Inomjon is optimistic that his venture will be successful and all his efforts will improve the family’s welfare.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor A. M. habita en el Municipio de San Marcos, del Departamento de Carazo, pero labora en la empresa ENACAL en Masaya desde hace nueve años como Lector, una labor que arduamente la realiza en el día a día, es acompañado tiene tres personas a su cargo.

Sus intereses que tiene es de proporcionarle lo mejor a su familia, pero para lograr eso este señor quiere cancelar unas pequeñas deudas que posee, por eso el está visitando las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y con esto lograr cancelar unos pequeños gastos personales que había realizado.

Cabe mencionar que este señor considera que saliendo de estas pequeñas deudas podrá sentirme libre para poder invertir más en su familiar y en el bienestar de los mismos.
texts.en:
Sr. A. M. lives in the town of San Marcos in the Department of Carazo, but he works in Masaya for the company ENACAL where he has been employed nine years as a meter reader. He works hard at his job day after day. José lives with three people who are under his care.

His interests include providing the best for his family, but in order to accomplish this he wants to pay off a few small debts that he accumulated. For this reason, José decided to visit the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he could pay off these personal debts.

It should be mentioned that Sr. José says the repayment of these debts will give him the freedom to invest more in his family and their welfare.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Zulma Iraday

texts.es:
Zulma es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudio educación superior. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de lentes de contacto.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez docenas de lentes. Trabaja sola en una tienda y su esposo también vende lentes en  otro puesto.
Su sueño es poner una cadena de ópticas que le permita generar más ingresos.	
Le que gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que le brindan los préstamos.
texts.en:
Zulma is a member of the “Inka Wasi” communal bank located in Puno district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children; she finished higher education.

She has been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her contact lens business.

She will use this new 700 new sol loan to buy ten dozen lenses.  She works alone in a store and her husband also sells glasses in a different stall.

Her dream is to set up a chain of optician shops that will allow her to earn more income.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the ease with which they grant loans.

loans.use: To buy ten dozen contact lenses.

loans.name: 'nee & Nah' Group

texts.en:
Neetu D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers, called 'Nee & N.'. She is 33 years old, married and has four children who are between the ages of 9-months to 9 years. She is a sophomore college student. 

For 7 years, she has been selling dishes (breakable and unbreakable bowls) in Duala Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar loan to buy more dishes and bowls to resell. 
She describes herself as a jovial woman whose dreams are to grow her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more dishes (breakable and unbreakable bowls) to resell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 23 años de edad, y vive con su familia en un caserío del distrito de Tambogrande ubicado en el departamento de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Maribel  se dedica a la venta de comida y elaboración de chicha de jora a base de harina de maíz. Tiene una antigüedad de más de 5 años en su negocio ubicado en su casa, y por el trato tan amable que brinda cuenta a la fecha con una clientela fidelizada.  Ella quiere mejorar los ambientes donde ella vende la comida y la chicha, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maribel is 23 years old and she lives with her family in a community in the district of Tambogrande, located in the department of Piura. It is 4 hours from Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

Maribel sells prepared foods and she makes the traditional drink called chicha de jora, made from corn flour. She has had 5 years in the business and her business is located in her house.  And for the excellent customer service she has a loyal client base. She wants to improve the space where she sells her foods and chicha drinks. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1000 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to improve the space where she sells her foods and drinks.

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yelen, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les femmes du groupe Yelen sont à leur premier prêt solidaire et font le commerce de condiments, du bétail et du savon.                                                                                                                               TAYE F. compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs au niveau de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Yelen group are all married and average 40 years of age and three children. They all live in extended traditional families in Tomba, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. The women of the Yelen group are seeking their first group loan and trade in food condiments, livestock, and soap.

TAYE F. intends to buy food condiments from resellers in Dioïla. She sells in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be used to repay the loan and pay her contributions to social ceremonies, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y el crédito lo necesita para  aumentar la mercadería al por mayor, como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos, cereales etc., para mejorar su margen de ganancia y así podrá equipar su tienda con mas productos. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Urb. Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada  tiene tres  hijos.
texts.en:
María Elena sells basic need items and needs the loan to buy more stock items at wholesale like: rice, sugar, noodles, cereals, etc. to improve her profit margin and stock her store with more products.

She lives in her own house located in El Alto’s Urbanización Mercurio zone.  She’s married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang D., 48, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. Besides those sectors, she also provides a rice hulling service inside her home to her neighbors. She is a widowed mother who has five children. Four of her children are single, while the other one is married and lives separately. Two children are employed in a garment factory as workers. 

Unfortunately, the hulling machine has often broken down while providing service. Because of this problem, Seang D. would like a loan to repair her hulling machine and buy rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.use: to repair her hulling machine and buy rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carmelita works hard to support her family. She has a recycling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of scrap for her recycling business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana Luz es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos.  La señora estudio hasta 4to de educación primaria.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos, ovinos y a la chacra (cosecha de papa, quinua, habas, cebada) luego los vende en la localidad de Ilave, también cuenta que su esposo es músico y viaja a diferentes lugares,  pero la ayuda en su tiempo libre.
Está trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo,  su préstamo anterior fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio para comprar ganados.
En la actualidad solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementará al capital  de su negocio para luego comprar una vaca lechera.
Su sueño es crecer y tener ganados mejorados.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana Luz is a member of the “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Ana Luz buys and sells cows and sheep.  She also grows potatoes, quinoa, beans and barley which she then sells in the town of Ilave.  She tells us that her husband is a musician and travels to different places but he helps her in his spare time.

Ana Luz has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle.  Her previous loan was for 500 Peruvian soles.  That money increased her business capital for buying cattle.

Ana Luz is currently requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which will increase her business capital so that she can buy a dairy cow.  Her dream is to grow in her business and make better profits.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Merlinda has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses & beauty products. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON

loans.name: Loic

texts.en: Loic is a business men .she have 3 children on of the 2 are school goer.Her husband is a driver and part time look after her wife's business.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with five children; three of her children attend school while two are still too young. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, Kwekwe has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of the increase in prices of goods at the market when there is food shortage. Kwekwe dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.
With the loan of 5,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sweet potatoes and open a retail shop business. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweet potatoes, and open a retail shop business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, age 30 and unmarried, is a farmer in his home area of Muranga, central Kenya, producing horticultural products, milk, and coffee.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a motorcycle, which will help him venture into the transport business. He says this will improve his income due to cheaper delivery of his own produce to the market, unlike when transportation is offered by other parties.

Alex says fluctuation in prices remains a challenge to local farmers, and general knowledge in farming remains a challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for better delivery of his produce

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 26 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She earns a living by selling goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on. This is her second successful year in this business. Her business is well organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her. 

Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on for resale. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business, and renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell, such as lotions, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de mariscos. Vende pescados y camarones a sus vecinos y conocidos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso desea mejorar su estilo de vida vendiendo mas mariscos. 

Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales tres sol mayores de edad y los otros estudian su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares ya que es maestro albañil. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en el futuro por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para su casa como zinc, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 44 years old and works hard at her job as a seafood vendor. She sells fish and shrimp to her neighbors and acquaintances. Alexandra works from 7am to 12pm every day. She has many aspirations for her business, such as selling more seafood in order to improve her lifestyle.

Alexandra has six children, three of whom are adults while the rest are in school. Her husband helps with the family expenses through his job as a master stonemason. Alexandra has many aspirations for the future, so she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials for her home such as zinc, cement, and other items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home such as zinc, cement, and other items.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, D. 55 años es madre D. 3 hijos D. los cuales solo dos viven con ella junto a sus dos nietos, yernos y su pareja en una casa propia. Elvira tiene un trabajo muy lindo como ella lo considera, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y bebidas en su pequeña pero muy surtida tienda que esta en su casa, lleva en este trabajo ya casi 25 años, llego desD. San Martín en busca D. un mejor futuro en esta tierra colorada, le fue bien hasta ahora ya que siempre trabajó en su bodega y como nos menciona gracias al trabajo D. su pareja y el esfuerzo D. ella pudo lograr construir su casa y darles un lugar digno en donD. vivir a sus hijos. Lo que mas le gusta D. su trabajo es que siempre hay movimiento, lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces se van algunas personas a querer sacar productos al crédito y demoran en cancelar. Ella espera más adelante poder hacer crecer su bodega, hasta ahora no lo ha hecho porque siempre ha utilizado las ganancias para hacer crecer su casa. Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene, sin emabrgo esta un poco desconforme con su grupo ya que algunos no pagan a tiempo, pero al final siempre terminan cancelando. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará productos y bebidas para abastecer su tienda, espera poder continuar trabajando con la institución ya que agradece el monto dado por el bajo interés que dan.
texts.en:
Elvira, 55 years old, has three children. Only two of them still live with her, her two grandchildren, her in-laws and her husband in their own house.

Elvira thinks she has a very nice job. She sells groceries and drinks in her small but very well-stocked store, which is in her house. She has been in this job for almost 25 years. She came from San Martín looking for a better future in this red land, and it has gone well for her up to now since she has always worked in her store, and as she has mentioned to us, thanks to her husband's work and her own effort she has been able to build them a house and give them a decent place to live with their children.

What Elvira likes most about her work is that there is always some movement. What she does not like is that often some people come who want to buy products on credit and who are late in paying off their bill.

She hopes that later she will be able to expand her store. She has not done it yet because she has always used her earnings to expand her house.

This is Elvira's third loan with MFP. She is a little dissatisfied with her group because some of them do not pay on time. In the end they always end up paying, but sometimes they get behind. With the 1000 soles she asked for, Elvira will buy groceries and drinks so she can keep doing her work. She hopes to continue working with the institution since she is grateful for the amount they have lent her and for the low interest rates they offer.

loans.use: to buy groceries and drinks so she can keep doing her work.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 44 years old and married with six children, living in his own house in Masindi, Uganda. He dreams of educating all his children to higher levels of education. Moses operates a butcher shop and he has been in the business for three years. Moses started by working for someone and after accumulating enough savings from his wages, he started his own. Hardships in the business include delays in payment by some debtors and his dream is to set up a meat processing plant. Moses needs the loan to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad, age 49, has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow-house where he breeds calves. He has a secondary education, but because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. He and his wife have four children. 
 
Mahammad buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. In this way, he provides the markets with meat and his own family with the necessary food for their subsistence. 

In order to buy three additional young cattle, Mahammad has decided to apply for a loan. He is very grateful to all those who can support him.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Nasibahon's Group

texts.en: Nasibahon is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a driver, whose monthly salary is 3000 soms. Together with her husband, she has raised a son, who is 25 and works in construction. In 1994, Nasibahon purchased a piece of land, where she cultivates wheat and cotton. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns money for a livelihood. In this way she earns about 3,000 soms per month; this profit made it possible to repair the house and to purchase two cows for breeding. With money received from the loan, Nasibahon wants to purchase 200 kg of mineral fertilizers. In the near future, she plans to build a sauna. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег работает на центральном рынке города Бердянска. Он занимается цветами и держит свой цветочный павильон в цветочном рядку на этом рынке. Олег женат, у него две взрослых дочери. У бизнеса Олега есть основное преимущество: он предлагает большой выбор цветов по минимальной цене по сравнению с конкурентами соседями по рынку. На данный момент оборотный капитал Олега составляет 25 000 гривен. 

Олегу необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить оптом живые цветы и комнатные растения на продажу, а также сопутствующие товары. Получение кредита благотворным образом отразится на бизнесе клиента, так как клиент, закупив цветы, сможет увеличить оборотные средства и таким образом сможет привлечь свободные денежные средства для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oleg works on the central market of the city of Berdyansk. He is in the flower business and has own flower pavilion in the flower aisle on the market. Oleg is married and has two adult daughters. Oleg's business has a big advantage: he offers a large variety of flowers at a minimal price in comparison with the competing neighbors on the market. At this time Oleg's working capital is 25,000 hryvna.

Oleg needs a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy live flowers and house plants in wholesale for resale as well as related merchandise. This loan will make a positive impact on his business because by purchasing the flowers he will be able to increase the working capital and this way free up some cash for further growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh flowers and house plants in wholesale for resale, as well as related goods.

loans.name: Moses Nyerere

texts.en: Moses is a single man. He describes himself to be quiet, humble, and persuasive. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will start a car hire service business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rebie

texts.en:
Rebie is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married, with three school-aged children.

Rebie has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business for over 10 years, earning approximately 1,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for maintenance and repairs for the motorcycle.

In 2010, Rebie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
A talented and caring lady, Razia operates a grocery store at her home to supplement the income for her family. She sells through her store edible items for children like chips and biscuits, and spices, lentils and cooking oil to her community clients. Her talent in dealing and reasonable rates attract clients to her store to buy products.

Her husband operates a local food business. He sells Samosay and Pakoray (a popular food items made with gram flour and filled with spices and potatoes). The taste of his products is very good and he makes good profits every month.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as gram floor, cooking oil, potatoes and spices in bulk quantity that will allow him to earn better profits from his business. He has been operating his business for past many years and Razia is hopeful about his business success as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for a local food business.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 41 years old and is married with one child. Marthe owns a boutique where she sells cooking oil, biscuits, water, soft drinks etc. Her business is well known and well organized. She has two years of experience in this business. She currently employs one person to help her and the hours of her business are from 8am to 8pm during the week but not on the weekend.

Marthe has requested loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, biscuits, water, soft drinks etc to sell. With any profit, she will be able to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, biscuits, water, soft drinks, etc to sell.

loans.name: Awak

texts.en:
Awak is a 30-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a grocery store in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Awak requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, salt and onions. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and onions to sell.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en: Ms. Thiet is 38 years old with three children who are of school age. She  has a shop selling rice. She started this business ten years ago and can earn a stable income from it. She used her previous loans to buy more raw rice seed to store and produce rice. Currently, she wants to buy more rice to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more rice to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро готовит и продает пирожки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 13 лет. Ей 50 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Зухро берет кредит для покупки продуктов и муки. Она хочет печь самбусу и пироги для торговли.
texts.en:
Zuhro bakes and sells pies. She has been engaged in this activity for 13 years. She is 50 years old and a widow. She has two children.

Zuhro takes a loan for the purchase of foodstuffs and flour. She wants to bake pastry and pies for sale.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and flour for baking and selling pies

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
Anam is a 44 year old married woman who supports 3 family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to buy a new furniture such as a guest room. She would like to create comfortable space for her family.
Anam is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her brother

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a veteran with a lot of experience in the field. He is humble and simple and is very friendly with people. He has great energy to develop any crop that needs production. He is a mixed farmer who hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya. This area is popular for dairy and maize farming. The most common crops in this area are fodder (to feed cows to produce milk) and maize to prepare Ugali “hard porridge”. 

Richard, who has been farming for the last seven years, keeps cattle, poultry and trees on his piece of land. He is seeking a loan for purchasing a chaff cutter. Dairy cows prefer their fodder cut into pieces of a certain size. Not so big that it is hard to digest and not so small that it is not "fun" to chew. A chaff cutter solves this problem perfectly. Electrically operated, a chaff cutting machine chops fodder into small, even pieces that the cows will enjoy chewing. The other advantage of the machine is that different grasses can be fed into it to achieve a desired feed ration. This creates mixtures that lead to higher milk production, since the cows cannot select what to eat and what not to. The increase in income from this asset will uplift the livelihood of Richard's family. Support a humble farmer so that he can develop his dairy farming with a loan!

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Yao Adjété

texts.en:
Mr. N. Yao Adjété was bon in 1954, he is father of four (04) children born to different mothers and is in charge of eleven (11), other children. As a volunteer school teacher, he earns a miserable and irregular salary, and as a result, his life is miserable. After his marital mishaps, he pulled himself together and currently shares his life with only one woman in his village “Alinka”. The village currently suffers from lack of clean water chiefly during the dry season where water becomes a scarce commodity. Women and children go a long way to buy water. He is very dynamic and sociable, and as the president of the village development committee (CVD), he had the idea of initiating a drilling to help the population find potable water in the village. The ever growing density of the local population fostered the profitability of the project. The rigorous sense of management shown by Mr. N. with his (03) credits which he promptly reimbursed allowed us to believe in his abilities to succeeded in this ambitious and humanitarian project. On that purpose, he applied for a credit of $2,000 that will allow realising the drilling from which the water will be sold to the population. Note that in Togo, water is not free of charge. It is sold and at a high price in places where it is scarce.

Monsieur N. Yao Adjété, né en 1954, il est père de quatre (04) enfants de mère différente et a à sa charge onze (11) autres personnes. Enseignant volontaire avec un salaire minable et irrégulier, il mène une vie de misère. Après ses mésaventures conjugales, il s’est ressaisi et vit aujourd’hui avec une seule femme dans son village natal « Alinka ». Ledit village souffre terriblement de problèmes d’eau potable, surtout pendant la saison sèche où l’eau devient une denrée très rare et très cher. Les bonnes femmes et les enfants parcourent de longue distance pour aller payer de l’eau. Très dynamique et sociable, et en sa qualité de président du comité villageois de développement (CVD), il eut l’idée d’initier un forage pour aider la population à trouver de l’eau potable sur place dans le village. La densité de la population sans cesse croissante dans cette localité favorise la rentabilité de ce projet. La gestion rigoureuse dont Monsieur N. a toujours fait preuve à travers ses trois (03) crédits reçus et remboursés promptement permet de croire à la réussite de ce projet ambitieux et humanitaire. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $2000 qui servira à faire le forage dont l’eau sera vendue à la population. Il faut préciser qu’au Togo, l’eau n’est pas gratuite. Elle se vend, et encore très chère dans les localités où il en manque cruellement.

loans.use: To buld the drilling

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Jose Ernesto Z., 45 years of age and married, is a native of Homoine, Inhambane province. Due to an early marriage, he never attended school beyond the 7th grade. Once he discontinued his studies, he began to work for a civil construction company to help confront the great challenge of being a father at the young age of 16. Months later, once his contract ended, he started an unsuccessful firewood cutting business. He started selling cow’s milk and raising chickens, an activity he continues to this day. Through conversations with friends he learned of Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who he became acquainted with and solicited a loan for the purchase of egg-laying hens. His income helps him support familial expenses, and his children’s educational and health expenses, as well as invest in the construction of his house. With this loan he intends to buy hens to supply the market of Boane with fresh eggs, as well as sell chickens and milk. His business’ impact on the community is a positive one because beyond providing employment for himself, his wife, and children, he also plays an important part in the supply of animal protein, calcium and other vitamins derived from cow’s milk, thus contributing to the essential nourishment of the community. His future goals include expanding his business and diversifying his products.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

José Ernesto Z., de 45 anos de idade, casado, natural de Homoine, provincial de Inhambane. Devido ao casamento precoce não estudou para alem da 7ª classe, logo deixou de estudar e começou a trabalhar numa empresa de construção civil, para conseguir enfrentar o grande desafio de ser pai com idade menor de 16 anos. Meses depois, findo o contrato de trabalho, pensou e fez numa actividade de corte de lenha e, segundo conta, não teve sucesso. Começou a vender leite de vaca e a criar frangos de corte, actividaes que exerce ate hoje . Através de conversas com amigos soube da existência da Hluvuku- Adsema , aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo para compra de galinha poedeiras de ovos. Com os rendimentos suporta as despensas familiares, investe na ampliação da sua casa, despesas de Saúde, Educação para os filhos. Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar poedeiras para poder abastecer o mercado de boane com ovos frescos, para além da venda frangos e leite que já exerce actualmente. A actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais a sua esposa e filhos, desempenha um papel importante no fornecimento de proteína animal, cálcio e outras vitaminas provenientes de leite de vaca contribuindo para a segurança alimentar e Nutrição da comunidade. Tem como perspectiva, fazer crescer o negócio cada vez mais, diversificando os produtos.

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan was born in 1978 in the village of Yenikand in the Salyan region. He is married and has 2 children. 
Ruslan started a business raising calves 3 years ago.
He is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a pregnant cow to enlarge his herd.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is 71 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer seeding sugarcane. She will invest the loan to set up a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the group “Flor de Caña 1”. The other group members are: Mrs. Graciela Candelaria Alvarez (who sells clothing that she buys in Comitan), and Mrs. Luz Angelina Arguello (grocery store). With the loan the want to buy merchandise in sufficient quantities to stock their businesses for a long time, and this way increase their profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

MARIA DEL CARMEN TIENE 71 AÑOS , CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA SIEMBRA DE LA CAÑA , ELLA INVERTIRA SU PRESTAMO COLOCANDO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 1 LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : DOÑA GRACIELA CANDELARIA ALVAREZ ( VENDE ROPA QUE COMPRA EN COMITAN ) Y DOÑA LUZ ANGELINA ARGUELLO (TIENDA DE ABARROTES )CON SU PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR MERCADERIA EN CANTIDADES SUFICIENTE COMO PARA ABASTECER SUS NEGOCIOS POR UN LARGO TIEMPO Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS .

loans.use: to increase their stock

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim S. M. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 3 school-aged children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To support her family, Mrs. S. M. sells live fish in her community, which enables her to generate around $5 in income each day. Her husband is a worker and makes only $2.50 each day.

This loan is vitally necessary to them and will be used to expand Mrs. S. M.'s fish-selling business as well as to fix their house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season.

(This is a picture of her husband because Mrs. S. M. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To expand her business and also to fix her house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
9 years ago Doña Aracelly started a family business selling food among friends and neighbors and with a lot of effort she saved enough money to buy a small car and 3 years ago she obtained her own stand at the municipal market which has provided her with a higher income to maintain and pay the cost of her daughters' schooling.

But today she is in need of money to buy supplies to make her business grow as the expenses for education have been growing. Doña Aracelly is asking for a loan of $475 to be able to meet the expenses of her business. She plans to repay in 5 months and the loan will be used to buy meat and supplies to prepare the "carnitas" dishes. With your support Doña Aracelly can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. Aracelly empezó de manera familiar hace 9 años vendiendo comidas entre conocidos y vecinos, con mucho esfuerzo logró ahorrar para comprar un carrito y hace 3 años logró obtener su propio puesto en el mercado municipal, lo cual le permitió tener un ingreso mejor para poder mantener y costear los estudios de sus hijas.

Pero hoy está necesitando dinero para poder comprar insumos para poder sacar adelante el negocio. Puesto que los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos le está exigiendo muchos gastos. Aracelly está solicitando un crédito para poder solventar los gastos del negocio. Aracelly solicita un préstamo de US $475 y está dispuesta a pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 5 meses, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar carne e insumos para elaborar las carnitas. Con tu ayuda Aracelly podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare food to sell at market stand

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith is a hard working woman. Everyday she puts a lot of effort into her work. She works for the better of her eight year old daughter. Her daughter is her reason to live. These immense gains of progress motivate her to work in two establishments of sales. In one of them she sells gelatin. This way she administers her small store. Her mother was the former owner, but since then Edith had to take over because of her mother’s serious illness. This way she helps the economy in her household. Everyday she is available early in the morning dedicating herself to her daily labor. With her money she helps pay for her families necessities. She likes to establish trust with her customers and maintain good personal relationships, and this is why her store has grown enormously in spite of not being in a central location. Edith wants a loan for her inventory, this way she can help pay off her beloved mother’s medical bill.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Edith, es muy trabajadora y empeñosa día a día se esfuerza para trabajar en bien de su hija de ocho años que es toda su razón de vivir, estas inmensas ganas de progreso la motivan a trabajar en dos establecimientos de ventas, en uno de ellos vende gelatinas y de manera adicional administra su pequeña tienda en casa que fue traspasada por su madre quien por motivos de salud no puede dedicarse a la atención de la demanda de su público y ahora ella sume con mucho agrado estos negocios para solventar la economía de su hogar.Cada día ella se dispone muy temprano a dedicarse a las labores cotidianas de su hogar para luego atender su tienda ya lleva dedicándose a esto cerca de dos años y se siente muy satisfecha de disponer del dinero de sus ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, a Edith le agrada tratar con las personas y brindar un trato que infunde confianza y buenas relaciones personales con sus clientes y es por ello que su pequeña bodega a crecido enormemente a pesar de no estar ubicado en un lugar céntrico, con esto nos demuestra una vez más que el trato amable es indispensable en la atención.Edith solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mercadería a fin de mejorar su tienda para ayudar con el tratamiento médico de su querida madre.

loans.use: Capital in order to acquire a greater quantity and variety of articles for her little shop.

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try S., age 24, runs a stand in front of primary school selling various kinds of biscuits and candies to students passing by, making around $1.50 each day of profit. She has four children, one who works with her husband repairing tires and the rest are students. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for improving her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for improving her business transportation.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.en:
The Nicaraguan handcrafts have always been in high demand both from Nicaraguans as well as foreigners. The city of Leon is known for selling these types of products and one of the vendors is Ms. Maria Nela R. whom with much effort had dedicated herself to selling these handcrafts in the main open-air market in Leon.

Every day, Ms. Maria R. is visited by people wanting to purchase her products and for this reason each day she makes the effort to bring her customers excellent products which reflect the Nicaraguan identity.

To improve her business, Ms. Maria R. had come to Ceprodel which has given her great assistance with granting 13 loans which were used to acquire handcrafts to sell. Her current need is to purchase more of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Las artesanías nicaragüenses siempre han sido productos muy demandados tanto por personas nacionales como extranjeros. La ciudad de León se caracteriza por comercializar estos productos y una de las comerciantes es la señora Maria Nela R. que con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a la venta de estas artesanías que las vende al aire libre en el mercado central de la ciudad de León.

Todos los días, la señora Maria R. es visitada por personas interesadas en las compra de los productos y por tal razón es que día a día se esfuerza para brindar a sus clientes eficientes productos que reflejan la identidad nicaragüense.

Para mejorar su negocio, la señora Maria R. ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un gran apoyo con la entrega de 13 créditos utilizados para la adquisición de las artesanías para luego vender estos productos. Su necesidad actual es la adquisición de tales productos.

loans.use: Purchase of handcrafts.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi Lua, 54 years old, currently live with her husband and two kids at Y Yen Disctric of Nam Dinh Province. Outside of farming, her other primary job is breeding pigs. Before joining the TYM group, her family's income was unstable and they encountered many difficulties, mainly due to the lack of capital to invest and expand their business. After joining the group, Mrs. Lua has take out loan to just focus on breeding pigs. She now have about 10 healthy pigs and her own income has reached 100 USD per month. In addition to that, her two childrens are working as building workers to help out their mother in weekly payment. Mrs. Lua just recently renew her pond and get into raising fishes. She currently need to take out a loan of 450 USD to buy more piglets and breeding fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu, 52 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 16 tuổi tại Yên Khang, ý Yên. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1997. Trong các năm tham gia Quỹ chị đều vay vốn ở mức tối đa sử dụng vào việc buôn bán than. Nơi chị sống là vùng ven bến sông thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán hàng hoá theo đường thủy. Hàng chị bán phục vụ cho nhân dân trong vùng và một số cở sở đốt gạch. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng mang lại cho gia đình một khoản thu nhập tương đối. Trung bình mỗi tháng gia đình chị Sáu thu 250USD. Than đang bán chạy nên chị Sáu vừa làm đơn xin vay 1200USD để tăng số lượng than xuất nhập.

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Sowra 2022-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret P.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a reporter over the radio.

Each week, Margret makes approximately 60 Sudanese pounds in profit, and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret is joined in her small group by Rejoice A., Regina Y., Joice I. and Anjelina D.. Rejoice A. has a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Regina Y. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Joice I. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Anjelina D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand the charcoal business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
26-year-old Maryam is a single mother taking care of one toddler. She owns a small clothing store in Zanzibar that was opened a year ago. She works from 9am to 6pm daily and is able to make a profit of about $180 per month from her sales.

Maryam hopes for a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She belongs to group Juhudi Iwepo, whose members guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her clothing shop

loans.name: Sikiratu

texts.en:
Sikiratu I. booming business shows that the financial help she has been receiving from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years has had great impact on her business and her family's lifestyle. She is 62 years old and married with four children. She sells fresh fish, a business she has been into since 1970. Sikiratu lives at Ajamgbadi in Lagos State Nigeria.

She is requesting for the loan amount of $1200 to buy more fresh fish for sale. She say thanks to all that makes the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Maribel Beatriz

texts.es:
Maribel is a woman dedicated to her work as a farmer. She grows potatoes, maize, and other seasonal products. The income from farming pays for the education of her son who lives in the city of Lima, where Maribel has sent him to benefit from its higher standard of education. As a result, Maribel has to make sacrifices in order to send money to her son, for which she is recognised as a hard-working and dedicated mother in her community.

Maribel needs to improve her farm’s crop yield but is unable to do so because of lack of capital. She hopes she can count on you.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel, es una mujer muy entregada a su labor como agricultora, ella produce papa, maíz y otros diversos productos que cultiva por temporadas. Gracias a esta actividad puede solventar los gastos de su hijo quien vive en la ciudad de Lima, donde Maribel lo envió para que logre una mejor preparación académica. Para esto, ella tiene que sacrificarse en sus chacras y lograr enviar la pensión de su hijo, y estos son los reconocimientos de doña Maribel en su comunidad, ser una madre abnegada y trabajadora. Ella necesita ahora mejorar sus cultivos con los insumos adecuados, pero no puede comprarlos porque esta pasando aprietos económicos, confía en poder contar con ustedes.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural products to increase crop yield

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy S. is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. Joy learnt this business for 6 months. She started her own business in 2005. Joy needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more provisions for re-sale. She is grateful to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Greetings from Chantal in Kicukiro, Rwanda! Chantal is 39 years old, married with 4 children and takes care of 2 adopted orphans. Chantal owns a hardware shop in Kicukiro center in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. She sells electric bulbs, paint, building nails, iron sheets for roofing, locks, and cement. She employs 3 people in the business. 

This client is requesting a loan worth 521 075 Frws to buy more items for her hardware shop because of the increasing number of customers.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es: Estefita a sus 28 años es madre de dos niños preciosos, y son la razón de seguir surgiendo en su negocio. Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, alquiló un local donde trabaja con su esposo Rodrigo, encargado de comprar la madera y de traerla a su local para que Estefita la venda, cuenta con una gran acogida, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar. Esta actividad la realiza desde ya hace mucho tiempo, a consecuencia de que su esposo tenía experiencia en ello desde muy joven, y es quien le brinda mucho apoyo. Solicita este préstamo porque se ha propuesto una meta, que es ampliar su negocio, así como también quiere comprar madera para almacenarla.
texts.en:
Estefita, at 28 years of age, is a mother to two precious children who are the reason to keep pushing with her business. She is dedicated to the buying and selling of wood. She rented a shop where she works with her husband, Rodrigo, who is in charge of purchasing wood and bringing it to the shop so that Estefita can sell it. They get a great reception since that are located in a good spot. They have already done this job for a long time since her husband has experience in this work since he was young. It is he who gives her a lot of support. She is requesting a loan since she has proposed a goal, which is to grow their business and also purchase wood for storing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business and acquire a greater quantity of wood.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo inicio hace cuatro años pero desde hace tres empezó en forma directa a vender, su meta es ser directora de ventas, pero tiene que empezar a recomendar gente para lograrlo por lo que se encuentra trabajando arduamente para lograrlo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertir y surtir mas, además porque esta planeando vender otras cosas para navidad sin descuidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aracely's occupation is the sale of beauty products through a catalogue. She started her business four years ago but it has only been three years that she has been a direct vendor. Her goal is to be the director of sales but she needs to first recommend a number of people before she can make that happen. She has been working tirelessly to achieve her goal.

She requires a loan in the amount of $550 US, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will invest the funds to increase her selection and because she plans on selling other items for Christmas and she wants to keep her business well looked after.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. 
Tiene 59 años, es casada y madre D. 07 hijos que ya formaron  sus familias, asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 01 año, su esposo se dedica  a reparar radios y televisores. Doña Petrona con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles deciD. invertir en la compra D. mercadería para su  pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. Tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Actualmente sigue vendiendo en su tiendita, ella abre todos los días, viaja a comprar sus productos a Desaguadero. 

Con el préstamo que recibirá D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara  arroz, azúcar, fideos y aceite.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona Q. D. C. is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz D. Cacorco" in the Copani district of Yunguyo-Puno province (Peru). She is 59 years old and married, with 7 grown children who have already started their own families. Mrs. Petrona attended a literacy program for 1 year. Her husband repairs radios and televisions for a living.

Mrs. Petrona decided to invest her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100) in buying merchandise for her small grocery store. She has been working with Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) for 5 years.

Mrs. Petrona continues to sell goods in her shop, which she opens daily. She travels to Desaguadero to buy her products. With the new loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) she receives, Mrs. Petrona will buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil. Mrs. Petrona will repay the loan in 4 installments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret, 28 years old and married to an engineer, has two children attending school. She is currently in the business of brewing local alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand the business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children through expansion of her business.

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Don Rubén desea adquirir un préstamo para poder pagar el hospital donde nació su hijo, ya que en ese momento no contaban con el dinero.
Él solicita este crédito para poder liquidar su adeudo con  la clínica en su totalidad. Planea sufragar la ayuda brindada con el ingreso de su trabajo ya que se dedica a la limpieza de terrenos en el vecino país.
Cuando se realizó la visita al domicilio del señor Rubén P. se encontraba trabajando, solo estaba su esposa la señora Karla Carolina Sosa quien fue la que nos atendió y aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Rubén wishes to acquire a loan in order to be able to pay the hospital where his son was born, because at the moment he doesn’t have the money to do so. He is asking for this loan to be able to totally clear his debt with the clinic. He plans to repay the help he received with the income from his job as he excavates land in a neighboring country. When we visited Mr. Rubén P. he was out working and only his wife Karla Carolina Sosa was home to meet with us and it is she who appears in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay medical expenses

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora K., 55, has six children, - three girls and three boys - the youngest of whom is in junior high school, while the rest are working, some as traders in the city and others as farmers. Living with the family in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small farming and commercial town not far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, Debora works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the family. She trades in bananas and oranges, a livelihood pursued by many women in the community.

Debra has been in business for 10 years, buying bags of oranges and bananas from farmers in the nearby villages, selling them to retailers in the local market after they have ripened. It has long been her dream to save enough money to support her children in school, so she is requesting a loan to procure bananas and oranges in bulk to increase her profit margin. She hopes to thereby help her youngest to further his education.

loans.use: To procure bananas and oranges.

loans.name: Nghia

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Nhân Nghĩa năm nay 30 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang kinh doanh và có nghề làm vòng hoa. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn gà để tăng thu nhập của gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị nghĩa đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm hoa phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Nhan Nghia is 30 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 2006. Currently, she and her husband have a business making and selling flower wreaths. In addition, they also raise pigs and chickens to supplement their income. With monthly income of 350 USD, her family's economic situation is becoming more stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to purchase additional flowers for her business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer que en su vida ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, a sus 50 años ha logrado tener su casa propia, en la cual vive sola, ya que nunca tuvo hijos con su pareja, D. la cual se divorció. Ella es una artesana muy hábil, utiliza la totora para crear piezas artesanales hermosas y llamativas, los cuales luego venD. a sus clientes a un buen precio, aunque no pudo terminar D. estudiar su primaria, por no contar con el dinero necesario, no se desanimó y siguió con sus planes D. tener una vida digna y conseguir las cosas que siempre soñó. Ha luchado mucho por forjarse una buena vida y sabe que todavía lo tiene que seguir haciendo, tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es que pueD. realizar diseños nuevos y creativos, lo cual hace que sus ventas mejoren, pero lo más difícil es realizarle los pequeños detalles a sus artesanías, para que se vean más bonitas. En el fututo espera tener una tienda donD. pueda vender sus artesanías con mayor comodidad y tranquilidad. Es el primer préstamo D. Maria con MFP y está muy feliz D. la oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre tiene un concejo para dar a las demás socias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más lana, alambres, adornitos, pintura, etc, para mejorar los diseños y la calidad D. sus piezas artesanales.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who has worked hard in her life to get ahead. At 50, she has managed to have her own house. She lives by herself since she never had children with her ex-husband, who she divorced. She is an adept artisan and utilizes the bulrush (a wetland plant) to create beautiful and striking artisanal pieces, which she sells to her customers at a good price. Although she did not finish primary education due to the lack of necessary funds, she was not discouraged. She followed her plans to have a dignified life and to continue with the things she has always dreamed of doing. She has fought hard to forge a good life. She knows that she still needs to continue making jewelry. She has spent 20 years in this business. What she likes the most is that she can make new, creative designs which result in improved sales. What she finds the most difficult is to make the small details to her pieces to make them more beautiful. In the future, she dreams of having her own store where she can sell her pieces with the most comfort and tranquility. It is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy for this opportunity. She understands that she must pay the loan on time and is determined to do so. The communal bank is very beloved, as it always provides council for the other members. With the money she requests, she will buy more wool, wire, ornaments, paint, etc. to improve her designs and the quality of her artisanal pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her artisanal pieces

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana es ama de casa la cual esta al cuidado de su familia, del hogar y de su esposo el señor Javier; que es empleado de una agencia aduanal en donde cuenta con una antigüedad de 12 años, demostrando una gran responsabilidad y un amor a su trabajo pero sobre todo la lealtad a su empresa. 
Ellos tienen un solo hijo; son una familia muy estable y unida que están tramitando este crédito para la remodelación de su recamara y la colocación del vitropiso en ella, para así tener una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Adriana is a housewife who takes care of her family, the home, and her husband Javier, who has been an employee of the customs agency for 12 years. He has shown great responsibility and love for his job, but above all, a loyalty to his company. They have one son. They are a stable and close knit family who are requesting this loan to remodel their bedroom and install stone flooring so that they can have a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel bedroom and install stone flooring

loans.name: Deny

texts.es:
La señora Deny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 546, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 52 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia emprendió su  negocio D. Venta D. Abarrotes, que desD. sus principios le dio buenos resultados, por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y al gusto del cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son moradores D. la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 que cancelará a un  plazo D. 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como sacos arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.
Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Señora Deny belongs to the communal bank "Mariscalense" and lives in the district of Juanjui in the department of San Martín. She lives with her boyfriend, is 52, and has 2 children who still are her dependents. With her first credit of 300 PEN, she started her business of selling groceries thorugh her own initiative. Since the beginning, this has given her good results because of the quality of her products, her reasonable prices, and her customer service. Currently she has her business in her own house. Her main clients are people who live in the community, her neighbors and friends. With this loan of 2,500 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase more products to supply her business such as sacks of rice and sugar, eggs, toiletries, cleaning products, soft drinks, candy, and other products to keep her clientele happy. Tody she feels very happy with her work and the service she offers and is thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes that they keep doing this for a long time and help a lot of families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of rice and sugar, eggs, toiletries, cleaning products, soft drinks, and candy

loans.name: Fakhra Ali Abbas Group

texts.en:
Fakhra baji is applying for a loan to buy medicines to increase the profit of her husband. Her husband, A. A., belongs to a medicine selling business. He has been selling medicines for the past five years. He buys medicines wholesale and supplies different medical stores. They live in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines.

Fakhra baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zubaida baji is requesting a loan to buy fruits to sell. Azra baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for a dairy business.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos  está solicitando  su 1er credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Pintar y repellar la cocina), trabaja en la corte suprema de Justicia desde hace 3 años, no tiene hijos pero se encarga del cuido de su ancianita mama y de los gastos del hogar,  es un  joven humilde, responsable, honesto, trabajador  y muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y su comunidad, actualmente esta estudiando su 1er año en la universidad Martin Lutero,  este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 2 años y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, vive en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población, su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda para asi tener mejor comodidad y vivir en un ambiente agradable , seguir estudiando para llegar a ser un excelente profesional, estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is requesting his first loan to invest in home improvements (to paint and re-plaster the kitchen). He has worked for the Supreme Court for the past 3 years, and does not have any children, but is in charge of caring for his elderly mother and household expenses. He is a humble young man, responsible, honest, hard working, and very loved by his work peers and community. Currently he is in his 1st year at the Martin Lutero University. He plans on improving his housing little by little and lives in a neighborhood where every day he sees the population increasing. His dreams are to improve his housing and in that way live more comfortably and in a pleasant environment, to continue studying to become an excellent professional, and to have job and health stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint and re-plaster the kitchen.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice B. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through senior high. Alice sells a variety of cosmetics and clothing at Melcom in Hohoe, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader who earns little from his trading activities.

With the high demand for Alice’s cosmetics, she will use the loan to buy a variety of cosmetics and clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn V. is a 26-year-old handicraft maker who stays at home to weave bamboo for baskets for sale. She also boils corn to sell to her neighbors in the village for daily profit. She is married to Vann Veasna, 26, who sells fresh clams in the market to earn a living. Beside their current work, they have always cultivated a rice crop. Khorn V. has given birth to two kids who are still minors and enrolled in school. Due to the cost of clams is commanding cheapest price. Khorn V. is looking for a loan for capital in order to purchase clams for her husband to sell. She will use some of the loan to grow her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase clams for her husband to sell

loans.name: Patricia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Patricia de los Ángeles P. M. tiene 33 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que depende de ella. Patricia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una mujer que piensa en el futuro, por lo que sus esposo labora como docente, el imparte clases en las modalidades nocturnas, ya que los dos son personas que les gusta trabajar para proporcionarle a su hijo lo más importante. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo, con el dinero podrá comprar productos como pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, perfumes, colonias, talcos y cremas. Patricia tiene como aspiración proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda y que su hijo logre finalizar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Patricia de los Ángeles P. M. is 33 years old, married and the mother of a son for whom she cares. Patricia has been selling cosmetics for over 11 years. She is a woman who believes in her future. Her husband is a teacher and gives evening classes. Both like to work and provide for all the needs of their child.

Patricia applied for this loan to increase her working capital. She will use the money to buy various cosmetics such as nail polish, lipsticks, perfume, eau de cologne, talcum powder and creams. Patricia's goal is to improve her home and ensure the professional success of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es: Doña Iccel Amanda de 30 años de edad,  reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, tiene una pulpería donde vende variedad de productos, este negocio lo inicio con ahorros y prestamos que hizo en Afodenic es su sexto ciclo y se siente sastifecha ya que ha logrado aumentar su negocio y tener un mejor  inventario. Tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, su esposo le ayuda administrar su negocio. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer su cocina y poder tener mejores condiciones. Sus planes a futuro es poder seguir incrementando su negocio y hacerlo una distribuidora. Da las gracias ala institución por los logros en su vida personal el cual ha beneficiado e su familia.
texts.en:
Iccel Amanda is 30 years old, and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She has a small grocery store where she sells a variety of products. She started this business with her savings and with loans she received from Kiva partner Afodenic. This is her sixth loan cycle, and she is happy because she has been able to increase her business and improve her inventory. Iccel Amanda has a 4-year-old son, and her husband helps her manage her business. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials for building a kitchen, which will improve her family’s standard of living. Her plan for the future is to continue increasing her business and become a wholesale distributor. She thanks the Afodenic organization for her personal achievements, which have been of great benefit to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for building a kitchen

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May L. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. May is married. May owns & operates a business venture selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. May has been in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 1,980.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, May joined PMPC to help improve her living situation by gainning access to financial services and capital. May is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by May from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nueva Luz” esta representado por el señor Francisco y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando juntos su tercer ciclo demostrando unidad, honestidad y ganas de sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios. Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de tarjetas Viva Entel por mayor y mayor,  alguna de ellas venden ropa americanas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de juguetes, salteñas, elaboración de prendas de vestir y pintura de viviendas. La competencia dentro de su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando capacidad para administrar sus recursos y ganas de trabajar como el hecho de hacer macitas y venderlas para recaudar fondos para su caja chica, son muy organizadas y muy trabajadoras.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Luz” (“New Light”) group has 12 members and is represented by Francisco. The group is in its third loan cycle and its members have demonstrated unity, honesty, and the desire to advance their small businesses. The members of the group have various businesses, which include selling Viva and Entel cellular phone cards, clothing from the United States, and “salteñas” (a Bolivian savory pastry). Other members own neighborhood grocery stores, make clothing, and paint houses. Each of the members of the group is very competent in their field and because of this they know how to advance in their chosen businesses.

This loan will be used to develop their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to increase their earnings. This will enable them to provide a better quality of life for their families.

The group is in its third loan cycle with this lending institution and has proven its capacity to administer its resources and the desire to work hard. For example, they made and sold pastries to raise money for a petty cash fund. They are very organized and very hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Carlos Manuel C. se ha destacado desde hace varios años en el negocio de sastrería teniéndolo en su propio establecimiento donde brinda el servicio a sus clientes que le visitan. Es un buen sastre con amplio conocimiento en el ramo y esto lo hace ser muy reconocido en su localidad.

La necesidad que atraviesa es la de obtener el crédito a lo inmediato para la compra de tela, hilos, tizas y reparación de maquinas de coser para continuar en su negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de trabajo

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora sells provisions and foodstuff. She is 55 years old and married with seven children. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more provisions and foodstuff. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
N. Jesca is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted 32 year old lady. She married with 6 children, who are between six and eighteen years old; additionally, she takes care of her parents.

Jesca is a business lady involved in the sale of agricultural produce. She has done this for 5 years now. Although she is able to make 100,000 a week, she is faced with significant challenges, such as competition from other farmers and the scarcity of produce (especially during some seasons). Jesca is grateful to those who have lent money to her, as the money has that enabled to buy more high quality produce. Jesca dreams of eventually having a wholesale shop and building houses for her children. Currently, however, she needs a loan to be able to recapitalize her business by buying more agricultural produce for resale.

loans.use: purchasing more agricultural products

loans.name: Siga Thioubou

texts.fr: Siga Thioubou D. est une femme mariée de 49 ans, mère de plus de 10 enfants. Elle travaille avec ses fils qui sont installés dans la capitale. Ils vendent divers produits alimentaires comme le haricot. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de soutenir ses enfants et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité.
texts.en:
