Siga Thioubou D. is 49 year old married woman and the mother of more than 10 children. She works with her children who are settled in the capital. They sell various foodstuffs like beans. This loan will enable her to strengthen her business in order to support her children and to improve their living conditions, health and schooling.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do petty trading of various foodstuffs

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en:
Chagchaadorj Juder is 53 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The oldest daughter of the five children is 17 years old and goes to Gurvan-Erdene University in the city and the other four children are high school students. Chagnaadorj's family moved to the capital city from Arhangai province 6 years ago, in search of a better life for his family and better business for himself. He owns a small old car that he uses as a taxi in the city. He also makes horse saddles from wood. He learned how to make horse saddle from his dad and his children help him in making various size saddles. His wife sells the saddle at the local market. He has been making saddles since 2003 and today it has grown into a family business in which almost all family members contribute in one way or another. He says that he would like to make his family business bigger and secure his children's future. He requests a loan to purchase saddle wood and other necessary materials for his saddle-making business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase saddle wood and other necessary materials

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. sells soft drinks and ice kenkey [a local cornmeal dish] at old post office near Abura.  Ernestina has received senior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. Ernestina has been selling minerals and ice kenkey since 2003. She supports her family by paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy kenkey and soft drinks for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build her personal house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy kenkey and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Eusebio tiene 58 años, es casado y tiene una hija pero es independiente. El socio educa a su nieta que tiene 20 años pues ella esta estudiando en un Institución privada. El socio trabaja como albañil. El socio Eusebio es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio tenia una pequeña chacra la cual la traspaso a su hija pero actualmente su hija necesita ayuda de su papá para construir pozos de irrigación. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para construir los pozos de irrigación para su chacra.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 58, married, and has one daughter who is independent. He is educating his 20 year old granddaughter. She goes to a private institution. He works as a bricklayer. He is from the city of Urubamba in the Cusco department. He belongs to the José Carlos Mariategui Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. He had a small farm, which he passed on to his daughter. His daughter currently needs his help to build wells for irrigation. He is an enterprising and hard-working father who gets his family ahead. He needs the loan to buy materials to build the wells for irrigation on his farm. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build irrigation wells for his farm

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita B. is from the village of Miaray in Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Julita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Julita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Julita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. Julita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Julita's 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Able Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Able group from the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva Lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 per member to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, make more sales, earn more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu K.. Mariatu was born in the small town of Yoni, in northern Sierra Leone. The 40-year-old is married to a professional worker and they have 4 children. Two of her children are in secondary school and two are in primary school. For many years now, Mariatu has been selling food at the market: fish, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, she will buy these foods wholesale for her business.

loans.use: Buy fish, margi, salt, and palm oil wholesale for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. sells provisions and cosmetics at Elmina. Janet has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. 

Janet has been selling provisions and cosmetics for some time now. She helps her husband pay school fees and utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy more provisions and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more provisions and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Elzevir

texts.en: Since Elzevir R. became a membership of ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, her performance in terms of repayment, attendance at the weekly meetings in the ASHI center and her business have been excellent. She is one of the most admired members of the institution for she has been able to sustain her business despite being poor. The love and support of her husband makes her feel inspired and complete as a woman, despite not having her own children. She has not felt bad and disappointed because of this, as she wants to be financially prepared before having her own child. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to grow her “sari-sari” (variety store) and to increase her profit. Once this has been done, she will have a child, and by then she will be able to support his needs and give him a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her "sari-sari" store.

loans.name: Nouboukpo

texts.en: Nouboukpo A. is married and has one child. He lives and works in Lomé, Togo, painting automobiles. He began this business in 2002 and is now asking for his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to purchase paint for the vehicles he paints for his customers. With your help, Mr. A. will be able to offer a wide selection of paints to his customers. It is with great hope that this loan will allow Mr. A.’s business to prosper and will help him support his family.

loans.use: Purchase of paint for vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring material to sell

loans.name: Mahmadnaib

texts.en:
H. Mahmadnaib is 37 years old. He has been selling different kinds of paints and other construction materials in the market for the past 10 years, during which time he has acquired the knowledge and skills required to open his store. Since he started his store, his clientele has increased thanks to his good service. He is requesting a loan of 2000 USD, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase his assortment of items for sale. With your help Mahmadnaib will get ahead.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy construction items for his store.

loans.name: Silvia Veronica

texts.es: La señora Silvia Verónica G. Chávez desde hace 6 años tiene una papelería y mercería llamada “Vero”, donde ofrece calidad y buen servicio a su clientela. Silvia es madre de 2 hijos por quienes  sale adelante. El negocio lo puso pensando en bienestar de la familia tanto económico como moral, pues prefiere darles una mejor atención a sus hijos y de la única manera es que ella este en su propia casa. Por eso pide el apoyo para poder surtir su negocio para seguir trabajando en el.
texts.en:
Silvia Verónica G. Chávez has had a store, Vero, selling paper and notions for six years. She offers her customers quality and good service. Silvia gets ahead for her two children. She established the business thinking of her family’s economic well-being as well as their morale. She prefers to give her children better attention, and the only way to do this is in her own house. That is why she is asking for help to be able to stock her business in order to keep working in it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eusebia Velazquez tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera, su vida es su negocio de Librería y Copetin que monto con mucho sacrificio hace ya 5 años, le ayuda su hermana con quien vive en el barrio centro donde tiene su comercio.
El local esta ubicado frente a un Colegio prestigioso de la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. 
Comenta que muchas veces por falta de capital no puede cumplir con la totalidad de la demanda de sus clientes.
La Sra. Eusebia recibio una promoción de la Fundación Paraguaya que otorga créditos a personas emprendedoras apoyando el trabajo, y le vino muy bien el ofrecimiento y solicito su crédito, agradeciendo la confianza hacia su persona y valorando la oportunidad que la Institución ofrece a gentes como ella.
Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de articulos de libreria como(cuaderno, bolígrafos, hojas)
texts.en:
Eusebia is 45 years old. She is single and her business, a bookstore which she began five years ago, is her life. Her sister helps her and lives in the same neighborhood where the shop is located. The location is across from a school in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She tells us that she is not always able to meet her customers’ needs, due to a lack of working capital. She received literature from Fundación Paraguaya, telling of the entrepreneur support programs and she liked the idea, so she requested a loan. She is grateful for the trust and values the opportunity that the institution has given her. She will use the money to buy bookstore items, such as notebooks and paper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Federico  Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Federico es de la compañía Calixtro de la ciudad de Carapeguá, cuenta con casa propia, y tiene un hijo.

 El cliente se dedica la zapatería hace más de cinco años, cuenta con clientela formada. Gracias a esta actividad pudo concretar muchos proyectos como la construcción de su casa y el mantener  a su familia. 

 Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de materia prima para la producción de calzados(cuero, tinta y clavos) y de esta forma aumentar su nivel de ingreso.
texts.en:
Federico lives in Calixtro in Carapeguá city. He has 1 son and owns his home. He has been a cobbler for more than 5 years and has a loyal customer base. Thanks to his work, he has been able to accomplish many things, like taking care of his family and building his home. Federico obtained a loan from our institution and used it to purchase raw materials for making shoes (leather, dye and nails), which has allowed him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather, shoe paint, and shoe nails.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old lady married to a businessman with two children aged 13 and 12. She lives with her family in Masindi, Uganda where she sells second-hand clothing. She has been in the business for one year. She started doing business selling juice, sugar, and airtime but she opted to change her business to clothing. She says changing business lines is not easy but she says she can cope because she feels good and she even says she plans to have a big clothing shop in the near future. 

This is Mariam’s first loan from HOFOKAM and the purpose of the loan for Mariam is to purchase used clothing to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Reine Djessougnon

texts.fr: T. Reine Djessougnon est née le 08 Novembre 1990 et vit depuis sa naissance à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Reine est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec elle. Reine est séparée de son mari. Ayant arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, Reine a appris ensuite la coiffure. Reine exerce cette activité depuis deux ans, ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d’assurer les diverses charges de ses enfants. Parallèlement, Reine vend dans son atelier des mèches et des produits pour cheveux. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Reine achète ses produits. Dans l’optique d’agrandir son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle par ses produits variés, Reine sollicite pour une première fois, de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Reine Djessougnon T. was born on November 1990; since birth, she has been living in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. Reine is the mother of two children who attend school and live with her. Reine is separated from her husband. After stopping her studies at the secondary level, she has learned the hairdresser’s trade. She has been in this trade for two years, and it allows her to provide for various needs of her children. In addition, she sells hair extensions and hair care products in her salon. She stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. With the view of expanding her business and to enlarger her customer based thanks to the diversity of her products, Reine is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hair dryers, hair extensions and hair care products

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, tiene 57 años, de su primer compromiso tuvo 6 hijos, quienes trabajan de manera independiente en la ciudad de Lima. Actualmente comparte su vida con Julio de 49 años, juntos tiene a su hijo Michael de 22 años, y viven en su casa propia, fabricado a base de madera. Hace más de dos años se dedica en la venta de comida en su restaurante ubicado en un espacio de sus casa, denominado cariñosamente “El Moreno”, también en las tardes prepara dulces y mazamorras que ofrece en la calle, además algunos días ayuda a su esposo con el cultivo de las plantaciones de palta, café y plátanos de la variedad isla, pues ambos llevan 19 años practicando en la agricultura. Ella, lo que más ama es cocinar y vender lo que prepara, ya que sus ganancias le permiten vivir cómodamente, por eso ahora quiere construir su casa de material noble,  ampliar su local, incrementar bebidas en su restaurante  y plantar más café y ser una reconocida e importante productora de estos granos, dentro de su zona. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta gustosa de continuar laborando en su banco comunal, porque está integrado por personas buenas, solidarias y muy cumplidas como ella. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de plátanos.
texts.en:
Felicia is 57 years old. She has 6 children from her first marriage, who are all working independently in the city of Lima. Currently, she is sharing her life with Julio, age 49, with whom she has a 22-year-old son, Michael. They live in their own house which is made of wood. For more than two years, Felicia has worked selling food in her restaurant located in a space in her house. The restaurant is affectionately called "El Moreno" ["Brown-Skinned Man"]. She also prepares sweets and mazamorras [corn puddings] in the evenings, which she offers on the street. In addition, some days she helps her husband cultivate his crops of avocado, coffee and bananas, since both of them have worked in agriculture for 19 years. What Felicia loves most is cooking and selling what she prepares, since her earnings allow the family to live comfortably. For that reason, she now wants to construct a house of solid materials, expand her restaurant, add beverages to her offerings, and plant more coffee so that she can become a recognized and significant producer of this crop in her area. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she is enthusiastic about continuing to work with her communal bank, because it is made up of good people who have a strong sense of solidarity and are very dependable, like she is. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy several sacks of fertilizer or compost which she will spread on her banana fields.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena M., age 36, owns and operates a general store in the village of Calamagui, San Paublo, where she sells a variety of different products. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Filomena joined ASKI last year in order to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Filomena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Filomena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. Filomena and her husband have three school-aged children.  

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio, se dedica a los trabajos de sastrería en su casa de habitación. Oficio que aprendió de joven desde hace más de 30 años con su papá, ya que una vez que se caso compro su máquina de coser e instalo su propio negocio de sastrería.  Con lo cual ha mantenido su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además de realizar otros trabajos por cuenta propia, siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Con este financiamiento comprara suficiente tela para atender a sus clientes, brindarle mejor servicio y obtener mejores ganancias. Con estas ganancias atenderá las necesidades del hogar y la familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio works as tailor from his home, a trade he learned as a young man more than 30 years ago while working with his father. After he married, he bought a sewing machine and started his own tailoring business. He has provided for his household and his children’s education as well as completed other jobs by himself. He always has proven to be a responsible person. With this loan, he will buy enough fabric to serve his customers, provide better service, and improve his earnings. With his earnings, he will meet the needs of both home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is a 44-year-old separated woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   abaca weaving, food vending and general store businesses.  She lives in Mantija 2, Mantija, Danao City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her abaca weaving, food vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500. Gemma is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she can use the money as additional working capital.  This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Gemma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

 About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma R. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Alma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishes to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kimyo

texts.en:
Kimyo sells women’s clothing in the local market. She is married with 4 children. She was forced to launch her business 15 years ago in order to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Kimyo is seeking a loan of 7500 Somoni to diversify her clothing merchandise. She believes the current loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase her selection of merchandise for the coming cold season. Kimyo realizes that at all stages in her business development it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to maintain a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina, Firdousi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To diversify her clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Geovin Andres

texts.es:
Geovin de 27 años, es carnicero en un mercado. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 3 años  en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

La mama de Geovin le enseño como atender el negocio de carnes y como comprarla a un bajo costo pero cuando ella se enfermo tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio de carnes para poder mantener a su mama. En la actualidad ya tiene 8 años con el puesto de carnes en el mercado, trabaja solo desde muy temprano cuando comprar la carne hasta que cierran el mercado la libra de carne la vende a $ 2.5, la libra de hueso a $ 1.00. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para tener un negocio muy grande de carnes pero para ello debe trabajar y tener capital por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo carnes y un congelador. En los próximos 5 años el quiere tener  un carro para poder transporta la carne con más facilidad.
texts.en: Geovin is 27 years old and works as a butcher in the market.  He lives with his wife and two children ages 9 and 3, in an urban area called Orquideas, which means Orchids.  The town was named for the discovery of its many orchids and you'll find a park full of the flowers there.   Geovin's mother taught him about the business and how to buy meat at the best prices.  When she became ill, Geovin took charge of the business.   He's been running the small butcher's shop for 8 years, working on his own from very early morning when he buys the meat, until the end of the day when the market closes.  Geovin aspires to grow his business into a large shop.  For that he not only needs to continue working hard, but also needs capital to invest.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, as well as a freezer.  In the next 5 years, he would like to be able to purchase a car so that he can transport the meat more easily.

loans.use: To purchase meat and a freezer to help grow his butcher business.

loans.name: Ligia Columbia

texts.es:
Ligia de 60 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Escogió tener una papelería ya que necesitaba tener una mejor viva económica para su familia. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar diversa papelería vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.00, plumas, lápices, papelería etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm por trabaja todos los días a esa hora ha podido surtir su negocio con juguetes y ropa.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería y otros artículos para su papelería. En el futuro quiere comprar un local en el centro de la ciudad para que sus ventas se eleven.
texts.en:
Ligia is 60 years old.  She has a small stationery store.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

Ligia chose to have a stationery store because she needed a better financial life for her family.  Little by little, with effort, she was able to buy products for her store, selling exercise books for $1.00, pens, pencils, stationery, etc.  She works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  By working these hours every day she has also been able to stock her business with toys and clothes.

Ligia will use her loan to buy exercise books, pens, stationery products and other articles for her store.  In the future, she would like to buy premises in the city center so that her sales will increase.

loans.use: To buy exercise books, pens

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte de carga y a la vez se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz y lo transporta a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y algunas provincia de Cusco como Urubamba, Ollantaytambo entre otros, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como fertilizantes, maíz, semillas y para el mantenimiento del carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the “Virgen Natividad” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Juan is 42 years old.  He is married and has 5 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his cargo transport business.  He also buys and sells corn which he transports to the city of Puerto Maldonado and some provinces of Cusco such as Urubamba and Ollantaytambo.  He works together with his wife.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his business such as fertilizer, corn and seeds.  He also needs to pay to have his car serviced.

Juan is happy to receive a loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business such as fertilizers, corn and seeds and to pay for his car to be serviced

loans.name: Aurora Lucrecia

texts.es:
Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “12 D. Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos (02 dependientes),  la señora realizó estudios D. educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda D. abarrotes, actualmente trabaja con fotografías, locutorios y fotocopias.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en materiales fotográficas, papel bond para trabajar en su negocio, etc.,  trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su sueño es poner un internet o un restaurant.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the "12 D. Agosto" community bank which is located in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.

Aurora is 48 years old, married and has five children (two of whom are still dependent).  She has an elementary school education.

Aurora has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles which she invested in her grocery store.  She currently works with photographs, telephone rental and photocopies.

Aurora is requesting a new loan for 600 Peruvian soles which she will invest in photographic materials, bond paper which she uses in her business, etc.  She works together with her husband.  Her dream is to set up an Internet café or a restaurant.  What she likes about her community bank is the unity and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy materials such as bond paper and photographic materials

loans.name: Bakhtiyar's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan is a very small country and airlines function only in a few cities, which means the majority of transportation is by land. Since it takes several hours to drive from one town to another, taxi driving is a way of earning money for thousands of men.

Bakhtiyar J. U., 20, is one of the members of this group. He’s a resident of a small town with a population of 16 000, called Toktogul. Bakhtiyar was not lucky enough to obtain a university education, so he had to search for a job right after his high school graduation. Cars have been his passion since early childhood. After getting his driver’s license, he decided that his favorite occupation, driving, could also be a good means of revenue. Bakhtiyar’s taxi route is between Toktogul-Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). He has acquired regular clients and drives up to 600 kilometers per route. Bakhtiyar sees his car as a main source of income, so he requested a loan in order to replace the engine and some parts. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital for a local store

loans.name: Fidela Erminia

texts.es:
Fidela es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos.  La señora estudio hasta 1ro de educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de pasamanería y telas.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cuatro cajas de cremas, colonias y otros productos.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener un carro para trabajar, actualmente trabaja con un triciclo el cual le facilita poder vender sus productos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamos y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the community bank "Inka Wasi" located in the district of Puno.  She is 42 years old and married with three children.  Fidela studied until the first year of primary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past three months. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, money she invested in her business selling braids and fabrics.  She is asking for a new loan of 500 nuevos soles, money she will use to buy four boxes of cremes, colognes, and other products.  She works together with her husband.

Her dream is to have a car for work.  Currently she is working with a tricycle, which helps her sell her products.  What she likes about her community bank is the facility of obtaining loans and their punctuality.

loans.use: Buying four boxes of cremes, colognes, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a motor for his maize mill

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene hijos mayores que ya son independientes. Vive con su esposa en el distrito de Chochope en el departamento de Lambayeque.
 
Gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Compró su mototaxi al contado usando sus ingresos de una cosecha de maíz que obtuvo de su terreno propio de agrícola. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de nuevas llantas y otros accesorios faltantes. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en su moto que se ha deteriorado debido al uso. Con las reparaciones, Juan puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos. 

Juan es muy trabajador y sigue incrementando su negocio. Ya que ha ahorrado su dinero y ahora piensa en comprarse otro vehículo para alquilarlo a otro conductor y conseguir mayores sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 51, is married and has children who are already adult and independent; he lives with his wife in Chochope District in Lambayeque Department.

He earns his livelihood providing public transportation services in his own mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport people inside it.  He paid cash for his mototaxi using income from corn crops he farmed in his own fields.  He’d like to use the loan to buy new tires and other needed accessories.  He also wants to do some repair work on his motorcycle because it’s having some problems due to heavy usage.  With these repairs, Juan will be able to maintain his motorcycle in better condition that will allow him to provide better customer service and increase his income.

Juan is very hard working and continues to increase his business.  Now that he’s saved some money he plans to buy a second vehicle to lease out to another driver thus increasing his income.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi and buy tires.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Teddy has a business selling tap water, which she has had for less than one year.

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay for the water bills. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Teddy hopes to become a nursery teacher.  

Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her manage to be self-employed and not relying on her parents.

loans.use: to purchase water for resale.

loans.name: José Nicolás

texts.es: José Nicolás P. O. es un joven de 31 años de edad, que vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de la edades de 1 a 9 años,  en  el barrio el Carmen de Galapa;  allí tiene su negocio llamado : “Textiles Gedeón”, mediante el cual se dedica a  la fabricación de hamacas, oficio aprendido cuando trabajó como empleado en una industria textil, donde adquirió gran experiencia, para un tiempo después independizarse y comprar maquinarias de segunda;  con sus utilidades José gradualmente ha mejorado su infraestructura, pero requiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para atender nuevos clientes;  su mercado está ubicado en las ciudades de Cartagena y Barraquilla, esta última donde es  más conocido porque allí está ubicado su taller; este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ella comprará materiales para la fabricación de hamacas que tiene encargadas, inversión que garantiza su éxito porque lo hace sobre pedidos y por su gran experiencia en el manejo de la clientela. Su sueño más adelante es convertirse en un exportador y aumentar cada día  el nivel de vida de su familia, mientras tanto sigue trabajando para ampliar sus ventas y aumentar su margen de rentabilidad que no es menor del 42%
texts.en:
José Nicolás P. O. is a young man who is 31 years of age.  He lives with his wife and three children who are the between the ages of 1 and 9.  They live in the neighborhood of El Carmen in southern Barranquilla.  There he has a business called “Textiles Gedeón” where he manufactures hammocks.  José learned this trade when he worked at a textile factory, a place where he gained a great deal of experience.  After some time José became independent and purchased secondhand equipment with his earnings.  He gradually improved his infrastructure, but he needs to increase his operating capital so that he can attract new customers.  His markets are in the cities of Cartagena and Barranquilla, with the latter being the location of his workshop.  

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He wants to buy materials for manufacturing hammocks that have been ordered.  This investment will guarantee his success because he will be able to complete his orders and create a good experience when managing his customers.  His dream later on is to become an exporter so that he can raise the standard of living for his family.  In the meantime, José is continually working to increase his sales and achieve a profit margin of no less than 42%.

loans.use: To purchase thread and yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 adult children.  Rebecca owns & operates a business selling fish in the market. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish and dried fish for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Asteria has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Asteria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear.

loans.name: Sodtsetseg

texts.en: Sodtsetseg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. All her children, one daughter and twins, go to a kindergarten and her husband works as a fireman. She manages a clothes trading business in her town. She started her business after conducting a PC game place for several years.  During her five years of business operation, she has gained much experience and built a strong customer base. She is a friendly woman who says, "I am happy to manage my own business, because I don’t have to ask someone to give me money." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her clothing trading business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn, age 36, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province.  She is a vendor who sells produce in the busy local market.  She sells a few kinds of vegetables and earns an average of $1.60 a day.  She is married to Mr. Van, 34, who is a construction worker, and they have been married for many years, but they still do not have a baby. 

Horn will be using the loan to buy a used motorbike to transport her vegetables to the market to sell so she won’t pay cash for a motor taxi. This can help her to decrease traveling expense.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike to transport her vegetables to the market for sale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children.

Khaled has had a food market since 2009; he sells cheese, juices, bread, daily use items, and dairy products. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator, a refrigerator and to make a ceiling for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life

loans.use: To buy a generator, a refrigerator and to make a ceiling for his market.

loans.name: Fasokounawolo I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Fasokounawolo I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans les familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SATA, qui est présidente du groupe et la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour, de sarclage, pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. SATA compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Fasokounawolo I are married women who average 45 years of age and 2 children. They all live in polygamous families in Koba, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are pearl millet, rice, and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, SATA, who is the group's president and the first one standing at the right (in the photo), intends to buy farm inputs and to pay for plowing and weeding in order to maintain about 0.7 hectare of pearl millet and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. SATA plans on making an average profit of about 70,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with seven family members. Four of his family members work.

In 2008, Atheer opened a store selling prayer beads, coffins and funeral supplies. He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation.His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to enlarge his store, to make an advertising lighting box and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge his store, to make an advertising light box and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Nyamirama Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Gone are those days when women were tied to only domestic work which did not have any economic value and were not even allowed in politics. The women’s movements that started in US way way back showed a great change sweeping across the entire world for women’s economic and political rights.

Presently, women have taken a center stage in the business world. In Uganda, women have actively taken important roles in the economic development of the country and the household incomes. 

A good example is a 36 year old Annet who manages a retail shop and a bar in Ntungamo. As the saying goes, ‘experience is the best teacher.' Experience has indeed taught Annet all the necessary skills for her business which she has handled for 2 decades. 

This hardworking and flexible business lady earns 50,000 Uganda shillings per week as profits from her business. She also practices agriculture as her other source of income and she stressed that she got the working capital to start up a retail shop and a bar from the sale of coffee. 

Her dream is to buy land in the near future. 

With this kiva loan, Annet plans to buy goods like soap, sugar, beans for resale at her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy goods like soap, sugar and beans for resale at her retail shop

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Isha.  She is married and has 3 children aged 1 month, and 10 and 14 years who are school-going children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her mother and her uncle and they help her with her business; the other one is her niece who lives with her to attend school in the city. 

 In 2000, Isha established her food business. She began her business because  as a teenager she usually accompanied her mother to sell at the market, and since then she became fond of doing business. After she left school, she began her own little business and has one till now.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. 

 Isha has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy eggs: 25 cartons @ Le210,000, vegetable oil:  100 gallons @ Le34,000 Maggi: 30 cartons @ Le150,000, and tinned tomatoes: 40 cartons @ Le40,000.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le1,250,000.  In the future, Isha plans to build a house and open a textile shop and support her children to get the best education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for eggs: 25 cartons @ Le210,000, vegetable oil: 100 gallons @ Le34,000, Maggi: 30 cartons @ Le150,000, and tinned tomatoes: 40 cartons @ Le40,000.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe WASSA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogames dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
WASSA fait le commerce de pagnes wax et de pagnes tissés traditionnellement. Elle est assise au milieu et compte acheter avec son  prêt,  25 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako auprès des grossistes et revend au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit payable hebdomadairement ou mensuellement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Wassa are mainly married women who are on average 30 years old with three children. They live in monogamous families in the city of Sikasso.
In order to satisfy customer demand, they are on their first loan with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso.
Wassa is in the trade of "Wax" and traditionally-woven cloth. She is sitting in the middle. With her loan, she is planning on purchasing 25 pieces of wax cloth from Bamako’s great market. She buys from wholesalers and retails at the great market in Sikasso and in family settings, to a clientele composed of men and women. She takes cash and sometimes offers credit with weekly or monthly payments.
She is counting on an average monthly benefit of 22,500 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, with the remainder going towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy "wax" cloth.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a caddie boy, and is the mother of four children. Three of her children are already working while the youngest is still studying in school. Together with her husband, Pacita manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
Pacita has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them at a piece rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golf players, who are her immediate customers. Aside from this, she also earns additional income from a small variety store. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Pacita is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Pacita hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of golf balls.

loans.name: Borey

texts.en: Borey, 24 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory earning $4 per day. They have four children. Two of the children are studying and the other two are staying at home. Every month, she has to spend $90 on food, $20 on electricity, and $40 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She doesn’t want to change her job because she doesn’t have knowledge to do another job beside this. She wants to support her children to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for travelling to work

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 49, is a married woman with a son. Her husband works in a textile factory. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 14 years, Diep has supported her family through the income she earns from her food stall, which occupies the front of her house. She sells pork soup, fried corn, and a variety of other dishes. She intends to take a loan to buy new furniture and ingredients so that she can produce a larger quantity of food to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her expanded business will help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children who both go to school. She has two additional family members (brother, sister). She operates a retail shop that she rents. She sells her products door-to-door. She has been in business for the last 2 years. Esther works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and baking flour. Her aspiration goal is to expand into a wholesale shop. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Sait

texts.ru: Саит занимается агробизнесом более 6 лет и имеет хороший опыт. Он женат и у них трое детей. Он выращивает пшеницу и овощей на свою землю. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Прибыль, который он получает, он ремонтирует свой дом.  Саит хотел бы получить займ для покупки семенное зерно и скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sait has been involved in an agricultural business for over six years and has a good experience in it.  He is married and has three children.  Sait grows wheat and vegetables on his land.  His wife helps him with the business.  Besides this, Sait is involved in animal husbandry.  He uses his profits to make repairs to his house.  Sait wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of sowing seeds and livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and livestock

loans.name: C 12023 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Baptiste is 44 years old and has six children aged between 6 and 16 years old. He owns an agriculture business which is open from 6am until 1pm every day except the weekend. He currently employs four people to help him. He is the leader of the group (pictured with his hand raised) called "C 1203 Tuzamurane" in the local language. 

Baptiste has four years of experience in this work. He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice for sale. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice for sale.

loans.name: Siliver

texts.en:
Siliver is 30 years old and is married with three children aged between 4 and 9 years old. His business is well organized. He sells items in a boutique such as lotions, rice, sugar, etc. Siliver has five years of experience and employs six people to help him. The hours of his business are from 6am to 7pm each day except on Sunday.

Siliver has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profit from this loan, Siliver will reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children. Siliver hopes to build a house for his family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Idirisa

texts.en:
Idirisa is a middle-aged man who is married with three children aged ten, six and two years-old. Two of them are  attending school. He lives in Shurugwi, Gweru town where he works as a Policeman. Idirisa is also doing a poultry business and has been doing this for the past six years now. He has borrowed once before from Kiva partner Microking and has now asked for a repeat loan in order to buy 300 chicks and 10 bags of chicken feed. He is requesting a loan of $1,200.00

The main challenge he faces is that chicks are easily affected by diseases such as newcastle which usually leads  to death. He sees himself having a plot and having a bigger project with 1,000 chicks supplied to a larger market. The loan would certainly improve Idirisa’s life style . He intends to buy a residential stand in Shurugwi, Gweru with the income generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks and 10 bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Puertas Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo puertas del futuro es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas del barrio. Actualmente se encuentran en el décimo tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas con mucho sacrificio y trabajo están sobresaliendo y desean seguir haciéndolo.
Vicenta es peluquera y nos cuenta que es muy buena, es por ello que siempre tiene buena cantidad de clientes, trabaja todos los días arduamente  y de esa forma puede tener los medios necesarios para mantener su hogar. Su meta es poder agrandar y tener un local bien equipado.
solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, esmaltes para uñas y demás insumos para su peluquería. Ella, al igual que sus compañeras está muy agradecida por la oportunidad de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Puertas del Futuro group is from Paraguarí city and is made up of 15 strong, hardworking women. They are all friends and neighbors. The group is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle through Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs. These women are working hard to improve their lives and hope to continue doing so.

Vicenta is a skilled hairstylist. She has many clients and works long hours every day to support her family. Her goal is to expand her business and to maintain a well-equipped salon. This loan will be used to buy hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, and other beauty products. Vicenta and her group members are very grateful for the financing opportunity provided by Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish and other beauty products.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Agée de 31 ans, Madame Mariam est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire à Médine Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité de vente d’oignons au nouveau  marché de Médine dont elle dispose une  table où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux années. Elle est à son cinquième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 30 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (15 sacs de petites graines et 15 sacs de grosses graines).
Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage.
Avec ce prêt  elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Pour acheter des  condiments

loans.name: Esmeralda Bibiana

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Escogió el negocio de venta de artículos por catálogo, debido a que es una actividad que le da mucha más comodidad y tiempo, pero sobretodo es muy rentable para ella.  Trabaja sola todos los días, sin un horario fijo.  Es divorciada y todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y están casados.  Tiene la aspiración de poder comprar un terreno, con la finalidad de construir una casa para que sus hijos tengan donde vivir en caso de que se divorcien o se queden solos; además desea tener un local donde pueda montar un comedor popular.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para comprar perfumes, maquillaje y bisutería.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Portoviejo.  She chose the business of selling items by catalog because it’s an activity that gives her more comfort and time but above all is profitable for her.  She works alone every day with no set schedule.  She’s divorced and all her children are married adults.  She hopes to buy a piece of and to build a house so her children can have a place to live in case they divorce or are left alone.  She also would like to have a locale in which to open a low-cost eatery.  For now, she needs the loan to buy perfume, make-up and costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy perfume, make-up and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs. Hoa is 61 years old. She lives with her children in a small house. Her family’s income is mainly from the pensionWith this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sampè Bella

texts.en:
Mother of two (02) children, Madam Bella Sampè M. is a door-to-door macacon reseller. She is very submitted to her husband who makes profit from her condition of poverty to abuse from her. Determine to leave that situation of her husband permanent dependency, she has started a small trade of table which is she managing very well. A credit of $150 obtained and well repaid allowed her to launch definitively in the essential products trading. She possesses a management ability which does not make any doubt of her business profitability. Currently, Madam Bella Sampè M. is requesting a credit of $500 to rent small shop and to buy rice, sugar, milk, tomatoes, etc. to growth her activities. She will increase her incomes allowing to provide for her own needs and those of her children and to draw out from her husband dependence and illtreating.

Mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame M. Sampè Bella est revendeuse de maroquineries qu’elle vend de porte à porte. Elle est très soumise à son mari qui profite de son état de pauvreté pour abuser sur elle. Déterminée à sortir de cet état de dépendance permanent de son mari, elle a débuté un petit commerce de table qu’elle gère assez bien. Un crédit de $150 obtenu et bien remboursé lui a permis de se lancé définitivement dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité. Elle possède une capacité de gestion qui ne fait pas douter de la rentabilité de ses affaires. Actuellement, Madame M. Sampè Bella, sollicite un crédit de $500 pour louer un petit magasin et acheter du riz, sucre, lait, tomate, etc. pour accroître ses activités. Elle augmenterait ses revenus lui permettant de subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants et de se soustraire de la dépendance et la maltraitance de son mari.

loans.use: To rent small a shop and buy essential basic products

loans.name: Acih

texts.en:
Acih is an MBK member who requested a second loan of $100. Acih’s business is making button. The entire loan from MBK will be used to buy raw material for making buttons. From 1 roll of the raw material that costs Rp. 37,000, she can produce 22 dozens of buttons. 1 dozen of buttons is sold for Rp. 3,000. Now Acih also has an assistant who helps her making the buttons. The assistant’s salary is Rp.400 per 1 dozen of buttons.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Membuat Kancing (Making buttons)

loans.name: Thelma Esther

texts.en:
Thelma is married, and has two children who are also already married. Her husband is a agricultural day-labourer. There were occasion where he was without work and the family suffered serious economic difficulties. Faced with this, Thelma decided to start-up her own business 6 years ago, selling snacks, soft drinks and making tamales. Little by little, her business has grown, and she now has a small shop.

Now, Thelma needs a loan of $550 dollars which she will use to purchase more stock to offer a better variety of products to her clients and in order to better adapt the area in which she makes tamales, because she wants to increase production. The well-being of this family is in your hands: they thank-you sincerely for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Thelma es casada y tiene dos hijos que ya están casados. Su esposo es jornalero y trabaja en las labores del campo, en ocasiones se quedaba sin trabajo y la familia pasaba por graves problemas económicos, ante esta necesidad, Thelma decidió iniciar su propio negocio, hace seis años, vendiendo frituras, refrescos y haciendo tamales, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor su negocio, ahora tiene una pequeña tienda.

En estos momentos, Thelma necesita de un préstamo por $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer mejor variedad a sus clientes y para acondicionar mejor el lugar en el que se dedica la elaboración de los tamales, porque quiere incrementar su producción. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Stock purchase and building renovation

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia is a 45-year-old married mother of six. Her husband works harvesting cane. She runs a convenience store out of her home to help with family expenses. She belongs to a collective with Maria Eugenia G. Lopez, who raises chickens, Berta Soliz G., who sells clothes, and Amalia V. Guillen, who raises pigs. With the loan, the animal breeders plan to purchase more livestock, while Ofelia and Berta plan to purchase more merchandise for their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

OFELIA TIENE 45 AÑOS , CASADA , 6 HIJOS , SU ESPOSOS SE DEDICA A LA COSECHA DE LA CAÑA .ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES CONTRIBUYENDO DE ESTA FORMA A LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LA PASADITA 4 . JUNTO CON MARIA EUGENIA G. LOPEZ ( CRIANZA DE POLLOS ) Y BERTA SOLIZ G. ( VENTA DE ROPA ) AMALIA V. GUILLEN ( CRIANZA DE PUERCOS ). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR MAS ANIMALES PARA TENER MAYOR PRODUCCION DE ELLOS Y OFELIA COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SU TIENDA .

loans.use: Purchase livestock and merchandise

loans.name: Ziyeddin

texts.en:
Ziyaddin A. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. He is from Azerbaijan in the Agdam region, an Armenian conflict territory situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. He is the only income-earner of his family. Ziyaddin started his business in 1999 when he purchased one milk cow with money he had saved. This money was not enough to cover all of the family expenses.

In 2005 Ziyeddin borrowed $600 from Normicro and expanded his business by purchasing another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and Ziyeddin has applied for a loan of $1000 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production to expand his business and considerably increase his income.

Ziyeddin would like to receive a $1,200 loan in order to acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them, and to make some repairs. He will repay the loan within 6 months. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them, and to make some repairs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira M. Calani is an expert in making crafts such as mantillas, aguayos and other garments. She learned this activity from her mother and is continuing the tradition.

Her customers are found at the most important fairs in the town of El Alto, at the doors of the "Iglesia de Gran Poder", one of the most traditional churches of La Paz because of its religious and folkloric connotations which are related.

Elvira makes her handcrafts alone but occasionally she needs an assistant to help out with the finish of her crafts.

Elvira needs capital to buy machinery so she can vary and improve the production and thus increase her earnings getting a better life quality with a real workshop to weave and knit the garments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Elvira M. Calani, es experta en la confección de artesanías en tela, principalmente mantillas, aguayos y otros. Esta es una actividad que aprendió de su madre y que ella continúa con la tradición.

Su principal mercado se encuentra en las más importantes Ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, como también en las puertas de la Iglesia de Gran Poder, que es una de las iglesias más tradicionales de la ciudad de La Paz, por las connotaciones religiosas y folklóricas que posee y que se interrelacionan.

Elvira trabaja sola, y todo el trabajo que ella realiza es a mano, en ocasiones precisa contratar algunos dependientes que colaboran en el acabado de los trabajos.

Elvira necesita capital para poder incrementar su producción, principalmente para la compra de maquinaria especializada para tejido, solo de esta forma podrá tanto variar como incrementar la producción y de esta manera mejorar su oingresos por este concepto. De esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, estableciendo un verdadero taller de producción de tejidos.

loans.use: To buy machinery to establish a workshop for woven garments.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
22 year-old Amelia, when she started her family with Máximo, decided to leave her home town Capachica in search of a better future. Currently, she works as a walking salesperson, selling food in the Sunday market of the town she now lives in, Juliaca: a business which thanks to her excellent seasoning and above all her amiability with those she serves, she is now attracting regular customers. In addition to this work, Amelia dedicates herself to the rearing and sale of rabbits, an activity which also generates extra income for the sustenance and well-being of her dear family.

This hard-working mother’s wish is to one day own her own restaurant and she knows that in order to achieve this aim she needs to work hard; for the moment she wants to obtain a loan which she will invest in purchasing wholesale supplies, with the aim of reducing the preparation costs of each of her delicious stews which she offers every day from her small mobile tricycle, sometimes accompanied by her two lovely children. Let us contribute to the happiness of this young mother and her enterprising family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Amelia de 22 años de edad, desde que formó su familia junto a Máximo, decidió salir de su pueblo natal Capachica en busca de un mejor porvenir. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en la feria dominical de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, negocio que gracias a su excelente sazón y sobre todo a la amabilidad con la que atiende va obteniendo asiduos comensales, adicionalmente a este trabajo doña Amelia se dedica a la crianza y venta de conejos, oficio que también le genera ingresos económicos extras para el sustento y bienestar de su querida familia.

El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es poseer algún día su propio restaurante y sabe que para lograrlo tiene que trabajar arduamente; por el momento desea obtener un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en comprar víveres al por mayor, con el fin de disminuir el costo en la preparación de cada uno de sus deliciosos potajes que ofrece diariamente en su pequeña movilidad (triciclo), en ocasiones acompañado de sus dos queridos hijos. Contribuyamos con la felicidad de esta joven madre y su emprendedora familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of the provisions needed to continue delighting the palates of Juliaca's inhabitants.

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.en:
