Faizullaeva Shahrabonu is a 40-year old loving mother of three children. The elder son is already a student and the younger are going to school. Shahrabonu and her husband, the cook, are dreaming that all three of their children shall have higher education.

Shahrabonu has been selling bread and the national bread “lepeshka” in the local market of Chklalovsk city. She has been already in this business for 14 years. Bread is the main dish on any table. That is why Sahrabonu’s business is rather successful and stable; she has had her bulk buyers for many years already, which allows her to have a stable income for her family.

Shahrabonu has already taken a loan from IMON and was very accurate and precise in her payments. Today she requests 350.00 US Dollars as she is planning to purchase more bread in order to enlarge the range of goods. Shahrabonu promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of bread for enlarging the range of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in ingredients and physical improvements to her restaurant

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Meourn M., 40, is married with 6 children, 2 of whom work in a garment factory earning about $3 each per day.  The others are students. Meourn is a fish seller, and she also works on a lake fishing with her husband, Ry Thel.  She typically earns around $6 per day from selling fish. Now, she would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a new boat and more fish nets to help in her business

loans.use: To buy a boat and fish nets.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 63-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has one child. Hussein owns a grocery store. This is the first time he's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sharifa's Asaakheri Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, 24, is married and has one toddler. She also takes care of of three other children (ages 16, 18, and 20). She runs a food business, which she started only three months ago. She works from 8am to noon daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Sharifa is requesting a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with Saida, as they are both members of loan group Asaakheri. The members of this loan group are mutually responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her small cafe

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
During the visit to Ifeoma I. at Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria, it was observed that her business is booming because it's located at the center of Alaba International Market. She is 40 years old and has two children and she is the breadwinner of the family. She sells snacks and VCD plates. She acquired the skill over six months and has been in this business since 1999.

Ifeoma needs a loan of $425.00 to buy more snacks and VCD plates in order to expand her business. This will equally help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and VCD plates.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline is a member of “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN “ Bank and lives in San Martín, Rioja. Her business is located in Jr Tupac Amarú N 330. Here she sell necessities and groceries in general, such as fizzy drinks. With support from her family, tenacity and dedication, she has been able to develop her business. When she started she only had a half-empty shelf, but now she is offering a variety of products. With this loan of S/.800.00 which she will pay back over 6 months, she will buy rice, bags of sugar, milk, oil, detergents, soaps and cleaning products in general, fizzy drinks and different sweets to fill her shop and offer her customers some variety. Jackeline is 21 years old and lives with her Mum and son, who motivate her to continue on each day and achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jackeline es socia del Banco Comunal. “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN “ , vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Rioja, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr Tupac Amarú N 330, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general ,como también bebidas gasificadas. Con el apoyo de su familia, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad de productos. Con este préstamo de S/.800.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en bolsas, leche, aceite en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles de limpieza en general, gaseosas y diversas golosinas para surtir su negocio y así poder ofertar variedad y novedad a sus clientes. La señora Jackeline tiene 21 años, vive con su Mamá y su hijo, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas.

loans.use: To purchase stock (groceries)

loans.name: Rehema's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years,She is a single woman with 1 child aged 11. She is a clothes seller. Every day, she works from 10am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $87 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with clothes sales, shop own and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Angelica Consuelo

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Angélica es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Angélica y su esposo son D. profesión técnicos dentales y tienen un laboratorio dental donD. elaboran prótesis dentales para lo cual trabajan con consultorios dentales a quienes brindan estos servicios, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en un local alquilado, los materiales son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima a donD. viajan mensualmente. Angélica tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio D. alquiler D. maquinarias pesadas.

Angélica necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. acrílico, cromo y revestimiento. Angélica sueña con que su negocio crezca, implementar con toda la maquinaria necesaria su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Comunal Glorioso Bank.

She is 53 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband are dental technicians and have a dental laboratory where they make dental prostheses. Because of this, they work as dental consultants to the dentists who use their services. Their business in located in the centre of Ayacucho in rented premises, and they obtain the material for their work from Lima where they travel every month. Angélica is planning to start a new business renting out heavy machinery.

Angélica needs a loan of 1050 soles which will be used to buy acrylic, chrome, and cladding material. Her dream is that her business will expand so that she outfit it with all the machinery necessary for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Angélica needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase acrylic, chrome, and cladding material.

loans.name: Blanca Lili

texts.es:
Blanca inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo, ya que en ocasiones tiene épocas muy difíciles porque sus 3 hijos estudian y el más grande dentro de poco va a comenzar una carrera universitaria y quiere apoyarlo. Comenzó en Noviembre de 2006 a vender productos para el hogar por invitación de una amiga a una demostración, pero en Mayo de 2007 por invitación de otra amiga comenzó con la venta de ropa usada ya que en esta actividad obtiene mejores ganancias. En su crédito anterior con KIVA pudo invertir en mercancía lo cual le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo sus ganancias y gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 5 meses para poder comprar ropa usada de temporada ahora que se acerca el otoño y la gente empieza a comprar ropa para la temporada de frío lo cual le permitirá tener mejor surtido para mis clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca began her business to help her husband, as from time to time she has difficult moments because her 3 children study and the oldest will soon begin studying at the university and she wants to support him. She began her business in November 2006 selling household products through a friend’s invitation to a demonstration. But in May 2007 another friend invited her to sell used clothing as there are greater profits in this work. With her previous KIVA loan she was able to invest in merchandise which helped her increase her sales and at the same time her earning. Thanks to that loan she was able to be successful and provide an education to her children. She needs a loan of US $475, which will be repaid in 5 months, in order to buy seasonal used clothing now that fall is approaching and people are starting to buy clothing for the cold season, which will permit her to have a better stock for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene de 34 años de edad, es madre de dos niños menores de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en el Jr. Pomabanba s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Tiene un negocio de abarrotes, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el mercado campo ferial de la provincia de Yungay. Su esposo es docente y además ayuda en el negocio. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como 10 sacos de arroz, 10 sacos de azúcar, 20 cajas de aceite y 10 bolsas de fideo para poder implementar su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es hacer más grande el negocio y para ello viene trabajando desde hace 12 años.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old, and mother of two underage children. She is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Fighting Women) Communal Bank, and she lives in Jr. Pomabanda, district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash. She owns a general store, which is located in the market at the fairgrounds of the province of Yungay. Her husband is a professor and also helps in the business. With this loan of S/. 12,00, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will buy first need products such as 10 sacs of rice, 10 sacs of sugar, 20 boxes of oil and 10 boxes of noodles for her business. Her greatest dream is to grow the business and she has been working on it for 12 years.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of first need goods (rice, sugar, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es: Santa Isabel tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y su última hija. DesD. que fue niña le ha gustado realizar variedad D. tejidos, es así que teje todo tipo D. gorros, chalinas, ponchos, entre otros, los venD. a los negociantes D. gran escaL., esta opción fue muy buen para Doña Santa Isabel, desD. que migró del campo a L. ciudad, antes L. agricultura  era L. única fuente D. ingreso, pero ahora también lo son los tejidos, lo cual le ayuda significativamente  para sostener L. educación D. sus hija  menor. A pesar D. vivir  mucho tiempo en L. ciudad no ha dejado D.  dedicarse a las tareas agrícolas, siembra papa y maíz, y cuando cosecha se los lleva a vender al mercado, pero esto solo suceD. cada 6 meses, por lo cual el ingreso fijo para elL. son los tejidos. Realmente disfruta  realizar sus tejidos. Se está iniciando como cliente D. MFP, pero su historial crediticio es limpio. Solicita este préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. lana por kilos, para seguir tejiendo, además D. comprar 3 sacos D. abono para sus cultivos D. papa.
texts.en:
Santa Isabel, 56, lives with her husband and her youngest daughter. She's enjoyed weaving cloth since she was a girl, which is how she came to set up a weaving business manufacturing all kinds of hats, "chalinas", ponchos and other clothing items. She sells them to bigger businesses, a good option for her now that she's moved from the country to the city. Her only source of income before was farming but now she has the weaving business which has helped her to pay for her youngest daughter's education. Despite having lived in the city for some time, she still works at farming, growing potatoes and maize, which she takes to market for sale at harvest time. The harvest only rolls around every 6 months, though, and the weaving business provides her with a fixed income. She truly enjoys her work. This is her first MFP loan but her credit history is clean. She's applying for a loan to buy bundles of wool by the kilo so that can continue her weaving business. She will also buy 3 sacks of fertilizer to grow potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for weaving business.

loans.name: Rashida Begum Hassan Raza Group

texts.en:
Rashida Begum is a 30 year old lady and resides in a shrine city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the past 30 years.  Rashida Baji completed her education up until the 8th standard, but couldn’t study further because of her family’s poor conditions.  

Her husband's name is H. R., and he is a driver by profession.  He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), and has 5 years of experience in this business.  Rashida Baji has no children.  She spends her time sewing clothes.  This activity enables her to earn 1500 Pak Rupees per month.  

She is applying for a loan to change the body of her husband’s auto-rickshaw. 

Rashida Baji is a group leader of a few more members of her community.  Zareena Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.  Sugran Baji and Razia Parveen Baji each want a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell.  Kursheeda Baji wants a loan to buy a grinding machine for grinding flour.  Qureshan Baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To change the body of an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Caroline E. is 29 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with one child, who is three years old.

Caroline has been running a stationary business since 2007. This micro-entrepreneur has demonstrated her business savvy by placing her stationary shops, stalls and tables strategically close to post offices, banks, schools and universities. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She is assisted by one employee. Caroline currently earns about $350 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $500 USD in order to buy stationary equipment. In the future, she plans to open a new stationary store. Caroline thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy stationary equipment like paper, scanners, and printers

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.en:
G. Mirzo is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. Mirzo has been providing transportation services for the last 2 years. Each day on his lorry he transports water to his neighboring villages of Shavkat, Andarsoy, and Somgar. Mirzo dreams that his children will be educated, and for that he is working hard. As a result the business generates a significant income allowing him to support his family. His daily profit is about 120-130 Somoni ($30-35 USD). Currently Mirzo needs to purchase spare parts for his lorry. For this purpose he requests $800 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the lorry.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị L. năm nay 56 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và kinh doanh dịch vụ đám cưới ( Cho thuê, loa đài, bát đĩa). Với mức thu nhập  3.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bàn ghế, bát đĩa phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị L., 56 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2004. Currently, the family earns money from raising animals and from a business renting out supplies for weddings (audio equipment, plates and bowls). With their income of 3,000,000 VND (172 USD) per month, the financial situation of the family is becoming more secure and continues to improve. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to buy tables and chairs and more plates and bowls to use in their business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wedding supplies rental business

loans.name: Matlubahon

texts.ru: Матлубахон не имеет постоянной работы. Ей 52 года, воспитала 2 детей. Муж работает, но зарабатываемых денег недостаточно для полноценной жизни. У Матлубахон есть швейная машинка и поэтому она принимает заказы на шитье национальных платьев. Шитье одного платья стоит от 10 до 50 сомони (3-15$), и если есть постоянные заказы, то можно хорошо заработать. Матлубахон старается шить качественно, чтобы привлечь и удержать постоянных клиентов. Сейчас ближе к весне наступает сезон праздников и свадебных мероприятий и Матлубахон собирается закупить ткани и фурнитуру. Для этого она обратилась в Микроинвест за получением займа.
texts.en:
Matlubahon doesn't have steady work. She is 52 and raised two children. Her husband works, but doesn't earn enough to support the family. Matlubahon has a sewing machine and therefore takes orders to sew national dresses. Sewing one dress costs about 10-50 somoni (US $3-15), and if she has regular orders, she can make good money. Matlubahon aims to do quality work, so that she can attract and maintain a steady clientele. Now, as spring draws near, and the season for holidays and weddings begins, Matlubahon seeks to stock up on cloth and accessories. To do so, she has come to Microinvest with a request for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: acquisition of cloth and accessories

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong H., age 48, has a six-member family and lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. The couple has four children; three of them are single and the other is married and lives independently.

He owns a car that he uses to provide a taxi service. Almost all of his clients are passers-by, tourists, and merchants. In addition to his taxi service, he also uses his car to transport fruit to the market for his wife to sell. The family can generate an income of approximately $15 per day to manage their family's living expenses.

Because the business of selling fruit is a profitable for the family, Suong H. is looking for a loan to use as capital to increase his stock of fruit for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To increase stocks of fruit

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 23 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene un hijo y posee estudios de superior incompleta ya que no pudo terminar sus estudios de “Educación”.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en su tienda de Abarrotes ya que con dicho dinero compra mercadería para su negocio.
Actualmente ella requiere otro préstamo, por tanto viene solicitando la suma de S/1500.00 nuevos soles, con el dinero piensa invertirlo en adquirir mas productos para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Juliana is a member of the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Communal Bank in the Mazo-Cruz District of Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old with a son, and lives with her domestic partner. She has attended high school but didn't graduate because she was not able to finish her studies in Education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols which she invested in her grocery store with the funds being used to buy merchandise for the business. Currently she needs another loan which she is now requesting in the amount of 1,500 New Sols. She intends to invest this in acquiring some more merchandise to stock up her grocery store. She feels very grateful for the support which Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Тошмиров Илхом в возрасте 37 лет, имеет 3 детей, живет в районе Турсунзаде. Илхом работает по своей специальности бригадиром, и занимается  дополнительным бизнесом т.е. земледелием. Т.к. семья преумножилась, заработной платы не хватает и поэтому он начал свой бизнес, который длится уже более 10 лет. Илхом просит у нас кредит для посева риса.
texts.en:
T. Ilhom is 37 years old, has 3 children and lives in the Tursun-zoda region. Ilhom works as a foreman in his profession and also has a supplementary business, farming. Since his family size has increased, his salary is not enough and this is why he started his business which has already lasted for more than 10 years. Ilhom is asking us for a loan in order to plant rice.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant rice

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De La Alborada Group

texts.es:
VILMA tiene 43 años, su esposo es el señor  Oscar  Reyes D. 45 años, que en forma conjunta apoyan a la educación D. sus  dos hijos D. 21 y 16 años para que ha futuro sean grandes profesionales.
VILMA es natural D. Lima  tiene  un pequeño negocio D. abarrotes ubicado en su domicilio: Calle las Ciruelas 169 La Alborada, Comas,  trabaja con Edaprospo poco mas D.  tres años perteneciendo a la Alcancía Comunal  SIEMPRE UNIDAS D. LA ALBORADA,  tiene el cargo D. presidenta, que en este mes culminó su primera fase y graduación  renovando su crédito grupal por el monto D. S/. 7,800.00.

La Alcancía  Comunal  esta conformada por 10 socios los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades y rubros, el 60% a la venta D. comida, el 20% a la prestación D. servicio vehicular y el otro 20% al rubro D. producción textil. Todos  saben que en estos tiempos la competencia  en el negocio es fuerte, pero trabajando organizadamente y en grupo los alienta a poner mayor esfuerzo en su trabajo y en la inversión D. capital que la institución les ofrece.
texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old, her husband is Mr. Oscar Reyas, 45 years old, and together they support the education of their children, 21 and 16 years old, so that in the future they will be great professionals.

Vilma is a native of Lima and has a small grocery business located in her home: 169 Las Ciruelas St, La Alborada, Comas. She has worked with Edaprospo a little more than three years, belonging to the SIEMPRE UNIDAS D. LA ALBORADA (Always United from the Dawn) Communal Bank where she has the position of President and which this month completed its first phase and graduated, renewing its group loan in the amount of 7,800 PEN.

The communal bank is composed of ten members who are in different businesses and areas: 60% in the sale of food, 20% offering vehicular services, and the other 20% in the area of textile production. All of them know that in these times the competition is strong, but working together in a group they are encouraged to put greater effort into their businesses and in the investment of capital that the institution (Edaprospo) offers them.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is the married mother of five children: three sons and two daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. Akosua is forty years old and lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a pastor.

Akosua is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell as well. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

Akosua has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Cacilda Ananias

texts.pt:
Cacilda Ananias M. nasceu na província de Gaza (a 300 km a norte de Maputo) tem 38 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 5 e 17 anos. Os três primeiros estudam nas escolas oficiais de boane.

Cacilda parou de estudar na segunda classe porque a mãe não tinha condições financeiras para sustentar os estudos. Foi abandonada pelo o pai ainda pequena.
Saiu de manjacaze (Gaza) há 22 anos, quando casou se com seu falecido marido.

É comerciante, dona de negocio há 15 anos com ajuda do seu irmão que esta sob sua responsabilidade. aprendeu esta actividade a 18 anos e vende fatos para senhoras, que os compra a 875,00MT e vende  a 1.500,00MT. Consegue um rendimento quinzenal no valor de 7.000,00MT e poupa 1.000,00MT, mensalmente num esquema tradicional de poupança (xitique).

Cacilda nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu primeiro com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 15.000,00MT e que pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio e satisfazer seus clientes.
Compromete se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para no futuro aceder a mais creditos assim como dar assistência aos filhos, são órfãos de pai.
texts.en:
Cacilda Ananias M. was born in the province of Gaza, 300 km north of Maputo. She is 38 years old, a widow and the mother of four children aged 5 to 17 years. The first three study in official Boane schools. Cacilda stopped her schooling in second grade because her mother did not have the financial wherewithal to support her studies. She was abandoned by her father when she was still small. She left Manjacaze (Gaza) 22 years ago, when she married her late husband. She is a merchant and has been a businesswoman for 15 years with the help of her brother, whom she has taken in. She learned this business 18 years ago, selling womens clothes, which she buys for 875 MT and sells for 1,500 MT. She manages to make 7,000 MT income every two weeks, and sets aside 1,000 MT per month in a traditional savings plan (xitique). Cacilda has never had loans with other banks, and this is her first with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 15,000 MT, with which she plans to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her customers. She promises to repay the loan without problem so that in future she can accede to more loans and in this way help her children, who are orphans without their father.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis H. G. tiene 72 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Que están al cuido de su esposa. Luis tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, es por eso que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. El un hombre muy preocupado y responsable con sus hijos. Pues todos los días recorre muchos lugares, para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, bolsos y calzado. Su deseo es obtener su establecimiento y acondicionarlo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Luis H. G. is 72 years of age and has three children he is responsible for and who are under the care of his wife. Luis's business is general merchandise and he's been engaged in this activity for more than six years. He does his selling door-to-door and on the streets, so that's why he gets up very early every day to offer his products and put food on the table every day for his family. He is very concerned and responsible with his children. So every day he travels all over the place so that his children will have the opportunity to study. The reason he is seeking this loan is for working capital for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, purses and footwear. His goal is to get himself a store and fix it up nicely.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Justina De La Concepción

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Justina R. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de bebidas las que son comercializadas por ella misma en su establecimiento donde es muy visitada por los clientes que compran dichos productos. Entre las bebidas que ella ofrece se encuentran las gaseosas, los jugos, el agua, entre otros.

Ella espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y así continuar en su negocio con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon, Mrs. Justina R. is the owner of her own business in the sale of beverages that she markets herself in her own establishment, visited by many clients that buy the said products. Among the drinks that she offers, one can find soft drinks, juices, water, and so on. She hopes to benefit from a loan to use for the purchase of beverages, and in this way to continue her business and to sustain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages (soft drinks, juices, etc.)

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego tiene 27 años de edad, vive en pareja con Julia de 25 años de edad, ambos tienen un hijo de 2 años.
Diego comenta que junto con sus hermanos se dedican a la producción y elaboración de panificados. Desde hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. 
Comenzó a trabajar desde   muy joven  a la edad de 8 años ya que trabajaba con su padre  en la panadería que hasta hoy día poseen. Cabe mencionar también que sus actividades diarias  empiezan desde muy tempranas horas, a las 2 de la mañana ya comienzan sus actividades de producción de panificados, y que para el amanecer ya deben tener el producto terminado para así poder  realizar su reparto a varios negocios de la zona en el cual vende sus productos terminados, que por cierto son muy requeridos por su numerosa  clientela. 

En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima, tales como: harina, leña, levadura, etc.  debido a que tiene una oferta que desea aprovechar.
texts.en:
Diego is 27 years old. He lives with Julia who is 25 years old. Together they have a two year old son. Diego, together with his brothers, produces and bakes bakery items. For over fifteen years he has been doing this activity. He began working with his brother when he was eight years old and he worked with his father in the bakery that they currently own. He would like to also mention that their daily work begins early in the morning. At two in the morning they begin to make the bakery items. They need to have their products finished before daybreak so that they can deliver them to various businesses in the neighborhood. These businesses sell the baked goods that are sought after by many customers. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy essential materials such as flour, wood, yeast etc. This is an opportunity that he would like to grab.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, wood, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas.
Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene un pequeño restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Maria sueña con tener otro negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a partner of the Banco Comunal Orquideas. She is married, 47 years old, and has 6 children. She has a small restaurant in a rented space, located near a bus station. With the help of her daughters, she works there every day. Maria needs a loan of 900 soles, which will be invested in purchasing soft drinks, rice, and sugar. She dreams of having another business and improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of soft drinks, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Group

texts.en:
This group of women formed in the San Miguel neighborhood through a contact at Fundacion Paraguaya. All its members are in sales, but they deal in a variety of products, such as cafeteria meals, cosmetics, dairy products, and cleaning supplies.

Each woman will receive a different loan amount, between 300,000 to 2,000,000, and will apply it toward her own business activities.

loans.use: To purchase food items, yarn, cosmetics, and other supplies for sale

loans.name: Jannette Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jannette del Socorro García Chávez ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Su  negocio  es la compra-venta de cosméticos, ella trabaja con las empresas Avon y la Zermat, además de esto viaja a Managua a traer perfumes y cremas más baratos al mercado Oriental a las personas que se lo solicitan, por lo que la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargos, sin embargo ella trabaja también con créditos a recuperarse en plazos no mayores de 1 mes, con cuotas quincenales. Hace más de 8 años que dio inicio a este negocio, en la búsqueda de ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cosméticos al por mayor, ya que se acercan una muy buena temporada de venta y ella desea aprovechar comprar en este momento en que los precios están un poco bajos por la reducción de las ventas de los últimos meses para los proveedores. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda-bisutería en la cual pueda distribuir todos sus productos sin necesidad de ofertarlos casa por casa.
texts.en:
Jannette del Socorro García Chávez is 33 and married. She and her husband have three minor children. She buys and sells cosmetics. She works with the Avon and Zermat companies. In addition to this, she travels to Managua to bring to the eastern market less expensive perfumes and creams for the people who request it. The majority of her sales are by order. Nevertheless, she also works with credits for no longer than one month; the payments are biweekly. She started this business over eight years ago looking for income to bring her children a better quality of life. The loan is to buy wholesale cosmetics. A very good selling season is approaching, and she wants to take advantage and buy now when the prices are reduced a bit because of the vendors’ sales in these last few months. Her dream is to have a jewelry store where she could distribute her products without having to sell them door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gune

texts.en: Gune M. is currently in the business of selling soda and water and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda to sell. Gune is 28 years old and is married to a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar at the nearby market. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Luma Traders Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Luma Traders. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by adding more goods into their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses; sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs. Consequently, the living standard of these entrepreneurs will also improve. 

Adama K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Adama was born in the village of Makalili, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 45 years old, married to a businessman and the two of them have three children. Two of her children are in primary school and the other is in Junior Secondary School. Adama has been a businesswoman for over 20 years now. She specialized in selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and groundnut/peanuts. Adama will use this loan to buy bags of rice, beans, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon P. lives in Cheak village in Kandal province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sok Eav, is a farmer who hires a piece of land to cultivate rice on. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have money to expend for his growing. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Khon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. This couple has two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
ANTONIETA Q. B., ES TESORERA DEL GRUPO "SAN FRANCISCO" INTEGRADO POR 10 PERSONAS QUE RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS. ANTONIETA TIENE 48 AÑOS D. EDAD,ESTÁ CASADA Y TIENE TRES HIJOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR PRENDAS D. VESTIR SOBRE PEDIDO.
DEBIDO A QUE SU ESPOSO QUEDÓ SIN TRABAJO, ELLA TUVO QUE INGENIARSELA PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO, E INCIÓ CON UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE LE IVA A PERMITIR DESARROLLAR SUS HABILIDADES EN LA COSTURA Y CONFECCIÓN D. PRENDAS D. VESTIR.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE OBTENGAN SU PROFESIÓN, ARREGLAR SU CASA E INSTALAR UNA BODEGA EN SU DOMICILIO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPRAR SUS MATERIALES Y TELAS PARA CONFECCIONAR ROPA PARA LA TEMPORADA D. VERANO.
texts.en:
Antonieta Q. B. is the treasurer of group San Francisco maD. up of 10 people who live in the district of Comas. Antonieta is 48 years old, married and has three kids. She makes clothes to order. Owing to the fact that her husband was without work, she had to think up an activity to support her husband. She started with an activity that allowed her to develop abilities in sewing and clothes to order.

With her job, she has achieved economic support of her children so they can become professionals. Also it has helped to fix the house and to install a bar in their home. This loan is being requested to be used for buying materials and fabrics to make clothes for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials for making clothes

loans.name: Vohidjon

texts.en:
N. Vohidjon is 35 years old. He is married and has five children. Vohidjon has been working in agriculture for years, since he was young. Vohidjon works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables. He works from early morning until late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Vohidjon sells his products in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and increase his business. For this reason Vohidjon has applied to IMON for a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer for sowing more vegetables. Your support will really help him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian O. is married to Robert Otani and they have three children. They live in Maraba, a town in Kakamega, in the western part of Kenya. Lillian’s husband is a journalist and all their children are still in school.

Lillian runs a boutique and has been doing it for the past year. She has applied for a loan which will enable her to add more new clothing stock to her business. She intends to buy ready-made clothes and cosmetics and use the rest of the money to pay her rent.

Her future dream is to expand the boutique into a wholesale shop and diversify into the transport business.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Francisco Javier B. le esta haciendo falta las bardas alrededor de la casa y las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para poder realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible ya que le han estado robando. 
Desea la seguridad de su familia para poder habitar la vivienda, ya que tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad y quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía de paquetería en el departamento de repartidos en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier B.'s home still needs walls around the property as well as protection on windows and doors. He is requesting funding in order to make the above-mentioned improvements as soon as possible because he has already been robbed. He hopes to provide his family with security so that they can live in their home because he has two, young children and he wants the best for them. He plans to repay his loan using part of his salary as a delivery person employed by a local, Nuevo Laredo, package delivery company.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build walls and add protection to windows and doors.

loans.name: Inti Amaru

texts.es: Inti Amaru es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en el barrio Batahola Norte, en la capital de Managua, soltero y vive junto con su papa y sus dos hermanos, su papa se desempeña como arqueólogo lo que  hace que viaje mucho poco esta con ellos, el es un joven muy esforzado y talentoso a pesar que su mama falleció hace cinco años, y la tristeza embarco a su familia no dejo sus estudios y gracias al apoyo que tuvo de sus padre concluyo su carrera, y esta trabajando desde hace dos años como contador, lo cual ha sido para el una gran oportunidad que esta aprovechando para  comenzar hacer las mejoras en su casa. Este préstamo lo quiere para construir un muro ya que se ve en la necesidad de reguardar más su vivienda para una mejor seguridad ya que la delincuencia asecha día a día, en el barrio. Lo cual comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra. A futuro espera seguir mejorando las necesidades que hace falta en su casa,  que por falta de capital no había realizado, y con este financiamiento lograra el objetivo para una mejor comodidad que junto con sus hermanos espera salir adelante
texts.en:
Inti Amaru is a young man who is 22 years of age. He lives in the Batahola Norte neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. He is single and lives with his father and two brothers. His father works as an archeologist, which means that he has to travel a lot, so he does not spend much time with his sons. Inti Amaru is a hardworking and talented young man. Despite the fact that his mother passed away 5 years ago and sadness struck the family, he did not leave his studies. Thanks to his father's support, he was able to finish his degree and has been working as an accountant for 2 years, which has given him a chance to start on home improvement. He needs this loan in order to build a protective wall around his yard because he wants to provide safety from the crime that threatens his neighborhood day after day. With this loan, he will purchase construction materials to start building. In the future, he hopes to keep improving whatever is needed in his house, which he has not been able to do so far due to lack of capital. This loan will help him reach his goal of living more comfortably with his brothers so that they can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a protective wall

loans.name: Kafayatu

texts.en: Kafayatu J. is a hardworking and honest woman. She loves her business so much because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband. She sells engine oil at retail prices in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She has drums that she uses to store the engine oil to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She is married, with 3 children and she is 40 years old. Her husband also works to support their home. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Prosper Business Group

texts.en:
Theresa K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Prosper Business. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children who range in age from 8 to 22 years old. Theresa also cares for a niece and a nephew.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty. For 10 years, Theresa has been selling general food items such as sardines, mayonnaise and milk at the Moulton Corner Market in Brewerville in Monrovia, Liberia. She provides flexible hours for her customers, which keeps them returning.  

Theresa plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more sardines, milk, and mayonnaise. Her goal is to grow her business into a store and help her children get a higher education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Theresa is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts an emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, milk, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
A. Alisher is 27 years old and the father of two children. Alisher is a villager in Istaravshan in Northern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own farming land to cultivate vegetables. At the same time, Alisher raises cattle at his house. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. So, Alisher decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Alisher’s children are studying at school. He hopes he can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Canubay. She is 57 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2001, Teresita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her sixteenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus suegros. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de Internet, para ello cuenta con cabinas instaladas en un local que alquiló dentro de su mima comunidad. Debido a la creciente demanda de sus clientes, entre ellos, niños y adolescente, ofrece video juegos también. Adicionalmente a este servicio, ofrece productos comestibles y dulces, que sus clientes consumen mientras están haciendo uso del Internet. Su ritmo de trabajo es todos los días y por lo mismo requiere estar siempre pendiente de su negocio, en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su suegra. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo, además le es rentable y por ello espera dar mantenimiento a sus equipos y renovar otros. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor y también en la remodelación de sus cabinas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and son in her in-law’s home. For the past 10 years, she has dedicated herself to providing Internet services. To do this, she installed cubicles in a location she rented within her very own community. Given the growing demand from her customers, children and teenagers among them, she also offers video games. In addition to this service, she offers food items and candy that her customers consume while using the Internet. She works every day, as she must always tend to her enterprise, and she occasionally gets help from her mother-in-law. She enjoys her work very much and, as it is profitable, she hopes to maintain her equipment and refurbish others. This is her sixth credit with MFP and she assures us she will be very responsible with her payments. In addition, she thinks this support will be very useful in helping her business progress. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy snacks at wholesale and also to remodel her cubicles.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks and to remodel the Internet cubicles she has.

loans.name: Guillermo Javier

texts.es:
Guillermo es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona de bastante crecimiento económico que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la crianza  y venta de animales menores, especialmente cuyes y patos, el cría sus animales en su propio domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona para comprarlos y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo y en el mismo distrito de Cayaltí.

Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en una empresa agroindustrial de la región. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus hijas una buena educación.

Es siguiendo esta meta que ha decidido ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta comprando más animales para anpliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para lograr que se desarrollen de buena manera, de modo que pueda percibir mayores ingresos con los cuales sacar adelante a sus hijas. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Guillermo es un padre bastante responsable y entregado a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 33-year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in the agricultural district of Cayalti, a well-developed area located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For over a year he has raised and sold small animals, especially guinea pigs and ducks. He raises the animals in his own home and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them to the dealers who are always visiting the area to buy and re-sell the animals in Chiclayo and in the same district of Cayalti. This business greatly helps his family, and he also works as an agricultural worker for a local agroindustrial company. His greatest desire is to keep working to offer his daughters a good education. Following this goal, he has decided to expand his business through buying more animals to expand his business, and balanced food so that they will develop well. This way he will make a better income to get his daughters ahead. With this motivation he has requested his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa: 1000 soles. Guillermo is a very responsible father, dedicated to his family. In the area where he lives his neighbours and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small animals, and balanced food

loans.name: Mr. Sothy Chuch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Sothy C. is 28 years old and married. He has been selected the leader of a group of ten people seeking a group loan. The group is located in Krang ToU. village in Takeo province. Mr. Sothy C. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land where he cultivates rice. He is also a laborer. His wife, Mrs. Sophal C., sells desserts in the local market. With these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income and improve their standard of living, Mr. Sothy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a female pig for breeding. This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school and one is just five years old. The day of the loan disbursement Mr. Sothy C. was busy working in the field. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Sophal C., received the loan for him. Mr. Sothy Church's wife is in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding

loans.name: Joseph Oitirori Ole

texts.en:
Joseph Oitirori Ole N. is a married gentleman who is 48 years old. His wife is called Nalakiti N., and together he and his wife support six people in his family. Joseph is a farmer and he has been practicing farming for last seven years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who had already registered as a member in KADET. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend 20,000 on harrowing, 20,000 on seeds and 10,000 on planting his 10 acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Joseph’s dream is to do large scale farming, attain financial independence and improve the living standard of his family. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Harrowing, buying wheat seeds and planting

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Damaris del Carmen tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Tiene la edad de 45 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, por lo que tiene más de 5 años en este negocio  esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos, por lo que han sido muy gratificantes.  Pues todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y atender a sus clientes que asisten a su pulpería. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Damaris del Carmen has 5 children who all work independently. She is 45 years old, and her source of income is a small grocery store, which is located in the house where she lives. She has been working in this business for more than 5 years, so this is not her first experience with loans, which have been rewarding. Every day she wakes up early to do her household chores and help the customers who come to her store. This loan will be used to buy candy, sodas, bread, cookies, and grain.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Srin

texts.en: Mrs. Srin S., who was born in 1965, lives in Doung Khpos village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sor Soeng, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her problems are that her field has infertile soil, it has a lot of insects, and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Srin S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline, and with the rest of the loan she will start a new business by buying some piglets and pig food for breeding. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is an ice seller, while the younger one is attending school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El  Sr. Francisco Hernández T., trabaja de lunes a domingo de las 8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde en su negocio venta de ropa ubicado en el barrio monseñor Lezcano.
Es padre de familia de una menor y esta se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo otorgado es para la compra de mercadería para invertir en su negocio.
Ha trabajado con ceprodel cuatro préstamos y estos han sido para la compra de mercadería a hora cuenta con un negocio más solido y podrá competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Hernández T. works Monday through Sunday from 8am until 5pm at his used clothes store located in Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood. He has a school age daughter. The loan granted is to buy merchandise for his business. He has collaborated with Ceprodel in four loans that he’s used to buy merchandise. He tells us that the business is now more established and he will be able to face his competition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of used children, young adult and adult clothing.

loans.name: Javier Eduardo

texts.es: El joven Javier Eduardo tiene 18 años, pero a su corta edad ya es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, el esta estudiando la secundaria nocturna, ya que por cuestiones económicas no tubo la oportunidad de terminarla antes, ahora el trabaja en una maquiladora y entra muy temprano en la mañana, sale a  las 5 de la tarde y a las 6 va a la escuela hasta las 10 de la noche, el quiere terminar sus estudios para en un futuro tener mejores oportunidades laborales, el motivo de que el este solicitando este crédito es por que necesita el dinero para la compra de una computadora para poder realizar los trabajos que le encargan en la escuela.
texts.en:
Javier Eduardo is 18 years old. At his young age, he is already a responsible, hardworking man. He is going to high school at night, since due to financial circumstances he wasn't able to finish previously. Now he works at a factory and he starts very early in the morning. He gets out at 5 and at 6 he goes to school, until 10 at night. He wants to finish his schooling in order to have better working opportunities in the future. The reason he is asking for this loan is that he needs the money to buy a computer to be able to do the work assigned at school.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is a 47-year-old mother of three children. Her eldest children (21 and 18 years old respectively) are in college while the youngest (8 years old) is a grade 2 pupil. Marilyn is a very determined and dynamic mother who joined Kiva partner, Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), in the Philippines in 2006. To gain access to capital she prefers ASHI to other MFIs because she is motivated by the principles of the institution. After several years of being in the program she talks about the big improvement in her life. She has been able to earn profits from her previous loans that have helped her family meet their daily expenses and children's educational expenses.
Now, Marilyn is applying for a loan of 45,000 PHP to finance her transportation business. She will buy ten rickshaw units at the price of 4,500 PHP per unit. Part of her business plan is to increase the number of her rickshaws to earn more income and at the same time provide more employment, especially to out-of-school youth who want to drive her rickshaws. Because of the many blessings she has received from joining the program, she also wants to share these with other people. What she often wishes is for her children to finish college and earn degrees and for her business to be stable and earning profits. Again, she is hoping for more Kiva lenders to provide her with financial assistance so that she can improve her business and help other people.

loans.use: To buy ten rickshaw units

loans.name: Marta Chadreque

texts.pt:
Marta Chadreque P. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique é viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 23 a 35 anos de idade os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez a 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ela.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para o Distrito de Namaacha com a sua família procurando melhores condições de vida. Trabalha como camponesa ha mais de 30 anos, produzindo hortícolas e cereais para a venda. Possui um empregado que tem auxiliado nos trabalhos de produção onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa. 

Ja teve empréstimos na Procredit e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através das mobilizações feitas na sua zona de trabalho. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agrícolas para aumentar as suas áreas de produção.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito para aumentar ainda mais a sua área de produção e adquirir uma motobomba para o regadio.
texts.en:
Marta Chadreque P. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of 6 children who are between the ages of 23 and 35.  The two youngest are in school.  She finished 4th grade and did not continue due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home and also supports her nephew that lives with her.

She left the city of Maputo for the district of Namaacha with her family in search of better living conditions.  She has worked as a simple farmer for more than 30 years, producing crops and grains to sell.  She has one employee who helps her in her production.  She makes an income of between 3,000 and 4,000 meticais per month, which she puts towards her living expenses.  She also saves a little in her home.  

She had already had loans with Procredit and decided not to continue with them.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through mobilizations they did in the area where she works.  This is her first loan in the amount of 20,000 meticais, and she will use it to buy agricultural supplies to increase her production.

She is confident that she will make her payments before the given deadlines so she can ask for another loan to increase her production even more and to acquire a pump to use for irrigation.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Martha Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Leticia A. A. es trabajadora Activa de la Escuela Técnica de Computación y Contabilidad de San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose en el cargo de Atención al Cliente tiene tres años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Leticia A. A. has been employed in Customer Service by the San Rafael del Sur Technical School of Accounting and Computation for the last three years.

She has had two previous CEPRODEL loans that she used to buy building materials and supplies to enlarge and improve her home.  

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit in that they have made it possible for her to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: Sand, Cement, etc.

loans.name: Ouleye

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ouleye S. est une jeune fille qui travaille dans la production vente de jus de fruits naturels quelle confectionne.Son refrigérateur était tombé en panne raison pour la Mademoiselle S. a sollicité ce crédit pour l'acquisition d'un nouveau.Ainsi, elle pourra redonner vie à son activité et les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce vont lui servir d'aide à sa famille
texts.en: Miss Ouleye S. is a young woman who makes and sells natural fruit juices. Her fridge broke down, so Miss S. needs a loan to buy a new one. This way, she will be able to revive her business and all the profits will be used to help her family.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a twenty-two-year-old, enterprising man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the motorcycle transport business and has been in the sector for a year now. He confesses that he has encountered challenges of seasonal customers and security threats but none the less he feels the sector is worthwhile since he is assured of daily income. His vision is having at least three motorcycles for transportation. Tom needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Margarita Elita

texts.es:
Margarita de 46 años, le gusto desde pequeña tener su propio dinero por eso decidió desde los 15 años  ser comerciante y vender ropa a sus amigas y conocidas del sector.  Pero por la faltar de ingresos tuvo que abandonar esa actividad y comenzar a trabajar en una empresa de camarones. 

Hace varios años decidió independizase y comenzar a trabajar en la actividad que siempre le gusto. Viviendo en una zona urbana ha estado trabajando durante todos estos años vendiendo vestidos, camisas, blusas etc. Recorre las calles ofreciendo su ropa desde muy temprano para obtener dinero y poder ayudar a sus 5 hijos en su economía. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para que sus clientes tengan más variedad.  En el futuro quiere Cambiarse de casa para mejorar su estilo de vida y tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old. As a little girl she wanted to have her own money and that is why when she was 15 she became a salesperson and sold clothing to her friends and people in her area. However, due to a lack of income she had to leave that job and began to work in a shrimp company.

Some years ago she decided to branch out and begin working in the field that she always liked. Margarita lives in an urban area and has been working all of these years selling dresses, shirts, blouses, etc. She goes street to street selling her clothing from very early in the morning to get enough money to be able to help her 5 children.

To keep her business, Margarita wants to use the loan to buy clothing so that her customers have a greater variety. In the future she wants to move to improve her quality of life and to have a clothing store.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Pomape del distrito de Monsefú. Una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas y aves de corral. Ella cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María ya había tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva anteriormente, en aquella oportunidad aprovechó el dinero para adquirir más ovejas, las cuales engordó y vendió, actualmente su demanda ha aumentado y ello la pone muy contenta. Actualmente desea adquirir más ovejas para satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

María se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con su negocio a través del fondo Kiva. Ella nos comenta que el préstamo le ha brindado fuerzas para seguir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Marîa Margarita is the mother of a family. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in Pomape, in the Monsefu District. This area is located twenty minutes from Chiclayo. For the past six years she has been raising and selling small animals, specifically sheep and domesticated birds. She raises these animals in an area near her home. When they have grown up sufficiently, she sells them to buyers in her area. This business helps her husband with the economic support of their family.
Marîa has had a loan previously with KIVA. She used the last loan to buy sheep, which she fattened and sold. She had a greater demand for this product and that made her happy. She would like to buy more sheep to satisfy her customer’s needs. This is why she has come to Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of 1000 new soles, which she will use to meet her business objectives.
Marîa is very thankful for the people that help her through KIVA. This loan gives her the opportunity to move forward and progress.

loans.use: She will buy more sheep in order to meet her customer's demands.

loans.name: Yusuf Kea

texts.en:
Yusuf Kea O. is a 28-year-old man from Bakarani. He has been a greengrocery owner for the last eight years. This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase vegetables for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business. Yusuf’s hopes and dreams are to raise his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Eneclito

texts.en:
Eneclito D. is from the village of Patawag liloy Zamboanga del norte. He is 51 years old. Eneclito is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eneclito owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Eneclito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eneclito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eneclito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Eneclito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Eneclito's second loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Edith Marisol

texts.es:
Doña Edith, reside en Usulután, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su hija y sus nietos,  se dedica a vender tortillas, este negocio tiene 12 años de existir, con el apoyo de su hija ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio. Ella por el momento necesita invertir en compra de maíz, gas y leña, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión.
