Con esta ayuda contara con materia prima para dar salida a las ventas, también puede aumentar su producción, mejorando así los ingresos para su hogar. Los sueños de doña Edith  son mantenerse activa con ánimos en el negocio, y garantizarle a su hija un mejor futuro para que crezcan sus nietos.
texts.en:
Edith lives in Usulután. She is 43 years old and lives with her daughter and grandchildren. She works selling tortillas. She has had this business for 12 years and with her daughter's help has been able to maintain this business. At this time, she needs to invest in purchasing corn, gas and firewood. That is why she is asking for a loan to make this investment. 

With this help, she will have raw material to get ahead in sales. She can also increase production, thus improving her income for her home. Edith's dreams are to stay active and enthusiatic with the business, and guaranteeing her daughter a better future for her grandchildren to grow.

loans.use: To purchase corn, gas and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase material to make traditional Rwandan dresses

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 38-year-old husband from Hebron city. He has been married for a long time and trying to have a baby. Since all remedies didn't work, Ismael wanted to try fertilization clinics.

Ismael took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the treatment that he hopes will give him a child soon. Ismael appears in the picture above in FATEN's branch in Hebron.

loans.use: to cover fertilization clinic expenses

loans.name: Francisca Mumbua

texts.en:
Francisca M. is 52 years old. She runs a Boutique in Athi River, Kenya. She is married to Alfred M. and together they have four children. Francisca was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Francisca has been running her business for a period of six years and her monthly income is KES 10,000. This loan of KES 65,000 will be her fourth loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use it to open another boutique in Kitengela. If the loan boosts the business, she plans to use the profit to pay school fees for her son who is in college.

Francisca describes herself as hardworking, and dreams of managing a big boutique shop in Athi River.

loans.use: open another clothing boutique

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla R. tiene 54 años de edad, esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Tiene mas de 30 años de vivir en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, ahi vive con un hijo y una nieta, los otros dos hijos viven en los Estados Unidos, Pabla se separo de su esposo hace unos años, doña Pabla se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para tener bien surtida su pulperia ya que se aproxima la semana santa y en esta semana las ventas son buenas.
Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan estar legalmente en los estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pabla R., 54, is single and sells groceries in a store located in her house.  She’s lived in the Buena Vista Centro neighborhood for over 30 years; she lives there with a son and granddaughter.  Her other children live in the United States.  Pabla separated from her husband a few years ago.  Her tenacity characterizes her.  

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store because Holy Week is approaching and sales are good that week.  

Her dream is that her children will be able to be in the United States legally.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap, toilet paper, oatmeal, cereal, coffee, cookies, bread, snacks, batteries, candles, beans, corn flour, lard, oil, margarine, eggs, sweets, deodorants, sardines, hair gel, noodles, tomato sauce, mortadella, ham, sausages, soft drinks, juices and water in cans and bags.

loans.name: Mary Julie

texts.en:
Mary Julie is a 35-year-old farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is still single and wants to have her own family someday.

Mary Julie has been growing rice for 4 years. She earns approximately 5000 PHP from this farming activity.  She works hard to earn better income and be able to save for her future family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.  Mary Julie hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 41 years old and married with three children, of whom two are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business. Janet requested a PHP 24,000 loan through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy bamboo on which to dry fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for drying fish to sell

loans.name: Moung

texts.en:
Mrs. Moung is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the Dongkor district of Phnom Penh City. She is a construction worker and earns a profit of approximately 3 USD daily. Her husband works as a leader in the construction field. The couple has one adult child who works as a garment factory worker and earns a monthly salary. They do not have a toilet and the family’s living condition is made more difficult due to poor sanitation and the pollutants that surround their house and harm their health. 

Mrs. Moung is requesting a loan to build a restroom to improve her family’s sanitation and hygiene conditions.

loans.use: to build a restroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 67 years old and lives in Sinacaban. She is married with 8 children. She has a motorcycle repair business and earns approximately $230 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her motorcycle repair business. Dulcisima has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is a builder. They have two children, one of whom lives at home and attends school.

Yassah sells a wide range of dry goods. She has had her business for five years. She was taught how to run the business by her elder sister.  

Her main challenges are the increases in prices for the things she sells. She is happy when she sells things as it enables her to help pay for school fees.

She is requesting a loan to purchase and sell more goods. She would like to get the money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase and sell more goods.

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen is 31 years old and married to Joyce. They have two children aged five years, and two months. He has been operating his house furnishing business for the past 11 years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 108,000, which he uses to take care of his business and family.

This is his fourth loan. He has been loaned KES 70,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use this loan to purchase stock like materials for making duvets, curtains and bed covers. He plans to use the profit from his business to build a family home.

In the future, he hopes to enlarge his business with stock worth over KES.500,000 and to employ over five people, thus creating job opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making duvets, curtains and bed covers

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Anastacia has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Anastacia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anastacia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. Vicenta is married and has a convenience store business in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, fried pork rinds, etc.

Vicenta has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, fried pork rinds, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 52 years old and married to Catherine. They are blessed with four children. He has been selling cereals for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family and business.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He has been loaned KES 20,000. He will use the loan to buy sacks of maize, beans and rice. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick operates a provisions shop at Akotokyir. Patrick attended a commercial school. A commercial school is a place where individuals are equipped with formal training on how to go into small business. Her husband sells electrical parts. 

Her loan will be used to buy provisions to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fruit like mangoes to sell. Cecilia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits like mangoes to sell

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor, 21, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Miraflor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

Miraflor has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 49, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a labourer in a seafood factory. 

Hang supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business ten years ago. She sells sugar, soft drinks, confectionery, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy food and beverages

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu is a fish monger at Abura. She also sells groceries. She has been through junior high school. She is a widow and has six children. She has been in this business for 20 years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy groceries for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 59-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells items like coffee, canned goods and detergent. Virginia also makes rice cakes and other local delicacies to sell to her community.

Virginia has requested a loan to buy flour, sticky rice, oil and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sticky rice, oil and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Sreyem

texts.en:
Sreyem is 21 years old and married. She lives in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sreyem and her husband sell wooden furniture. 

Sreyem is requesting her first loan from KREDIT for $1,200, which she will use to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture to sell.  With the loan, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a twenty nine year old lady with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a retail shop for three years and this has enabled her to provide basics for the family. Her major challenge is the high cost of living however, she has a goal to set up a wholesale shop. 

Mary needs the loan to buy matchboxes and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy matchboxes and soap to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31-years-old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 57-year-old mother who loves to sell pork and chicken barbecue in their village. This is her way of gaining income for their daily living while her husband cultivates their farmland. They live in a village with their two children. Through their patience and sacrifices, they survived poverty and educated their children. At this time, their children are already married and have their own family.

Tessie aims to continue and improve the business to earn and save more income for their future. She is asking for additional capital of P13,000 to buy pork, chicken heads and intestines, liver and seasonings needed for making barbecue. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken heads and intestines, liver, and seasonings needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 27-year-old single lady who wants to help her father in his financial situation. Her father, Zidan, does metalwork from his home yard, but he doesn't have enough tools and material to grow his business. Sumaya has decided to take a loan to support her father to buy more required tools, which will help him increase his productivity.
Because Sumaya is a conservative person, she asked her father, Zidan, to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more blacksmith tools for her father.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is married with one child.   She lives in Alakuma, in the northwest region of Cameroon. Dorothy and her entire family are living in a 3-room house. Dorothy had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, facing difficulties to pay school fees for the children in the family, and general poverty within the family. She does farming to assist her family to reduce the level of poverty amongst them.

This will be Dorothy's second time to receive a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2011 and she has been quite successful in the past with her dressmaking activity due to the high demand for its product.  She plans to buy more stock of materials and a new sewing machine. This activity will ease the issue of proper clothing in the community.
 
Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her child, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick and will also be used to plough back part into the business.


The Grounded and Holistic Approach for  People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its client

loans.use: buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 38-year-old divorced woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She is a third-time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd and a member of Nakulabye town council. She has been servicing a loan of 600,000 for 6 months, and she has now requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings to buy stock of sugar, salt and other household items to sell in her retail business.

Jessica is so grateful for the support given to her as a low-income earner. She has been able to borrow money and make profit from it and has managed to pay school fees for her children. Her future plan is to buy a plot of land and build a home for her family. She wants to educate her children and also take care of them.

Pictured is Jessica with the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To buy daily household use items for her store

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue is a 49-year-old hardworking woman by the name of Selina who is a high school graduate.  She is a widow and lives together with her 3 children. The ages of the children are 16 to 23 years, and all three of her children are in school.

For the past 10 years, Sue has been selling cool water, soft drinks and baked bread. According to her, she will use the money to buy enough goods like flour, cool water, soft drinks, butter, sugar, etc., to sell. She transports her goods by car to her business center and sells 10 hours per day. She started this business from selling bread, and learned this trade from seeing other people doing it. She likes her business because it gives her fast money.

Her future plan is to build a shop and educate her children, and thanks was her last statement.

loans.use: to buy enough goods like flour, cool water, soft drinks, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Litoral Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años , y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, trabajadora, constante, y responsable. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en su domicilio que está ubicado en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por encontrarse enclavadas en los márgenes del majestuoso curso de agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. El clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Ana es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada, usa blusa floreada y bermuda verde).  Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se trabaja como chofer y con su hijo que está al cuidado de la madre, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores utilidades y satisfacer a su familia, la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de chamarras para niños, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de polleras, taller de soldadura, tapizado de autos y venta de jugos batidos,  para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su actividad principal es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, refrescos, etc. Labor que realiza durante toda la semana porque las ventas no descansan. “mi horario de trabajo es casi todo el día porque los compradores vienen a toda hora y si encuentran la tienda cerrada se van a otro lado, por eso no puedo cerrar, casi nunca…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un mini-mercado en su propio domicilio. Ella desea realizar una ampliación en su tienda comprando alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para su tienda de barrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para abastecer su tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 3-year old son. She sells basic groceries.

Ana is enterprising, a good mother, hardworking, committed, and responsible. She works from home which is located in a part of the town which is nestled on the banks of a majestic river. The town is also noted for its traditional weekend strolls, simple buildings made of local materials, wonderful traditional food, and sporting activities. The local climate is warm, tropical, and humid with a temperature that varies through the day between 21 and 35 C. It stays the same throughout the year.

Ana is dark-skinned with long black braided hair and is small in size. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish as part of her culture and for business purposes. (In the photo she is sitting down and is wearing a flowery blouse and green Bermuda shorts.)

Her life is shared with her partner who is a driver and her son who is looked after by her mother. They live in their own house made of brick with a metal roof. It has clean water, electricity, and a sewage system. Because she needs to expand her business to earn more money for utilities and family expenses, Ana has formed a bank consisting of a group of businesspeople. They run businesses such as selling cell phone covers, children’s coats, alpaca sweaters, traditional skirts, running a welding workshop, car upholstery workshop, selling milk shakes and juices. The purpose of the group is to seek a loan and expand their businesses.

Ana’s main source of income is from her corner store where she sells basics such as bread, sugar, rice, pasta, oil, soft drinks etc. She works every day because there are always people wanting to buy items. “I work nearly all day long,” she says, “because customers come at all hours of the day, and if they find the store shut they go elsewhere. For that reason I cannot close, hardly ever.”

 Ana’s dream is to run a mini-supermarket out of her home. She is seeking a loan because she wishes to buy more stock at wholesale prices for her store. This is her first loan in the year she has been running her store.

loans.use: buy basic groceries at wholesale prices to stock her corner store

loans.name: Caren's Group

texts.en:
Caren is 33 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Oyombe A village in Kenya. Caren works as a peasant farmer for a living. Her community of Oyombe A village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Caren is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Caren represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Caren and other promoters in her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Caren wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will alleviate water-borne diseases and improve health within the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Caren's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Dadhibamana Group

texts.en:
Duhita, aged about 32 who is an unique lady in the Jhikimiki village under Bhabanipatana Bolck, Kalahandi district,Odisha,India. Duhita has a small family with her Husband and two children. She has been engaged with herself Grocery business at her own home of Jhikimiki village. Who is standing in the 2nd  row fourth person from left hand side with raised hand in the photo is Duhita. Also she is an ideal member of her village SHG namely Dadhibamana. Which was perverse in the year 2015 and contains 13 no’s of member under the SHG and they all are engaged with their own professional and business. Duhita is one of them who has taken a great role to play with an objective to improve their livelihood and professional life as well as their group members.

Duhita has been engaged with herself with Grocery business at her own home of Jhikimiki village since 10 years. Through concerned business she earns a monthly income of about Rs.8,900/-. Her opinion is that, through concerned income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus which total investment in the business and to materialize her dreams. She has to get more and more income by expansion of her business, so she planned to improve her business in the course of loan, which resulting taken the loan & will purchase huge quantity of grocery items like rice, oil, seeds, wheat, spices & stationary items from nearest market post disbursement of loan .She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and purchase of any additional household assets.

The other 12 members of her group are also smart at their professional like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store and transport business and with this loan, hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice,oil,seeds,wheat,spices & stationary items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Es una señora amable de 35 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada,  con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera, de su vivienda de tambo, que se encuentra en estado deteriorado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: Madera, zinc, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  construir una vivienda de concreto, para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.

En la fotografía la acompaña su esposo.

loans.use: para comprar materiales de construcción: Madera, zinc, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir los costos de mano de obra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mativa

texts.en: Mativa S. is a young talented woman of thirty-two years of age.   She is a woman who loves to do what she is doing.  She spends most of her time going to her plantation to weed, clean and plant taro, banana, breadfruit and much more.  Mativa is earning one hundred and fifty a day from her goods that she sells at the market.  She believes in herself and that having her business really helps her out through her church stuff and her family needs.  The growth of her product is good to sell to the people.  She has no doubt of what to sell because she has different kinds of goods at her plantation to sell.  Mativa wants to maintain the good condition of her plantation by using her loan to buy more equipments (e.g.) spade, knives, etc.

loans.use: To purchase  fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides and farm implements

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married and has three children. When she married, she had to give up her job, and so to help her husband with the bills she decided to start her own business selling stationery and gifts from her home. She began with very few products but little by little, with the help of her eldest daughter who works in the shop after school, the stationery shop has been expanding and they have increased the variety of products on offer.

Now, Maria needs a loan of $750 dollars in order to fix the business’ photocopying machine and buy more school stationery items, as these are the most popular products on offer. You can improve the living conditions of this family and contribute to the growth of this building, don’t hesitate!

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria de los Ángeles es casada y tiene tres hijos. La despidieron de su trabajo cuando se casó y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de papelería y regalos, en su domicilio, empezó con muy pocos productos, pero poco a poco y con la ayuda de su hija mayor, que atiende el negocio después de su escuela, la papelería ha estado creciendo e incrementando la variedad de productos que ofrece.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita un crédito por $ 750 dólares con el que podrá arreglar la máquina copiadora que tiene en el negocio y comprar artículos escolares para tener un mejor surtido de estos productos que son los de mayor demanda. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia y contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Repair photocopier and Purchase stock

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
After her husband's recent death, two daughters having moved out and two sons away from maternal home for employment, Pham thi T. becomes the sole manual labor in the household. Supported by a daughter and son-in-law T. devotes all her time to raising a flock of more than 100 chickens. In return they provide her with an income of US$62.00 a month. In addition, she tills a piece of land of more than one acre. The labor is backbreaking, but T. always remains hopeful that one day it will pay off. She's considering taking a loan of UD$325.00 to buy 200 chicks to add to her existing flock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Mai Doan, Kiva volunteer.

Chồng vừa mất, hai con gái đều ra ở riêng, hai con trai đi làm ăn xa, chị Phạm Thị Thuận trở thành lao động duy nhất trong gia đình. Được con gái và con rể thường xuyên hỗ trợ, chị Thuận đầu tư tất cả thời gian vào việc chăn nuôi đàn gà hơn 100 con. Đàn gà này mang lại cho chị mức thu nhập 62 USD / tháng. Ngoài ra chị còn làm hơn một mẫu ruộng. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng chị Thuận luôn tin tưởng vào những thành quả mình sẽ đạt được. Chị đang định vay 325 USD để mua thêm 200 con gà nữa để mở rộng việc chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy 200 young chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand trousers for sale and rent a stall for his business

loans.name: Waldemar

texts.es:
Mr. Waldemar is 44 years old, married, and has 3 kids. In his home he has a small factory that produces bricks and tiles. He has dedicated himself to this activity for more than 20 years. Thanks to the business he was able to build his own house and provide basic commodities for his family. One of his best helpers is his son, who is in charge of the purchase of firewood and clay. Thus his son is also accustomed to producing bricks.

Mr. Waldemar's business is doing very well now that it's the time of year when production and sales are at their highest. This business also provides a source of jobs for many of the citizens in the area, generating a dynamic economy. Mr. Waldemar has asked for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya so that he can purchase raw materials in order to satisfy the great demand for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

El señor Waldemar tiene 44 años esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, en su domicilio posee una pequeña fabrica de producción de ladrillos y tejas, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 20 años, gracias a este oficio pudo construir su casa propia, y dotarle de las comodidades mínimas a su familia. Uno de sus ayudantes es su hijo, quien se encarga de la compra de las arcillas y leñas, como así también le suele ayudar en la producción y quemas de los ladrillos.

Actualmente su negocio registra buen movimiento de ventas, ya que es la temporada donde hay mayor movimiento de producción y ventas, generalmente los meses cercanos a fin de año. Este rubro provee de fuentes de trabajos a numerosos pobladores de la zona lo cual genera una dinámica en la economía de la zona. Waldemar tiene pensado renovar su crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de materia prima ya que tiene gran cantidad de pedido que necesita satisfacer.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, clay, etc.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
I have an unfinished construction project. My husband and I have worked diligently to build an extra room, but we lack the funds to finish the concrete roof. We urgently need to inhabit this room since our house is very small and our family has become quite uncomfortable. I am requesting $1,000.00 in order to build the concrete roof for this room.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una construcción sin terminar, mi esposa y yo hemos trabajado mucho para poder hacer este cuarto pero ahora nos falto dinero para construir el techo de concreto necesitamos mucho habitar ese cuarto ya que nuestra casa en muy pequeña y mi familia ya esta incomoda” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para construir un techo de concreto en un cuarto de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of the paving stone of a room

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong P., 47, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Angkor complex, where is the main tourism site in Cambodia. She works as a housewife, while her husband is the one who supplement her household by producing a kind of Khmer musical instrument called “ TRO”. He can typically make on average around $2 each day from selling his outputs to a number of tourists passing by. One of her children, meanwhile, works selling souvenir items opposite Taprum temple and some of them work assist their father in producing “ TRO” and a few kinds of instruments. Mrs. Hong P. and her husband would like to request for a loan to help them purchase woods to expand their inventory during this coming high season.

loans.use: To purchase wood to produce more quantity of instruments to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Ccenhuancucho Group

texts.en:
“Las Estrellas de Ccenhuacucho” is a rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides credit and education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica and Ayacucho.

BCR “Las Estrellas de Ccenhuacucho” is located in the small community of Ccenhuacucho in the province of Huamanga, Ayacucho, at the border of a small river and on the main paved road of Ayacucho to Peru´s capital, L.. The little village is known for one particular thing: trout-fishing. The village has a big trout-farm with more than 50 big basins to grow the trout to an “eatable-size”. Along the main road, most of the population (which consists of only 20 families), have a small restaurant where you can eat grilled or fried trout. People traveling from L. to Ayacucho (over 8 hours) stop over on their way to rest a little and eat fish. Also, day-tourists from Ayacucho travel over one hour to eat the trout.

Currently, the bank has completed its first loan-cycle after half a year of existence and all 15 female borrowers paid back their loans punctually throughout the whole 6 month cycle. All the members are wearing their reward for paying back on time: a T-shirt from FINCA Peru!

The members of the bank during their first half year with FINCA Peru, besides having learned to be responsible and punctual, have also learned to respect each other and to help other members of the group when they face some kind of difficulty. Another important fact is that the members of the “board of directors” have learned how to manage their bank, assuming responsibilities they never assumed before in their life.

The group was able to save over 1,800 soles (about 600 US$) in the first loan-cycle and will continue to save in the future; following the first loan-cycle most members have kept their savings within their community bank, with the hope of saving more. For all members, the main use of the savings is for investing in their business or for the education of their children. The money is used to buy school uniforms, supplies, books and even to pay for entering primary or secondary school. Another dream they have for their savings is to be able to make renovations to their small restaurants or kiosks.

The loans range from 200 soles, 400 soles and up to 600 soles. The total of the loans adds up to 5,000 soles among the 15 members. Although many dedicate their time to the same business, every member has a different testimony….. As is the case of Bertha T. P.. Bertha has 2 businesses: a small grocery-store and the trout-restaurant she has run for over 10 years. But, with her 200 soles loan she will buy new supplies such as soft-drinks, beer, sweets and toilet paper for her grocery-store. When asked about her future, she says that everything she earns and saves is for the education of her children so they can be professionals and keep studying.

Jacinta H. G. is one of the few members that does not dedicate her business to trout. She sells vegetables and fruits in local weekly markets and has a small grocery-store. She will use her 400 soles loan to buy new products for both businesses. She continues to build up her savings for the future.

loans.use: Raising Fish

loans.name: Nansana Church A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Regina S.. She is currently in the business of farming and is requesting a loan to buy seeds, and hire labor and transport for her produce. Regina is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 7 children ranging from age 19 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Regina makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to rent a store where she can sell her produce. Regina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to set up a banana plantation and the loan was paid back on time.

Regina is joined in her small group by Janat Wasajja, Prossy S., Annet N., and Mary N.. Janat Wasajja has a business selling jewelry and wants to purchase more materials. Prossy S. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to add capital and buy fish directly at the seashore. Annet N. operates a public pay phone business and wants to purchase airtime cards and another phone. Mary N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock to her shop.

loans.use: To add capital to farming business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs Elizabeth González is married with 2 children – Fiorela who is 4 and Richard who is 2, who are the love of her life and her greatest hope. She hopes that they can one day go to the university of their choice

Elizabeth is the owner of a sawmill. She knows about business as she has worked in a sawmill since a very young age. Her father also had a sawmill and he is the person who helped her set up one of her own.

Elizabeth hopes to continue to develop her business and improve its infrastructure by building platform. To achieve this, she needs a loan which she is now requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Elizabeth González es casada, tiene 2 hijos Fiorela de 4 años y Richard de 2 años, que son la luz de su vida y su mayor esperanza, ella desea que ellos puedan culminar el día de mañana una carrera universitaria de la preferencia de ellos.

Elizabeth es propietaria de un aserradero, ella conoce del negocio ya que desde muy joven trabajo en ello; su padre también tenía un aserradero y fue él quien ayudo a Elizabeth a montar su propio aserradero.

Ella desea seguir creciendo en este negocio, y mejorar su infraestructura, construyendo un tinglado; para lograr esto ella necesita de un crédito que hoy día está solicitando.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her sawmill, building a platform

loans.name: Nading

texts.en:
G. Nading has been a member of GHAPE for two years. She was motivated by some other GHAPE members to join the program after her husband’s family mistreated her. She found it difficult to care for her nine children. The situation became worse when her husband died and she had to move into an uncompleted house.

Becoming a member of GHAPE has improved her situation. She has successfully repaid a loan and was able to pay for her children’s education.

Given a loan, she plans to purchase yam seeds, corn, palm oil, bananas, and peppers for her small business. She believes the business will be successful because there is a ready market and she has experience. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months. Repayment shall commence from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of banana, palm oil, peppers, and seeds

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria's enthusiasm is contagious which significantly adds to the daily sales of her high quality beauty products. Everyday she goes out to earn her daily sales accompanied by her catalogs and product samples which are points in her favor. She is very satisfied with her work because this activity allows Maria to provide for the needs of her 3 children and to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

El entusiasmo de Maria es contagiante y favorece significativamente las ventas diarias de sus productos de belleza de las más exigentes marcas de calidad, día a día sale a realizar sus jornadas de ventas provista de sus catálogos y probadores de productos que son un punto a su favor, está muy satisfecha de la labor que realiza ya que esta actividad le permite a Maria velar por el cuidado de sus 3 hijos y desarrollarse.

loans.use: Capital to increase supplies of her high quality beauty products

loans.name: Elisa Marcela

texts.es:
Small business entrepreneur Elisa Marcela O. L.is from the city of Bluefields, is 53 years old, and is a single mother with 6 grown children. The only income she has is that of her business. Mrs. O. has been owner of a section in the city’s municipal market for more than 35 years where she sells a variety of products (plantains, bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, limes, onions, carrots, lettuce, oranges, cucumber, water melon, mandarins among other things). She has as clients state institutions (hospital, police, naval district) and the passers-by who patronize her business because the variety of products she offers. It should be pointed out that the demand for the products that she sells has not decreased, as they are highly consumed by the population.. Now she needs to buy: 300 pounds of potatoes at US$41.00 per 100 pounds, 4 cases of tomatoes at US$22.00 per case, 300 pounds of onions at US$20.00 per 100 pounds, 100 heads of cabbage at US$1.00 per head, 2 cases of sweet peppers at US$15.00 per case, 2 cases of carrots at US$15.00 per case, 1 case of chayote squash at US$22.00 per case, and 100 units of bananas at US$0.47 per unit. With this loan she will be able to meet the ever-increasing demands of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La Microempresaria Elisa Marcela O. L.es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tienen 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad. El único ingreso que tiene la microempresaria es la de su negocio. La Sra. O. es propietaria de un tramo en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad por más de 35 años donde ofrece una variedad de productos (plátano, banano, repollo, tomate, papa, limón, cebolla, zanahoria, lechuga, naranja, pepino, sandilla, mandarina, entre otras cosas) teniendo como clientes a las instituciones del estado (hospital, Policía y el Distrito Naval) y los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 3 quintales de papa a $ 41.00 dólares el quintal, 4 cajas de tomate a $ 22.00 dólares la caja, 3 quintales de cebolla a $20.00 dólares el quintal, 100 cabezas de repollo a $ 1.00 dólar cada cabeza, 2 cajas de chiltomas a $15.00 dólares la caja, 2 cajas de zanahoria a $ 15.00 dólares la caja, 1 caja de chayote a $ 22.00 dólares la caja y 100 unidades de banano a $ 0.47 centavos dólar la unidad, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase potato, onion, sweet pepper , banana, chayote squash, carrot, tomato and cabbage

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been working as a tailor in Arusha since 1992. She is 37 years old and married with three children, ages 19, 16, and 1. Working daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm, Khadija is able to earn approximately $150 each month.

Khadija hopes to use this loan to increase her inventory of supplies so that her business may grow. She will be sharing this loan with her ten other group members. They own businesses in the sale of vegetables, clothing, and food.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Rosa lives with her partner; she is 39 years old and has 3 children. She has a kiosk located at the last urban bus stop where she sells sodas, fruits, and breads. She works from 9am until 6pm. In addition, Rosa sells food on Sundays at the kiosk and operates a small store out of her home where she sells groceries while she cares for her son.

Rosa needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar and sodas. Rosa hopes to buy land to build another home and to expand her business, and stock it better.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Rosa es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Rosa tiene un kiosco ubicado en el paradero final de una ruta de transporte urbano, en donde vende gaseosas, frutas, panes, actividad que realiza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Además Rosa los días domingos vende comida en su mismo puesto y también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes y quien atiende es su hijo.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas. Rosa sueña con comprar un terreno para construir otra casa y ampliar sus negocios, surtirlos más.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar and sodas.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa inició el negocio porque su esposo la abandonó cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeños y nunca les ayudó económicamente, inclusive dejo de trabajar para no tener que darles dinero y ella sola tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Comenzó el 28 Mayo de 1994, es una fecha que siempre recuerdo porque ese día su esposo se fue de la casa y la dejó sola con sus 4 hijos. Comenzó vendiendo comidas, después ropa usada en la banqueta de su casa y después ya se instalo en un mercado rodante que se pone en la colonia donde vive. En la actualidad aparte de vender ropa también esta trabajando como empleada. El crédito anterior que le fue otorgado por KIVA le ayudó mucho a resurtirse de mercancía lo cual le permitió mejorar mis ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar ropa usada de temporada que le permitirá tener un mejor surtido para que sus clientes sigan comprándole.
texts.en:
Teresa began her business because her husband left her when her children were very small. He never helped her economically. He even stopped working in order to not to have to give them money, and so she had to support her children by herself. She began on the 28th of May, 1994. It is a date that she will always remember because on this day her husband left the house and left her alone with 4 children. She began selling food, and later used clothing in the sidewalk of her house, and later she got a place in an open air market, that is in the district where she lives. Currently, in addition to selling clothing, she also works as an employee. The previous loan that she got from KIVA helped her very much to stock merchandise, which allowed her to improve her sales. She needs a loan of US $275 that she would repay in 4 months in order to buy seasonal used clothing that will allow her to have a better supply for her clients to buy.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos.  Día a día trabaja cuidando sus campos de cultivo, lo viene haciendo durante 30 años consecutivos, siembra productos nativos de su región y también alfalfa, con la cual alimenta a los cuyes que cría, esta actividad le permite esperar pacientemente y sin preocupaciones económicas el tiempo de la cosecha, donde verá el fruto de su trabajo.  Su diaria jornada desde muy temprano por la mañana consiste: ir a cortar el pasto para sus cuyes, almacenarlo, para que no esté mojado, y lo que hizo secar del día anterior, se lo da a comer a sus cuyes, luego regresa para dedicarse a sus hijos. Julia se esfuerza por sus hijos y también porque ella disfruta diariamente de realizar estas labores. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar  más cuyes machos, como reproductores de su granja, y también sacos de abono, con el que podrá seguir cultivando alfalfa en otra extensión de terreno que tiene.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She works day to day, tending the agricultural fields, where she is worked for the last 30 years. She plants native goods from her region, as well as alfalfa, with which she feeds her guinea pigs. This activity allows her to patiently wait, without economic worries, for the harvest, when she will see the fruits of her labor. Her daily journey which begins very early in the morning consists of : she cuts hay for her guinea pigs, stores it so that it cannot get wet, and collects dry hay from the day before to giver to her guinea pigs; she then returns home to take care of her children. Julia is strong for her children and also because she enjoys her daily work. She is requesting a loan with which she will purchase more male guinea pigs, as reproducers for her herd, as well as sacks of fertilizer, with which she can continue to cultivate alfalfa in another area of land she has.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase male guinea pigs for breeding, and fertilizer for alfafa cultivation

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Doña Adilia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama  Waspan Norte, tiene 28 años de edad, casada y con un niño de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca y se desempeña como operario en maquinas, la Sra. Adilia vende cosméticos desde hace cuatro años, lo cual inicio con prestamos de bancos comunales, sus dificultades es cuando las clientas se cambian de domicilio y no le pagan ya que sus productos los vende al contado y al crédito, con la solicitud que esta solicitando en Afodenic es para invertir en la compra de pacas para vender ropa favorables a los clientes y obtener mejores ingresos ya que todo esta caro, tiene que buscar como promover el dinero. A largo plazo es ampliar su negocio y vender varios productos que les guste a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Adilia lives in a neighborhood of Managua named Waspan Norte, she is 28 years old, married, with a 5 year-old son. Her husband works operating machinery at an enterprise in the free zone . Mrs. Adilia has been selling cosmetics for four years and she initiated this business with loans from community banks. She has difficulties when her clients move and do not pay the products as she sells in cash or on credit. With the loan requested from Afodenic she will invest in buying clothing in bulk to be able to sell favorable garments to the clients and obtain higher income, and as everything is so expensive she has to find ways of making money. In the long run she will increase business and sell other products that are popular with her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad H. is a 28-year-old butcher who works in a small butcher shop located along the road, which makes this place very successful. Elshad is married and has 2 sons.  He started his business in 2002 when he decided to separate from his father who was engaged in cattle breeding. His permanent customers are people who pass his shop, restaurant owners and local people. Elshad has applied for 1200 USD to improve the conditions of his working place.

loans.use: improve the conditions of his store

loans.name: Arnulfo Nicolás

texts.es:
El Señor Arnulfo Nicolás M. Chávez tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casado, Este Señor tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tiene las siguientes edades su hijo mayor de 30 años y trabaja por cuenta propia, su otro hijo de 27 años de edad es un profesional y trabaja por cuenta propia, su hijo de 23 años y su hijo menor de 23 años de edad, su compañera de vida labora como ama de casa, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo para poder mantenerse con este trabajo, sus deseos son de obtener otra unidad para trabajar y no solo adquirir los ingresos de lo que el gana con su taxi ya que con este otro podría tener un respaldo de ingreso.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es taxista, el tiempo que tiene poseer su negocio es de 9 años, el inicia este negocio por la necesitaba un trabajo que le proporcionara ingresos ya que tenia una familia que mantener y decide ingresar al negocio de manejar un taxi al principio no conocía muy bien león por lo que esto era necesario para llevar a los pasajeros al destino que ellos pedían y fue así como logro  adaptarse a esta nueva vida y adquiere la experiencia en este campo por lo que hoy en día hay mucha competencia  en este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que invertir en su unidad de transporte ya que tiene que proporcionarle las debidas mejorías como lo es llantas, frenos y otros por lo que este le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnulfo Nicolás M. Chavez is 51 years old and is married. This gentleman has four children who have the following ages: his oldest son is 30 and works for himself; his other son is 27, is a profesional, and works for himself; another son is 23 and his youngest son is also 23. His life companion works as a homemaker. His plans are to maintain his active business in order to provide for himself with this work. His goals are to obtain another vehicle for working and not only have the income which he earns from his taxi, but with this other one he would be able to have additional income. The economic activity in which he works is taxi driver. He has had this business for nine years. He started the business out of the need for a job that would provide him income since he had a family to support and decided to go into the business of driving a taxi. In the beginning he did not know León city very well, which was necessary to take the pasengers to the destination they requested. But he was able to adapt to the new life and acquire experience in this field. Since there is a lot of competition in the business these days, the financing is for working capital he needs to invest in his transport vehicle, since he has to make needed improvements like tires, brakes, and other things that will help him provide better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Сулаймонова Фируза проживает в районе Рудаки.. Возраст 34 года , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. Торгует одеждой. Торговой точки нет, она торгует по кишлакам. То есть она ходит из дома в дом , предлагая товар. Кредит планирует получить для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Бизнес приносит доход , но если она увеличит товарооборот , то она сможет увеличить доходность дела.
texts.en:
Firuza S. lives in Rudaki region. She is 34, married, and has 4 children. Firuza sells clothing. She has no permanent location for her business, so she travels with her merchandise from one village to another. Firuza S. applied for this loan to finance purchase of seasonal clothing inventory. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing inventory

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, es una señorita de 65 años, vive con su hermana de 55 años en la casa que heredaron de su padre. Siempre estuvo interesada en la elaboración de adornos de decoración y su hermana le enseñó a confeccionar estos y a tejer, pues juntas tiene un taller de costura dentro de su domicilio. Lidia anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa contable, pero desde que se jubiló, puso en práctica las enseñanzas de su hermana, y hace 10 años viene trabajando en la confección y venta de ropa por  temporada, la cual lleva a sus amistades, quienes alegremente esperan la visita de tan agradable dama que les ofrece diversas prendas y algunos adornos que puedan decorar su vivienda. Este negocio es muy rentable, gracias a la creatividad que tiene para realizar cada artículo de manera novedosa y buen gusto. Lidia y su hermana anhelan incrementar su taller con nuevas máquinas que agilicen y mejoren su producción. Hace 8 años que viene trabajando con MFP, este es su décimo préstamo, y está muy contenta con el gran equipo que formó entre sus vecinas quienes vienen trabajando en forma conjunta. Con el dinero que solicita comprara materiales para sus confecciones y algunas prendas de vestir para seguir trabajando en este negocio que tanto la satisface.
texts.en:
Lidia is 65 years old and lives with her 55-year-old sister in the house they inherited from their father. She has always been interested in making ornamental decorations and her sister taught her how to make these and to knit. Together, they have a sewing workshop in their home. Before, Lidia worked in an accounting firm, but since she retired, she has put into practice what she has learned from her sister. For 10 years, she has worked to make and sell seasonal clothing. This has led to new friends, who eagerly await her visits when she brings clothing and decorations for their homes. This business is very profitable, thanks to the creativity with which she crafts each item of novelty and good taste. Lidia and her sister wish to expand their workshop with new machines that will expedite and improve their production. She has worked with MFP for the past eight years. This is her 10th loan, and she is very happy with the great team she has formed with her neighbors. With this money, she will buy materials for her creations and some clothing so she can continue to work on this business, which brings her so much satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for crafts and clothing to sell

loans.name: Modjévi

texts.fr: Madame W. modjévi et une femme mariée et a 03 enfants, elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè assiyéyé, son mari est un retraité. Cette dame exerce comme activité  la vente de tissus, elle a associé à cela la vente des objets de piété. Avec le revenu de son activité elle contribue énormément aux charges de sa famille. Actuellement elle est en rupture de stock, elle demande un crédit afin d’acheter de l’encens, de l’huile sainte et des tissus.
texts.en:
Modjévi W. is a married woman who has three children. She lives with her family in the neighbourhood of Agoè Assiyéyé. Her husband is retired. She sells cloth as well as selling religious objects. Thanks to the revenues from her business she makes an enormous contribution to paying the household expenses. She is currently out of stock and is asking for this loan in order to buy incense, holy oil and cloth.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, holy oil and incense

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Mrs. Dionesia D. is 63 years old and married to Eufemio D., a fisherman. They are blessed with six children. The couple is so very thankful to Paglaum. One of their children is a beneficiary of Paglaum Community Development Foundation Incorporated, the mother organization of the cooperative that supports the educational needs of their students.

Recently, Dionesia started a new business. She enjoys making "longganisa" (processed meat) using the capital she got from Paglaum. She packs the longganisa and keeps it refrigerated.

She is a good member and has religiously made her required payments during the center meetings. Her business is on-going and she hopes to succeed in her new business venture.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth Elizabeth C. de 56 años de edad, reside en colonia San Patricio junto a sus dos hijos, David de 20 y Vrenaly de 13 años de edad y junto a su compañero de vida de 72 años de edad. Ruth posee su propio negocio desde hace 20 años, en el cual comercializa ropa para niños y adultos, así también vende comida típica como lo es la yuca frita, enchiladas, entre otras más. Ruth solícita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda obtener el dinero necesario para poder construir un cuarto adicional en su lugar de residencia, ya que a pesar que su esposo y su hijo mayor trabajan, no le es necesario para poder invertir en la construcción de un nuevo cuarto, es por ello que Ruth desea obtener el capital necesario para poder ampliar su hogar y poder vivir de una manera más cómoda en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ruth Elizabeth C. is 56 years old. She lives in the San Patricio neighborhood with her two children, David, 20 and Vrenaly, 13, and with her lifeling companion who is 72 years old. Ruth has owned her own business for the past 20 years. She sells clothing for children and adults and also sells regional foods such as fried yucca, enchiladas and others. Ruth is asking for a loan so that she can have enough month to build another room onto her house. In spite of the fact that her husband and oldest son work, she does not want them to have to invest in the construction of the new room. Ruth hopes to get the funding needed to build onto her house and to be able to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard A., 22 and married to a driver in the Ministry of Fisheries, Government of southern Sudan (GOSS), currently sells beer at home and requests a loan to set up a bar at the market in order to expand her customer base.  The mother of two children in primary school, Richard hopes to build a house for rental purposes with the extra profits from the loan. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 4,000 women members.

loans.use: To set up a bar at the market.

loans.name: Has

texts.en: Has B., 56, lives in Phnom Penh and runs a moto-taxi to earn a living. He is able to make $3 per day. He has been running a moto-taxi business since 2000. His wife, Try Mom, 55, is a clothes seller in the local market. She typically makes $2 per day. This couple has three children; one is a student and two are employed. Mr. Has B. needs a loan of $200 to purchase more clothes for his wife to sell at the market. (Has B. and his wife were not available for the picture so their daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos que son solteros y trabajan independientemente. Desde hace 5 años vende comida regional en todas sus variedades, además de frutas y golosinas en un pequeño puesto que acondiciona fuera de su casa. Adela vende durante todo el día y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar activa y demostrar que es una persona útil, además su negocio es rentable porque cuenta con sus clientes regulares que le compran desde el primer momento en que se inició. Posteriormente, Adela quiere llegar a tener un restaurante de comida típica de su zona.Este es si 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que existe responsabilidad en los pagos y mucha unión entre sus compañeros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará frutas, golosinas e ingredientes para sus comidas, con otra parte adquirirá madera para hacer algunas reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adela is a 50 year old single mother that lives with her 3 children who are single and work. She has been selling for the last 5 years a variety of regional cusine meals, as well as fruits and candy in a small booth in the front of her home. Adela sells all day and is doing very well. What she likes about her job is to be active and prove that she is useful. Her business is profitable because of her regular customers that have been buying her meals since she started the business.

Adela wants to have a regional cuisine restaurant. This is her 8th loan with MFP and what she likes about the community bank is that there is a commitment in making payments and the union among their members. With the money requested she will buy fruits, candies and the ingredients to prepare the meals. A percentage of the loan will be used to buy wood to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and repair home

loans.name: Venturada

texts.en:
Venturada has managed a hog-raising business for three years already. She started with only one piglet and has been able to improve her business and eventually have the number of her animals multiply.

But due to insufficient capital to sustain her livestock business, Venturada is requesting Kiva to lend her PHP 7,000. With this amount, she will then be able to buy enough feed supply for her pigs. She will also be able to purchase vaccines for the protection of her animals. She hopes that her hog-raising business will grow and eventually turn into a bigger piggery business.

Venturada is already 38 years old. She is married to Victorino A. and they are blessed with three children, namely: Ryan - 17 years old; followed by Victorino A. Jr. - 14 years old, a second-year high school student; and their youngest is Mae Ann - 7 years old who is a grade 1 pupil. They are presently residing at Barangay Allangigan, Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and plain area.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres, junto a su esposo Moisés de 38 años y gracias a su duro trabajo sus hijos ya son independientes y lo que ahora anhela es vivir una vejez tranquila. En Ananea (distrito de Juliaca) se encuentra el negocio de María, el cual es muy concurrido por las personas, debido a la variedad de artículos que ofrece; vende juguetes, cartucheras, porta CDs, etc., lo cual ha hecho que su tienda sea una de las más completas del pueblo. Ella consigue la mercadería de las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero donde hay mayor variedad y bajos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que es su propia jefa y que puede tomar las decisiones que mejor le parezcan, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frio que hace en Ananea. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda más completa donde pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este es el primer préstamo de María con MFP y está muy contenta por la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para llevar a vender en Ananea, espera así poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a hard working mother. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She lives with her husband, Moisés, who is 38. Thanks to her hard work, all of her children are now independent. What she wishes for now is to have a tranquil old age. María’s business is in Ananea (a district in Juliaca). It is very busy because of the variety of articles that she sells. She sells toys, pencil cases, and CD carriers, etc. This has made her store one of the most complete in the town. She gets the merchandise from cities like Tacna and Desaguadero, where there are better varieties and lower prices. What she likes best about her work is that she is her own boss, and she can make the decisions that seem the best to her. She has had her business for five years. The most difficult part is putting up with the intense cold in Ananea. In the near future she hopes to have a more complete store where she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This is María’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity to receive a loan. She is a very responsible member of her community bank, and she is always aware of the agreements made by the members. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more products to take to Ananea to sell. She expects that she will be able to increase her income this way.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
La señora Exilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Exilda, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Exilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Optimistas II”, San Hilarión district, San Martín province, San Martín state. She lives in a common law marriage and is 50 years old. She has 4 children, all of them independent.

Her character and her urge to achieve her dreams motivated her to start her own business of selling groceries, from which she would bring income to her house. Since the start until today she has been gaining customers. Nowadays she has regular clients who daily go to her store, since she has all the products a housewife might need. She personally serves her customers, with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of 500 new soles she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of cookies, noodles and salt, boxes of milk and canned fish of a variety of brands, eggs and personal hygiene products in order to continue providing a better service to her clients.

Exilda is eager to continue working and is very grateful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for helping women like her have opportunities to succeed within their environment.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to increase stock

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: A. Honorine est née le 27/02/1959 à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Honorine a fait le cours primaire et est mariée à DJIWANOU Félix, un revendeur. Honorine et son mari ont cinq enfants. La famille vit à Tokpégbé à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin. . C’est le mari d’Honorine qui assure les charges du foyer. C’est du pain que vend Honorine à la place le Bélier à Cotonou Honorine a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a bien remboursées et avec quoi elle a pu relever le niveau de son activité. Honorine sollicite son cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Honorine was born on February 27, 1959 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin.  Honorine has gone to elementary school and is married to DJIWANOU Félix, a storekeeper.  She and her husband have five children.  The family lives in Tokpégbé in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Honorine's husband is the one who ensure that household expenses are covered.  Honorine sells bread at Place le Bélier in Cotonou.  She has already benefited from four loans from ALIDé that she has repaid.  She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business.  She's requesting her fifth loan for bolstering her working capital in order to satisfy the growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread

loans.name: Yelka

texts.es:
Yelka tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres. Desde hace 2 años y medio decidió  tener su propia fuente de ingresos vendiendo productos de primera necesidad, los cuales comercializa en su misma casa, que es arrendada. Ella abre su tienda todos los días y los fines de semana, vende cervezas, pues es un producto muy rentable. Yelka está muy contenta con las ventajas de tener su propio negocio y desea para más adelante tener una tienda más grande donde ofrezca gran variedad de mercadería. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de continuar con la misma actitud de participación activa en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado en la compra de mercadería en productos comestibles de primera necesidad, como arroz, azúcar y leche.
texts.en:
Yelka is 23 years old and lives with her parents. She started her own business 2½ years ago selling basic necessities in order to earn her own income. Her business operates out of her family’s rented house. Yelka opens her shop every day, even on weekends when beer is her most profitable product. She is very happy with the advantages of having her own business. Sometime later, she would like to have a larger shop where she can offer a wider variety of merchandise.

This is Yelka’s second loan with MFP. She looks forward to continuing her active participation with her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, and milk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities such as rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat d'ignames

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the house. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. 

To support her children, she has been selling cosmetic products like sprays, powders, lip glosses, blouses, etc., through hawking. She has been in business for a year. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children’s education. 

She is so sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results she expects. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Naome's Group

texts.en:
Naome K. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. Along with taking care of and paying school fees for her 10 children, including siblings, she also looks after two of her late relatives' children.

Naome has a retail shop which she has maintained and expanded with the assistance of her first loan seven years ago.

She is requesting another loan so she can buy more products like bread, toothpaste, cooking oil and other products for her shop.

In the future Naome plans to become a wholesaler as well as build rental houses for increased income. By joining this lending group, she has benefited by being able to pay her children’s school fees on time plus owning more household items.

(The two ladies in the small photos appeared late for the photo hence taken each as an individual but a part of the group photo).

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a 68-year-old married woman with seven children aged between 15 and 40 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with ten people. Deborah takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.  She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get it from villages. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Deborah works seven days a week .She receives an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include ever-increasing prices of charcoal and the rainy season, which hinders her customers to reach out to her. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 17th loan. Deborah joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.
