She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: 32-year-old Analiza sells agricultural products for a living. She has been married to her husband Cesar for 11 years. She prays for her business to grow so that her family’s living conditions will improve. She currently needs additional capital. She turned to an MFI, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She applied for a loan of PHP8,000. She will use this loan to buy products like bananas and other crops. This loan will help grow Analiza’s business.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and other crops

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Florencia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desD. hace 2 años atrás, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Florencia no estudió. Ella tiene su tienda D. ferreterìa.
Florencia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar cemento, fierro, alambrón, alambre, clavos, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia e instalar ahí su tienda D. abarrotes.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad D. las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Florencia has been a member of the "Gran Poder" communal bank for two years, located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, state of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children. Florencia did not attend school. She has a hardware store. She tells us that her first loan with the Manuela Ramos Movement was for 50i0 soles to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles which she will use to purchase cement, iron, rolled wire, wire, nails, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own home where she would set up a general store. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the punctuality of the members in meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, rolled wire, wire, nails

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom S. lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ky Yoeun, is a duck breeder. Now Mrs. Khom S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, ducklings, and duck food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.  Mrs. Khom S. is 27 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children attends the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, ducklings, and duck food.

loans.name: Muthama

texts.en:
Muthama is 36 years old, married, and has a four-year-old son. He is the owner of a retail shop that sells milk, bread, margarine, sugar, flour and other essential basic foodstuffs in Mombassa, Kenya. He has one employee, and his business is located in a low- to medium-income area. He also runs a restaurant.
Muthama wants to improve his business to better provide for his family. In the future he wants to grow his retail business into a wholesale business. He describes himself as serious in business and ready to learn.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana se dedica compra venta de bolsitas de condimentos estos productos los comercializa  en las tiendas y ferias de barrios además trabaja como, lavandera de nylon.

Vive en la  Av. Hawai de la  Zona San Juan Rió Seco.

 Tiene dos hermanastros los cuales quedaron huérfanos y ella se hizo responsable ellos se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la  compra de material de construcción para la limpieza de habitación.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Viviana makes a living by buying and selling condiment pouches. These products are sold to stores and at neighborhood fairs. In addition, she works as a nylon washer. She lives on Hawai Avenue in the District of San Juan Rió Seco. Her two younger brothers are orphans, so she is now responsible for them since they are still of school age.

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials needed to spruce up her house. This is Viviana’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Fiorella Ivonne

texts.es:
Fiorella, tiene 21 años, es soltera y aun todavía no tiene hijos. Fiorella es socia nueva del banco comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
Fiorella estudia la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto “Antonio Lorena” y esta en el segundo semestre y en sus horas libres ofrece productos de belleza por catalogo a sus amigas y familiares. Fiorella nos cuenta que compra productos de belleza que están de oferta, ella hace pedidos a la empresa “ESIKA” y después de 15 días llegan los productos. Ya son 45 días que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fiorella es una mujer joven y emprendedora requiere el crédito para comprar colonias y aretes. Fiorella se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 21 years old. She is single and doesn't yet have any children. Fiorella is a new partner of the group “Sol de Oro” at Asociación Arariwa. Fiorella studies tourism in the Antonio Lorena Institute and is in the second semester. In her free time she sells beauty products from a catalog to her friends and family. Fiorella told us that she buys beauty products that are on sale, she orders from the business ESIKA and after 15 days the products arrive. She already has 45 days with the business and has done very well thanks to the commitment she has put into her work. Fiorella is a young woman and is enterprising, she will use the credit to buy perfumes and earrings. Fiorella is thankful for this opportunity and is committed to complete the repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fiorella needs this loan to buy perfumes and earrings

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Nairobi-based business lady who owns a driving school. She has been in this business for six years and serves walk-in clients. She is requesting a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy office equipment.

Jane says that Faulu has taught her how to keep records for her business since she never used to do it. A mother of two, Jane hopes to expand her business to new locations, add to her fleet of vehicles and improve her living standards. She describes herself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To buy office equipment

loans.name: Tiago Rome

texts.pt:
Tiago Rame J. nasceu Província de Tete, Centro de Moçambique, tem 53 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 10, 2 e 1 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe, não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Tete para Boane em missão de serviço militar, depois da desmobilização continuou vivendo neste Distrito ate hoje. Ė Pensionista do Ministério da Defesa, não possui nenhum empregado e recebe 4.722.00mt de pensão por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e outros) para a construção da sua casa.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Tiago Rame J. was born in Tete Province in central Mozambique. He is 53 years old, married, and father to 3 children, ages 10, 2 and 1. The eldest child goes to school. Tiago only finished fifth grade; he did not continue with school because he was drafted for military service. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Tete for Boane to complete his military service. After demobilization, he continued living in Boane District and remains there today. He receives a pension from the Ministry of Defense. He has no employees and receives 4,722 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account. Tiago has never had loans with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, stone, sand and other materials) in order to build his house. He promises to pay off this loan promptly so he can take out more loans. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to continue construction on his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, sand and other materials)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters. She lives in the town of Telijjawila, in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has a beauty salon which her husband is also involved in.  They have lots of experience with this type of business and have been running their shop successfully for two years.

Sriyani has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help  her business and purchase materials for the salon.  She is an honest and hard-working woman.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy materials for the beauty salon

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana D. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosana owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Rosana joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Patricia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Patricia del Socorro M. F., es casada de 31 años dedicada desde hace 20 años a la agricultura, su esposo labora como albañil, y tienen un hijo de 8 años que estudia la escuela secundaria, ellos habitan en el barrio San Francisco.
Dentro de las mayores necesidades que tiene la familia está el mejoramiento a la infraestructura de su hogar, tras sus años de experiencia considera nuevamente que sus terrenos necesitan de un mantenimiento que permita mejorar la producción, es por esta razón que solicitan vuelven a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizantes y fungicidas, que aporten al buen crecimiento de las cosechas, un aumento en el volumen de ventas, y les favorezca sus recursos económicos para la inversión a su hogar en las remodelaciones que se necesitan llevar a cabo ya que amenazan con la estabilidad y seguridad familiar.
texts.en:
Patricia del Socorro M. F. is married and 31 years of age. For the past 20 years, she has dedicated herself to farming. Her husband works in construction. They have one son who is 8 years old, and attends the secondary school. They live in the San Francisco neighborhood. Among the family’s primary needs is the improvement of the infrastructure of their home. Over her years of experience, she considers that her lands need maintenance that will allow for a better level of production. For this reason, she returns to request a loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizers and fungicides. This will allow her harvests to grow, therefore augmenting her sales, which will favorably impact her financial resources. The income would allow her to make the renovations her home needs, as its disrepair threatens the family’s stability and security.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the maintenance of her farmlands.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the village of Liloan Bonifacio. She is 60 years old. Norma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business selling daily use products and fruits in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr: Née en 1962, H. Noëlie est mariée à HOUNGUE Jean et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Noëlie a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il y a environs dix sept ans que Noëlie vit au quartier PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Noëlie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Noëlie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs cinq ans, Noëlie exerce comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage, et de façon secondaire, la vente de condiments à son domicile. Noëlie s'approvisionne à Houègbo, dans le département de l'Atlantique. C'est la première fois que Noëlie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1962, Noëlie H. is married tol Jean Houngue, and has four children. Some of them went to school. She cares for one other child as well. For about seven years, she has lived in the PK10 neighborhood in the commune of Sèmè-Podji with her family. She helps her husband in taking care of their family's needs. She dropped out of high school. For about five years she has sold firewood from her home, and has also sold spices and seasonings. She buys her supplies at Houègbo in the Department of the Atlantic. She is asking for her first loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business and attract more customers.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité  San Miguel Arcángel, trabajan en forma conjunta y la mayoría se dedican a la venta de comidas típicas. 
Ellas solicitaron el crédito lo cual invirtieron en la producción de comidas típicas, que venden en ferias y torneos del barrio.
Gracias a los trabajos también han podido mejorar su calidad de vida mediante la compra de muebles o mejoras en las viviendas en algunos casos, además pueden ayudar a mantener a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Isidora quien se dedica  a la venta de comidas como empanadas, marineras, milanesas, hamburguesas y otros.
La venta de sus comestibles lo realiza en feria o en otros lugares con aglomeraciones de gentes dependiendo de la ocasión.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la compra de carne, verduras, hamburguesas, y otros.
texts.en:
The members that make up the committee of San Miguel Arcángel work together and the majority of them sell typical foods. They are asking for the loan to invest in making these foods that they sell at markets and trips around the neighborhood. Thanks to their work they have been able to improve the quality of their lives while buying furniture, or in some cases making home improvements . They have also been able to help support their families. One of the members is Isidora who sells foods such as empanadas (stuffed pastries) seafood salads, cutlets, hamburgers and more. She sells the foods that she makes at markets or other places with many people, depending on the occasion. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to purchase meat, vegetables, hamburger, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, flour, hamburger, cheeses, ham, different kinds of salts, vegetables, and more

loans.name: Vailupe

texts.en: Vailupe E. is 21 and married with one child. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell and has one year of experience in this business. Vailupe needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or approximately US$60 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Vailupe joined SPBD and is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn L. is 48 years old and lives in Tralach village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vang Ben, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice, which they sell to support their family. Mr. Vang Ben is a village chief. Mrs. Phorn L.'s difficulty is that her field is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy a pump machine. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer. She is the mother of seven children, two of whom are laborers in Thailand. A third is a driver, a fourth child is a seamstress in a garment factory, a fifth is a soldier, and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El Sr. Juan José M. es originario del municipio de El Sauce se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene un año de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de comprar ropa y zapatos escolares a sus hijos ya que se avecinan las fiestas patria en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan José M. is originally from El Sauce and works as a security guard for the City of El Sauce. He has been employed at this job for one year.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and will use it to buy school clothes and shoes for his children since the patron saint festivals are about to be celebrated in Nicaragua.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school clothes and shoes for his children

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Madame T. Kayi est née en 1969 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. C’est une agricultrice maraîcher qui se charge de commercialiser elle-même les produits issus de son jardin. Ses principales cultures sont les légumes notamment les tomates, laitues et oignons. Elle demande ce financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable. Ce qui lui procurera plus de revenus et lui permettra de changer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Madame T. Kayi est née en 1969 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. C’est une agricultrice maraîcher qui se charge de commercialiser elle-même les produits issus de son jardin. Ses principales cultures sont les légumes notamment les tomates, laitues et oignons. Elle demande ce financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable. Ce qui lui procurera plus de revenus et lui permettra de changer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: acheter des intrants agricoles et étendre sa superficie cultivable

loans.name: Ononherlen

texts.en:
Ononherlen B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her son attends a local kindergarten while her husband works as a police officer in the local police department and receives a monthly salary of 250,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 

Ononherlen owns a computer and copier service as well as stationary trading business and runs it in a rented office in her town. She started her business in 2008 by operating with only one computer; since then, she has found success over the years. Her working capital has reached 600,000 MNT and her total assets, including all her computers and equipment, are worth 10,000,000 MNT today. 

In the future, she hopes to have her own workplace. She says, "I will use my business earnings to build a new workplace for the future." 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory such as paper and ink for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mbathio

texts.fr: Madame Mbathio N. est âgée de 53 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 14et 32ans. Madame N. a choisi le commerce pour  améliorer sa capacité financière et assister sa famille sur le volet social. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et d’appareils portables depuis 1990.Madame N.  est salariée car elle est assistante depuis 1997 dans un centre  de santé de la zone. La réalisation de profits que lui procure son activité lui permet de trouver une solution pour son niveau de salaire insuffisant. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2009 et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. L’objet de ce prêt est de renforcer son capital pour l’achat de tissus et de portables pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Mbathio N. is 53 years old. She lives in the township of Yoff. She is married and the mother of five, from 14 to 32 years of age. Mrs. N. decided to go into commerce in order to boost her financial resources and help her family improve its social standing. She has been selling fabrics and cell phones since 1990. Mrs. N. has been employed as an assistant in the local health center since 1997. The additional income brought in by her business is a solution to the problems created by her insufficient salary level. She joined the Yoff mutual fund in March 2009 and already had a loan in the past. The purpose of the current loan is to bolster her capital to purchase fabrics and cell phones for her business.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Amanda Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra.   R. trabaja como Operaria de la Empresa Arnecom de Nicaragua  su días de trabajo son variado ya que cada 15 días realiza  turnos de mañana y 15 días  por la tarde por la mañana su jornada es de 6:00 am a 2:00 Pm y en la tarde de 3:00 Pm a 10:00 Pm.
  
 Este crédito fue utilizado para la compra de  cemento, arena y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Ms. R. works as an operator for the company Arnecom of Nicaragua.  Her work schedule varies because every 15 days she works morning shifts, and then 15 days of afternoon shifts.  In the morning, her shift is 6:00 am to 2:00 pm, and in the afternoons, she works from 3:00 pm to 10:00 pm.

She will use this loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a forty-four-year-old married man who has been a farmer for for twenty years. He owns a house in which he lives with his family of seven children. He moved from subsistence agriculture to agro-based commercial agriculture. However, his hardships include diseases, price fluctuations and high production costs.

Francis wants a loan to buy pesticides, fertilizer, manure and farm tools.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizers, manure and farm tools to increase production.

loans.name: Jose Lupario

texts.es:
El señor Jose Lupario F. V. esta casado con la señora Luz Marina Posadas y tienen un hijo, viven en la Colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Nacaome.
El Sr. Lupario tiene su negocio que es una pùlperia la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion en donde tiene mucha clientela.
Su esposa vende baleadas en la estacion de buses del mercado municipal de nacaome. 
El señor Lupario es una persona de muy buena reputacion en su comunidad, sus vecinos y amigos dan muy buena 
opinion de el.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Jose Lupario F. V. is married to Luz Marina Posadas and they have one child.  They live in Nueva Esperanza district in the city of Nacaome.

Mr Lupario has a small grocery store which is located in his home.  He has a lot of customers.

His wife sells 'baleadas' (a popular Honduran food - wheat tortillas filled with fried beans).  She sells these at Nacaome market's bus station.

Mr Lupario is a man who has a very good reputation in his community.  His neighbors and his friends have a very good opinion of him.

He will use his loan to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, butter, oil, beans, bread, soft drinks, soups, margarine, pasta, oats, mosquito spray, batteries, candles, matches, soap, razors, toilet paper, flour, cinnamon and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements on a home.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical caracterizada por producir principalmente frutas como el mango,la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado caprino. Ella posee 30 cabras las cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Las alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando están gordas las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le sirve para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Enma desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y hacer que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera para que los pueda vender a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Enma is a 28 year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which is noted for producing fruit such as mango, passion fruit and lemon.  It is located in Piura region which is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Enma raises and sells goats.  She owns 30 goats which she raises in an area behind her home.  She feeds them grains and natural fodder and when they are fattened she offers them for sale to the general public and to the traders who always visit the area where she lives.  This business allows her to help her husband to support the family financially.

Enma would like to acquire feed so that she can improve the raising of her animals and help them to develop in the best way possible so that she can sell them for a better price.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire feed to improve the raising of her animals so that they develop in the best way possible

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 22 años, vive en la compañía de su madre y hermanos en la casa de uno de sus familiares.Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad a personas conocidas, también prepara  almuerzos que lleva a sus clientes. Su madre  es su principal socia en este negocio, trabaja todos los días distribuyendo sus horarios, entre sus estudios y su labor;  y es así que su negocio esta prosperando con éxito además obtiene regulares ganancias  que le permiten sostenerse económicamente por lo que para mas adelante desea instalar su  tienda de abarrotes y también quiere captar más clientes nuevos que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias.Es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente segura de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, además  agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Erika tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de más  mercadería en abarrotes  para seguir preparando sus comidas, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Erika is 22 years old.  She lives with her mother and siblings in a house belonging to a family member.

For four years, Erika has been selling essentials to her acquaintances.  She also prepares lunches that she delivers to customers.  Her mother is her main partner in this business.  She works every day, dividing her hours between her studies and her work.  In this way, her business is prospering and successful.  She also makes regular profits that allow her to support herself financially.  In the future, she would like to set up a grocery store and she would also like to attract more new customers which will allow her to increase her profits.

This is Erika's second loan with MFP.  She feels secure to know that she has financial support and has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments.  She likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Erika plans to invest her loan money in buying more merchandise (groceries) to continue making her meals.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy groceries to continue in her business

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth T. G. de 32 años de edad es soltera, y vive junto a su madre y una hermana en el departamento de Chalatenango. Para poder cubrir sus gastos y contar con todo lo necesario para ella y su familia, Sandra se dedica a la venta de pantuflas, sandalias, y zapatos para mujer, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado regional de Chalatenango, y es la única fuente de ingresos con la que ella cuenta, razón por la que este negocio es muy importante para ella. Sandra solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos y así mismo comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos en diferentes estilos de forma que puedan ser más llamativos para las personas y sus ventas se aumenten.
texts.en: Sandra Elizabeth T. G. is 32 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother and sister in the Chalatenango department.  In order to cover her family expenses, Sandra sells slippers, sandals, and women’s shoes in the Chalatenango regional market.  This is the only source of income that she has, so this business is very important to her.  Sandra is asking for this loan so that she can buy products in quantity and different and more attractive styles of shoes so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: Inventory (shoes)

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Celia G. M. ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Docente en el colegio “Ernesto Che Guevara” tiene doce  años de trabajar como docente de la educación para esta institución, actualmente tiene un  hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  Seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para hacerle una mejora a su casa de habitación y para comprar unos medicamentos, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Celia G. M. works for the Ministry of Education as a teacher at Ernesto Che Guevara School.  She has been working as a teacher at this school for twelve years.  She currently has one school-age child.

Ana Celia has had six loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. to extend and improve her home.  She is requesting this loan to make an improvement to her home and also to buy some medicines.  Her loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly since they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building supplies: sand and cement.  To buy some medicines.

loans.name: 'god's Grace' Group

texts.en:
James D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God's Grace'.  He is 26 years old, single, and a high school graduate. He cares for two siblings.

James D. has been selling used shoes on Water Street, Monrovia, Liberia, for four years. He plans to use his 8,000 LRD portion of this 42,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used shoes. He describes himself as a peace-loving man whose goal is to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a married woman who lives in Sta. Fe, in the island of Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  buying and selling coconut, hog fattening and also works as a real-estate agent.  Her husband Victor, who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 6 and 21 years old. 

Rose Marie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rose Marie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she could sustain her business activities: buy more coconut to resell and buy feed for the pigs. Rose Marie is working hard so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Rose Marie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell and buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Kamulikwizi Women Group

texts.en: Robert is a 41 year-old married man with three children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electrical accessories for ten years.  He started with capital of 500,000 and now has 3,000,000 shillings. His hardship is bad debtors and his vision is to be the leading supplier of electrical accessories. He is a member of Kamulikwizi women group which literally means "Visionary" and each member has to guarantee the other to access a loan.  Robert intends to use the loan to buy phones, bulbs and chargers for sell.

loans.use: To buy phones, bulbs and chargers for sell

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy tiene 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa del local de un centro educativo de su zona. Vende comida desde hace un año y medio en el cafetín de una escuela de su localidad y atiende todos los días, durante la temporada escolar, en este trabajo lo ayudan sus hijos, ya que durante la hora del refrigerio es cuando viene más gente y sola no se da abasto, de la misma forma necesita de ayuda durante la noche cuando es el otro turno. De esta manera ha logrado generarse un capital más, sostenible que le permite mejorar en su economía y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación para seguir trabajando. Además en su puesto de ventas llega a vender golosinas y gaseosas variadas, por lo que su establecimiento ha tenido mucha acogida, y por ello necesita de más capital para asegurar mayores ganancias e implementar mejor su puesto con vitrinas y mesas. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, durante este tiempo de trabajo con su banco comunal ha visto los beneficios de unir esfuerzos para lograr el bien común del crecimiento económico de la cual esta muy agradecida y seguirá adelante con este mismo esfuerzo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cajas de golosinas y gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en: Edy is 33 years old.  She lives in a house with her 3 children in the nieghborhood of an educational center of her region.  She has been selling food in the cafe of a neighborhood school for a year and a half.  Edy serves people everyday during the school year.  Her children help her with the work, as during the refreshment break a lot of people come and she can't keep up by herself.  Likewise, she needs help during the evening when it is the other shift.  Working like this, she has been able to generate more sustainable capital, which has allowed her to improve her finanaces and to pay for her children's necesities.  Her children are her main motivation to keep working.  In her sales post she sells sweets and various sodas, and her establishment has been very well recieved.  That is the reason she needs more capital- to ensure greater earnings and to implement improvements to her stall, such as adding display cases and tables.  This is her 3rd loan with MFP.  During the time Edy has worked with her commual bank, she has seen the benefits of uniting efforts for the common good of financial growth, and she is very grateful.  She will continue to move forward with the same effort.  With the loan that she is requesting, Edy will invest in the purchase of boxes of wholesale sweets and sodas.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is aged 61 years and has been in active farming for the last 12 years. His produce of milk and eggs are sold to the local market. His family relies on farming for their upkeep. He is married, with 7 children between 23 and 12 years old.

Christopher has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the dairy cow will provide the family with milk for consumption, and for sale to meet other basic needs. He  hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows and purchase a motorcycle to help him with the supply of produce to the market.

Christopher concurs with other farmers that animal diseases are quite costly to manage. He is, however, glad Juhudi Kilimo provides agricultural loans.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Many people aim for simplicity, because as Richard Bach once said, “The simplest things are often the truest.” This principle is evident in the life of Jennifer S., 33. Jennifer is married to Lino, a security guard. Together they are raising two children, one of whom is in elementary school, while the other is still too young to attend school. They have been living in Silang, Cavite the last five years.

Jennifer has a sari-sari (variety) store which she operates on her own every day. It is her daily task to check on which items and which specific brands her customers prefer. After her three years of experience in this kind of micro enterprise, she knows the tastes of her customers and earns PHP9,000 monthly.

To help her use the information she has, she is requesting a PHP10,000 loan. She will use it increase her inventory of the most popular items, such as  rice, canned goods, soft drinks, and other daily essentials. 

It is inevitable for sari-sari store owners to have customers who do not pay their debts. But Jennifer strives to get past this challenge to make her life simpler and better. As much as she wants her business to grow, she desires to have another baby and to lead a simple life. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Koam

texts.en:
The mother of three children who are still attending local school and are dependent on her income, Koam, 35, is a fish-paste seller in Siem Reap Province, earning around $3 a day to cover her family's daily expenses. Her husband assists the family by planting a variety of crops on his own farmland for both the rainy and the dry season.

Koam, a hard-working woman who always tries to earn money to feed her children, wants to start a small vegetable-selling business but lacks sufficient capital. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy some vegetables and a new bicycle for picking up her products to sell in and around her community.

loans.use: to buy some vegetables and also a new bicycle to pick up her products to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben comes from the village of Siktarva, Imereti region, in the western part of the country. He is 49 years old, married and lives with his wife Nana, ten-year-old daughter and eight-year-old son. Ruben is a farmer and agricultural activities are the main source of income for the family. Their average monthly income is 370 Laris, including a 70 Laris pension for Ruben’s daughter given to her by the government because of her health problems.
Ruben’s family has two cows, and their milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold to local dairy product retailers. Also Ruben has 1 ha vineyard with 600 vines. Half of the harvested grapes are sold and the rest are used for wine production. The produced wine is sold locally.
With his requested loan, Ruben plans to build a small greenhouse. He will grow vegetables all year round and sell them on the local market. This venture will be positively reflected in the family income. More income will allow the family to improve its everyday life.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Florien

texts.en:
Florien is 37 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old child. Florien sells spare parts. He has been in this business for two years, and his business is open from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Florien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more spare parts. If successful, he hopes to continue building a secure future for his family and to reinvest in his business. In addition, he will help the people of his community by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old and has been in mixed farming for 10 years in his hometown of Eldoret, North Rift Kenya. He is married with six children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. His farm produces maize, beans and milk. David also trades animals for additional income.

David has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional cow will mean more disposable income for his family's needs. He says he will only be rearing pedigree cows in the future for better production.

David mentions unpredictable weather conditions as the major challenge in his area for farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Las Perlas entrando a su novena  secuencia conformado por 10 integrantes que viven en la zona de la guardia,  cuentan con negocio y actividad propios. La Presidenta es la Sra. María de  edad de 28 años oriunda Santa Cruz de la Sierra  vive en la zona de la Guardia hace 11 años.           Su Actividad es la venta de refrigerio, desayunos y almuerzos  en domicilio propio desde hace 5 años, le va muy bien en su actividad, la Sra. María ya tiene muchos clientes, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. comprara abarrotes e insumos para la elaboración de sus refrigerios, ya que desea comprar algunas cosas por cantidad, ella no esta casada pero convive con el   sr. Gustavo quien a veces le ayuda con la venta de refrigerio y tienen 1 hijos pequeño, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The 'Las Perlas' community bank is entering its ninth loan cycle.  The group has 10 members who all live in La Guardia neighborhood.  They all have their own businesses and business activities.

The group's president is María.  She is 28 years old and comes from Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  She has lived in La Guardia neighborhood for 11 years.  Her business is selling light refreshments, breakfasts and lunches from her home.  She has been doing this for five years and her business is doing very well.  María has a lot of customers and she will use her loan money to buy groceries and supplies for making her snacks as she would like to buy some things in bulk.  María isn't married but she lives with Gustavo who sometimes helps her to sell her food.  The couple have a young son.

María is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy groceries and supplies for making snacks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and  married to a driver. They have four children  between twenty one and four years of age. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for ten years  and has one employee.
Mary says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is insufficient capital. She is using her loan of kes 50,000 to increase stock of shoes. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. She sees herself improving her family's living standards by giving the children proper education to the university level. She describes herself as aggressive and trustworthy.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Neddelyn

texts.en:
Neddelyn is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Neddelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Neddelyn has been raising pigs for 11 years and earns additional income from buying & selling rice grains and peanuts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
For the last year, Grace has been raising chickens in Karanjee, Limuru town. She is 26 years old and married to Sebatian. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use the loan to buy more chickens in order to meet the high demand,

In the future, Grace hopes to rent a business premises in Limuru town.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr.Munkh-Erdene, 37 is a taxi driver and he lives with his wife and sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his taxi business since 2009. His family make Mongolian national boots, by hand, and they sell them to the customers. 

Munkh-Erdene deeloped a wool allergy 3 years ago, so he started a his taxi business. Now it is a main income source of income for this family. Recently he needs to change the some parts and make repairs to his taxi car, because it has become bad and dangerous to use. Munkh-Erdene is taking a loan to purchase some spare-parts for his car to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase some spare-parts for his car, to continue his taxi business.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You is 30-years-old. She is a married woman who has nine lovely children. Four of her children are married and live independently and the other five live with her. Presently, she has a business as a vegetable planter. She has been in this industry for many years. From this business activity she earns about $2 for each day. 

She is a resident of Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. For advancing her livelihood, she would like to purchase farmland but she is lacking some fund so she wishes to apply for a loan from lenders. She hopes that all donors will provide this loan to her soon. The loan will provide her support in meeting her financial needs and improving the quality of the product and her agricultural activities. 

She characterizes herself as an honest woman, honorable and very responsible, prompt with her payments. Her hopes in the future are that she will send the last born-child to earn a university degree and she wishes to have a comfortable house. This is her first loan with Kiva and the second cycle with Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur with a wood lamination shop in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. Josephine earns more income from fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her wood lamination business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam trabaja como secretaria  y también percibe una renta de jubilación. El crédito lo requiere para iniciar el negocio de venta de cosmeticos.  Miriam  va a comprar cosméticos para su venta a clientes que ya han comprometido la primera compra. Vive en casa en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona  San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; es divorciada, tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Miriam obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam works as a secretary, but she also receives income from a retirement pension. The loan she is requesting will be used to start a business of selling cosmetics. Miriam will buy cosmetics to sell to customers who have already promised to make their first purchase with her. She lives in her own home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Miriam is divorced and has two children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan and she hopes to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella vende gallinas en los diferentes mercados de Urubamba, ella vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de  gallinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas y alimentos para las gallinas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 49 years old, married, and has two children. Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals. She sells chickens at the different markets in Urubamba from 8am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to move her children forward. Rosa wants to expand and improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and poultry feed.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Salvacion is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Salvacion owns and operates a net-working business venture, selling cosmetics in the local community. 

Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over 7 months and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities. Salvacion is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of her business. 

In 2010, Salvacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in the expansion of her business

loans.name: Sana'

texts.en: Sana' is a 44-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sana' wants to make repairs to her house such as changing tiles, changing windows and doors, and painting but she does not have enough money. Therefore she needs a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sana' gets the loan, she will be able to pay for repairs and improve the condition of the family house. Sana' is a conservative woman so her husband, Mostafa, is photographed instead.

loans.use: To repair the family house.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a thirty-nine-year-old, hardworking woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goal is educate her children. 

She has been working in the butcher business for ten years after diverting from farming. The challenge she facing is insufficient capital and her dream is to own a ranch. Dalia needs a loan to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Judelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.Judelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Judelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard working mother, who aims to become financially stable and give her family a better future. She is now 51 years old and has two adult-age children. She owns and manages a general store to generate income, while her husband manages their rice farming business. She has operated this business for almost ten years and usually earns a profits of PHP 7,000 a month, which she usually spends for their basic necessities.

Margarita planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers needs, but due financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oils, soaps, breads, shampoos and candies to sell in her store. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and make her dream comes true.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oils, soaps, breads, shampoos and candies to sell.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui vend de la paille d'arachide, un fourrage très privé par les éleveurs pour l'alimentation des leurs bètes.Il est père de 4 enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école primaire.Son activité s'avère très rentable et lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les frais d'entretien de sa famille.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400000f afin d'acheter 200 sacs de paille d'arachide. Son ambition est de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: He is married and sells peanut plant stalks, a very special by-product which farmers use to feed their livestock. He has four children with one attending school at this time. The business has turned out to be very profitable and the profits have allowed him take care of his family. In order to increase his capital, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 cfa francs to purchase 200 sacks of peanut plant stalks. His goal is to strengthen and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy 200 sacks of peanut plant stalks.

loans.name: Diosabel

texts.en:
Diosabel is married with (number) children. (Name) is (age) years old and lives in the Philippines.
(Name) is a farmer and grows  (type of crop) to earn a living. (He/She) has been doing this for (#) years. (He/She) has requested a loan to (loan use). 
(Name) has been a member of PMPC for (#) years. In the future, (Name) hopes to (future plans).

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 56 year-old married man with four children aged 25, 24, 19 and 16 years-old and they live in Kamwenge, Uganda.

To earn a living, he deals in agriculture and livestock and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and two of them are now graduates. Pests and diseases, coupled with bad weather, affect his production while his dream is to become a model farmer.  

Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy bulls to raise.

loans.use: to buy bulls to raise.

loans.name: Kamanzi

texts.en:
Kamanzi is 35 years old. His hand is raised in the photo. He is married and has two children, age 4 and 7 years. One of them goes to school. 

He is a farmer and he has been in a business for the past five years and the second person is the one who sell the cow. While his wife is a business woman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing.With the profits from the business he plans to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Flérida

texts.en:
Flerida has a stand where she sells fruit in a local market. She started off with a very small amount of investment capital and with her husband’s help learned the trade quickly. She has been doing this type of work for about 10 years along with her husband. The most difficult part of this business is offering competitive prices to the customer. In order to do this Flerida has requested a loan so that she may purchase her fruits at wholesale quantities and prices. She and her husband have three children together including one who they are currently putting through college. Her dream is to have all her kids attain a college degree.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy large amounts of fruits for her market

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
The market in Fugalei is a busy place every day, and every day you can count on seeing Susitana in her canteen stall.  She specializes in hot breakfast items such as pancakes, toast, eggs, hot dogs and coffee and tea - all sold at reasonable prices.

Susitana is a very hard worker and has six dependents.  She feels is thankful for the loans that she has received in the past, and feels obligated to repay the kind people who helped her start her business.  

She earns approximately 120 tala per week and is applying for another loan to allow her to purchase additional food supplies, building materials and equipment to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove, building materials and food supplies to expand her business.

loans.name: Dal Kho

texts.en: Dal Kho lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is supporting her family because her husband lost his foot in a car accident, although sometimes he helps his wife. She has a bakery. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and bought lumber to build a new place for cooking breads. She wants to take anther loan to enlarge her shop to find more clients and expand her business. She is very happy now that she can help her family.

loans.use: To buy extra ingredients

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh lives with all of her family members. The grandmother is 65 years old. The father is a carpenter and Hanh works as a day laborer. Their two older children (14 and 10 years old) quit school because their marks were poor and it is very expensive. Their youngest daughter is in the 1st class. Their average income is $13 per month per person. Hanh wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their 100  "green dragon" (fruit) plants. She is sure they can repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: invest in their "green dragon" fruit plants

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: When I heard about what LAPO is doing for the poor I was amaze to seek their help and hopefully, I was given loan to increase my business. Eunice A. plaits hair for people in her community. She is 68 years old, a widow mother of nine (9) children. She needs the loan  of $400 to boost her business. She has been in business since 1967.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Mr. Isidro, 57, and his wife, Silvia Elizeche, 49, are married with three children and live in Carapeguá, Paraguay. All their three children are in college. Their only daughter studies in the capital city of Asuncion while the two boys study and help their father with his business.

Mr. Isidro works as a carpenter and Silvia is a nurse. Mr. Isidro began working in carpentry 30 years ago. He learned this trade from a family friend when he was very young. This mentor taught Mr. Isidro how to make professional carpentry products. As he came of age, he began working as a professional carpenter out of his house. Day by day, thanks to the help of his family he has been successful.

Mr. Isidro has asked for a loan to buy a compressor, which would both save him time and lessen his workload. With this machine he would be able to provide better quality products.

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman W. lives with her husband, Nyoman Tunas. To fulfill the family's daily need, Nyoman Tunas works as a contract labor with uncertain income. To supplement her family's income, Ni Nyoman W. sells traditional Balinese snack. She learned to make the snacks from her parents. She buys ingredients from the local market. To support the business, Ni Nyoman W. wants to obtain loan from DINARI Foundation. Besides funding assistance, Nyoman W. also obtained training. She earns $3.30 daily which is sufficient to fulfill her family's daily needs with her husband.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Nyoman W. sekarang hanya tinggal dengan suaminya yaitu Nyoman Tunas.Untuk memenuhi keperluan keluarganya Nyoman Tunas bekerja sebagai buruh yang pendapatannya tidak tetap. Untuk menambah pendapatan dalam keluarga Ni Nyoman W. tidak tinggal diam dan hanya mengandalkan suaminya. Dengan segala keterbatasanya yang dapat dilakukan hanyalah membuat kue tradisioanal Bali. Pengalaman ini diadapat karena sudah terbiasa membuat sendiri bersama orang tuanya sejak dulu. Bahan baku didapat dari pasar. Dalam menunjang usahanya Ni Nyoman W. mendapat pinjaman dari Yayasan DINARI. Selain pinjaman dana, juga memperoleh pembinaan-pembinaan untuk memajukan usahanya. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat dari usahanya mencapai Rp. 30.000,- dalam sehari. Ini semua cukup untuk memenuhi keperluan sehari - hari bersama dengan suaminya.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, e.g. flour, sugar

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly I. Quiroga de Rengel is the owner of a beauty salon. She is a hairdresser and her business is located in the area of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. She started as a cleaning assistant, then as a styling assistant, and slowly she learned the business. Currently Nelly has taken hairstyling and refresher courses in Argentina. Her business currently has what it needs to provide a good service to her clients, and she also has two assistants that work in shifts, thus helping her give a better attention to all her customers. Nelly will use the loan to buy new furniture and fixtures for her business, since all her current furniture has already used all of its useful life, and she needs to have new furniture and fixtures in order to better serve her customers during the high demand of the carnival season.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly IIlanes Quiroga de Rengel, es dueña de un Salón de Belleza, ella es peinadora, y su negocio esta ubicado en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. Hace mucho comenzó como ayudante de limpieza, posteriormente como asistente de estilismo, y poco a poco fue aprendiendo el oficio. En la actualidad Nelly ha aprobado importantes cursos de actualización y estilismo en la Argentina, Actualmente el Salón cuenta con todas las comodidades para su clientela, además de contar con dos dependientes asistentes, que trabajan por turnos, colaborando para una mejor atención. Nelly precisa de dinero para poder renovar todo el mobiliario de su salón, tomando en cuenta que el tiempo de vida util del que actualmente posee ya se ha cumplido, y es urgente preparar todo por la demanda existente principalmente ahora que se acercan las fiestas de los carnavales.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and fixtures for her business.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
K. Firuz is 33 years old. He is married with two children.

Firuz has a shop where he repairs jewelry and also makes jewelry such as earrings, rings, and bracelets of the oriental style. He has been in business for more than 15 years. Mr. K.'s business is quite stable and generates considerable income for his family.

Firuz is going to purchase the equipment required for producing jewelry items of the oriental style. For this purpose he has requested 2 000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) which he will repay over 6 months. This is Firuz's first loan and he would like to thank everyone for thier trust and support and he promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing jewelry supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Leokadiya

texts.en:
Leokadiya is a seasoned entrepreneur from the city of Stryi in the beautiful western part of Ukraine. She has been self-employed for twelve years as a market vendor and has gained much experience and knowledge along the way. Leokadiya currently sells a selection of household and toiletry supplies. She is constantly renewing her inventory and takes her business very seriously, working hard to ensure its success. Over the years, she has also been able to help a few other people start businesses. One of her goals for the future is to be able to buy her own store facility.

Leokadiya has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory, including bathroom gift sets, to sell in her kiosk. Profits from her business will allow her to continue to support her family – she is married and has two children, a son, 25, and a daughter, 21, who is in college – and will help her pursue her entrepreneurial goals.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory including bathroom gift sets

loans.name: Sarah's Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 23 years old and is a single woman. Sarah owns a small salon, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Afsa, Farida, Baia, Yunnis and Anitha, who have businesses of a salon, shop, cafe, clothes sales and vegetables sales.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery is an enterprising woman whom in conjunction with her husband decided to sell CDs every Sunday in the commercial markets around their local area. This all began when she received a relative’s advice to occupy herself with this business activity. Mery’s ambition is to be able to establish a business site where she will be able to sell the products daily. In order for the business to continue growing and her merchandise stock to continue expanding, Mery is asking for a loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Mery es una mujer emprendedora y en compañía de su esposo decidió vender CD’s todos los domingos en las ferias comerciales que se dan en su localidad. Todo empezó cuando ella recibió la recomendación de uno de sus familiares a dedicarse a este negocio. El anhelo de Mery es poder establecerse en un local donde pueda diariamente vender estos artículos. Para seguir creciendo y aumentando su mercancía Mery solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to improve her supply

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey C. works as a tailor from her house and can make around $2 per day. She has a sewing machine and provides service to people in her local area. Her husband is an English teacher and makes around $4 per day. They both live in Sophy Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. 

C. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle to use in her family, especially for her husband to go to work. The loan allows them to reduce their family expenses while commuting to work. Her husband said that he wants to offer additional educational courses to teach students to use computers. After successful repayment of this loan, he will request another loan to purchase a computer for his teaching business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in her family, especially for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella I. is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuff. She has been in this business since 1996. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Edith Shony

texts.es:
Shony is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. Each day she works using her talent to prepare meals, for this reason, each day she prepares several diverse menus and supplies her clients, who are usually drivers and bus collectors of a transportation line, whose stop is very close to Shony’s sales place. She wakes up very early to prepare her meals, she offers breakfast and lunches. She has also stock her small restaurant with sodas and pates, now she has a great challenge because there are more places that offer food, competition is stronger every day. Shony has always liked to work, wishes a better future for her family and wants to open a grocery store in the future to increase her profit. She will invest the money on buying supplies at wholesale prices and stock ingredients she uses in the preparation of her menus.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Shony tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Cada día trabaja utilizando el talento que tiene para la cocina, es muy hábil para ello, por esa razón, cada día cocina variados menús y abastece a sus clientes, que por lo general son chóferes y cobradores de una línea de transportes, cuyo paradero es muy cercano al lugar de ventas de Shony, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus alimentos, ofrece desayunos y almuerzos. Adicionalmente a esto Shony ha implementado su pequeño restaurante con gaseosas y pastelitos, ahora tiene un gran reto, ser más competitiva, ya que existe otros establecimientos que ofrecen comida, la competencia es cada vez más exigente. A Shony siempre le ha gustado trabajar, desea un futuro mejor para su familia, por ello, quiere a futuro abrir una bodega para incrementar sus ganancias. Invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para abastecerse de los ingredientes que ella utiliza en la preparación de sus menús.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and items to elaborate her food dishes / Compra de los ingrediente e insumos para la elaboración de sus platos de comida.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 26 años y es madre de 2 hijos quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, también tiene a lado a su esposo Walter quien es rematista de plátanos y siempre le da la mano en lo que puede.Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio es el que apoya en el sustento económico de su familia, y para brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario para sus estudios,  esperando que en un mañana lleguen a ser personas de bien.Delia desea ampliar su negocio, comprar más productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Delia logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Delia is 26 years old and mother of 2 children who are her reason for living and continue fighting to be successful. She also has her husband, Walter, at her side, and he is a banana harvester and always gives a hand when he can. She sells groceries and basic needs products, and this business is what supports this family economically and provides the children what’s needed for their education, hoping that one day they will be successful. Delia wishes to expand her business, buy more food products, and above all improve the structure of her home, so she needs capital to complete these goals. Thanks to your help Delia will be able to achieve her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her business and improve the structure of her home where her store is located

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel B. es una dama originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega el cual se dedica a laborar en el mercado central por medio de la venta de ropa y cosméticos comercializados todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta altas horas de la tarde.

Se ha destacado por ser una señora muy trabajadora que a pesar de los infortunios de la vida como lo es la crisis económica que ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante en la comercialización de sus productos.

La razón por la cual ha llegado a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar la mercadería como lo es la ropa y los cosméticos para su respectiva comercialización. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado ya que se ha destacado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado sus anteriores 18 créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.
texts.en:
Claribel B. is a woman originally from the city of Chinandega, who is dedicated to working in the central market through selling clothes and cosmetics in the very early hours of the morning until late into the afternoon every day. She stands out for being a very hardworking woman despite the misfortunes in her life, such as the economic crisis that she faced, but she has moved on by selling her products. The reason why Claribel came to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan with which she will buy merchandise like clothes and cosmetics. She waits confident that her loan will be granted since she has stood out as a loyal client who has repaid her previous 18 loans from Ceprodel on time and in a manner that was in accordance with the institution's established policies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: This group consists of twelve members from Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal Province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Navuth K. is 31 years old and the mother of two young children, five and two years old.  She is the village bank president elected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. She has a lot of consumers who need many goods. In order to satisfy these demands, Mrs. Navuth K. requests a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Noung Satja, is a driver.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en: Svitlana is married with two children. She lives in a small town of Storozhnytsya where she sells groceries and household necessities in a small retail store. Svitlana started this business 2 years ago. Because of her hard work, she has been able to offer more and more variety of goods and earn more income. She currently rents her store, but she dreams of owning her own little shop.
