She is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas (about $623) so continue to diversify the goods she sells and build more income towards realizing her dream.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Рахима Дехконова женщина 36 лет , портниха на дому имеет троих детей.Муж Рахимы на заработках в России.Она сама также занимается откормом и продажей скота.В основном Рахима откармливает скот а продаёт у неё её брат ,т.к. это мужская работа.Пока скот дешёвый Рахима хочет закупить пару больших дойных коров.Чтоб иметь своё молоко. У Рахимы есть свои постоянные клиенты по пошиву платьев.
Рахима когда начинала кредитную историю имела всего одну корову , а на сегодняшний день у неё две коровы и пять баранов.Она благодарит инвесторов за такую возможность для расширения бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Rahima is a 36-year-old woman with three children. She works out of her home as a dressmaker. Rahima's husband has gone to work in Russia. As a sideline, she also fattens and sells cattle. Usually Rahima feeds the cattle for the market that belong to her brother, because that is man's work, but while the price of cattle is down, Rahima wants to purchase two large dairy cows of her own for the milk. Rahima has regular customers for her dressmaking business. At the time of her first loan, Rahima only had one cow, but today she has two cows and five sheep. She is grateful to the investors for the opportunity to expand her livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is a seamstress and also sells tailoring materials. She is requesting a loan amount of $625 (N90,000) to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. It will help to boost her income to take care of her family, and also improve her delivery times to her customers. She is 52-years-old and is married with six children. Her husband is a civil servant who does not receive a salary from the government. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en la casa que compraron hace varios años. Se dedica a la venta de comida que prepara en su domicilio con el apoyo de su hija, quien trata en lo posible, de ayudar a su madre por las mañanas, pero de todas maneras hace falta de otra persona, pues para distribuir los menús tiene que tener un ayudante, pero no cuenta con un presupuesto para contratar un personal. Es así que se levanta muy de mañana para preparar los alimentos, lo que le toma un aproximado de tres horas, para luego salir al medio día para repartir a sus clientes. Esta actividad le toma toda una mañana y en las tardes se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su domicilio, lo cual es más descansado, pues no tiene que trasladarse, sino solo estar muy atenta a la llamada de sus clientes. Con el paso del tiempo desea tener un restaurante  donde pueda vender bebidas y comida a la vez, sin tener que hacer grandes recorridos por la ciudad. Eusebia viene trabajando en MFP hace un año, este es su segundo préstamo, lo cual le ayudó a  acrecentar su mercadería, y a relacionarse con otras personas, además, siendo la presidenta  tiene muchas responsabilidades dentro de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunas ollas y utensilios que necesita para aumentar la cantidad de comida que prepara para sus pensionistas, los cuales cada día son más.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 57 years old and lives with her husband and her four children in the house they bought several years ago. She sells food she prepares in her home with the help of her daughter, who helps her each morning. She could use an assistant to help distribute the food but does not have the budget to hire additional personnel. Therefore, she rises early every morning to prepare the food, a task that takes approximately three hours. Then she leaves at noon to deliver the food to her customers and this takes up the entire morning. In the afternoon, she sells beverages from her home, a more relaxing activity since she does not have to transport them and only needs to be on hand for her customers’ calls. In time, she wants to have a restaurant where she can sell beverages and food at the same time, without having to travel throughout the city. Eusebia has been working with MFP for a year, and this is her second loan. It has helped her increase commodities and network with others, in addition to being the president of the communal bank, with its many responsibilities. With the funds requested, she will buy pots and utensils needed to increase the quantity of food she prepares for her retired customers, which grow in number each day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and utensils to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas quienes cursan estudios superiores. Para incrementar sus ingresos económicos tuvo que irse de su país a forjar un futuro prometedor, pero la crisis económica le obligó a regresar a Perú y en poco tiempo implementó un restaurante, el cual apenas tiene 6 meses de funcionamiento, pero ya tiene gran cantidad de clientes, lo cual es resultado de la exquisita sazón que posee la esposa de Jaime, pues ella es la autora de los diversos platos que ofrecen, mientras que él es quien atiende a los clientes y lo realiza con mucha alegría y respeto. Así trabajan juntos todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, tiempo que disfrutan compartiendo sus actividades como pareja. Los sueños de esta familia es tener un auto para realizar sus compras y en los tiempos libres Jaime pueda trabajar haciendo taxi con la finalidad de tener ingresos adicionales. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contento por la oportunidad y confianza brindada, pues este dinero le da la posibilidad que crecer en su negocio. Con la cantidad solicitada comprará algunos utensilios y mesas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Jaime is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters who attend university. To increase his income, he left his country trying to forge a more promising future, but the economic crisis forced him to return to Peru. Soon after, he opened up a restaurant that, even though is only six months old has attracted a large number of costumers. This is mostly due to the seasoning that Jaime’s wife makes. She is the one who prepares the delicious meals and Jaime attends to the costumers with respect and joviality. They work together every day from 8am until 10pm, sharing the work as a couple. One of their dreams is to have an automobile to carry the supplies they purchase for the restaurant and, during Jaime’s free time, to use it as a taxi to generate additional income. This would be the first loan with MFP and Jaime is very happy for the opportunity and trust. The loan would give them the chance to grow along with their business. He will use the loan to buy utensils and tables for the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and tables for his restaurant

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. is a 56 year-old mother of five. Her husband is a farmer. They live in a village situated in the middle of the vast rice land of San Jose, Antique, the capital town of the province. Two of her children got married after their secondary education. The couple has no capacity to send the two to college because their income is not enough to support it. 

However, when she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) she got capital to start a new venture. Soon after, she was able to send two of her children to secondary school and one to elementary school, hoping to support them until college. She applied for this loan to buy assorted foods for her variety store to sustain its operation and to keep her regular customers. She dreams of saving enough money to get a stall in the market.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store

loans.name: Reyna Pascuala

texts.es: Reyna Pascuala G. R. de 48 años de edad reside en el municipio de Tamanique, vive junto a su hijo y su nieta de cuatro años de edad. Como toda mujer soltera, ella debe trabajar arduamente día con día para poder seguir adelante, Reyna posee un comedor el cual esta ubicado en una de las playas más hermosas del país la cual es en la Bocana del Palmarcito, debido a que vende a precios muy bajos posee mucha clientela, la cual llega día con día a degustar sus platillos. Reyna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos y de esta manera poder brindar más variedad a las personas. Su mayor anhelo es poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que la única ayuda que posee es la de un hijo el cual vive en Estados Unidos y le ayuda con $50 dólares, es por esto que ella desea aumentar sus ventas, para poder mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Reyna Pascuala G. R., 48, lives in the Tamanique municipality with her daughter and her 4 year old granddaughter. Like all single women, she needs to work arduously every day to be able to get ahead. Reyna has an eatery on one of the most beautiful beaches in the country in La Bocana del Palmarcito. Because she sells at very low prices, she has a lot of customers who come every day to enjoy her dishes. Reyna is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes and offer greater variety to her customers. Her biggest goal is to increase her sales. The only help she gets is from a son who lives in the United States. He helps her with $50. She wants to increase sales to be able to improve her family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Grace A. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 14 and 25. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants while they are attending school in the area. Grace has been running a women’s shoes and bags business since 2006. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Grace currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shoes and bags. In the future, she plans to open another business. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags for her business.

loans.name: Shara

texts.en:
Mrs. Shara A. is 25 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a motor cub driver. She has been a member of Paglaum Coop since August 15, 2008 and has good performance in repayments. Currently, she's availing her third cycle of loans in the amount of PHP7,000.00 for additional capital for her existing business which is a sari-sari store.
This loan will be used to expand her business in order to have more income. She dreams of sending her children to school and to finish their studies.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Don Ramón is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He has been an entrepreneur for more than four years. He owns a small workshop where, with the help of his wife, he makes leather belts, bags, and shoes. He also travels around selling various merchandise such as jeans, shirts, shorts, shoes, etc. He has more than 300 clients with whom he constantly works according to their needs and orders.

Through this activity he is able to provide the basic necessities to his family, as well as funding his children’s education.

loans.use: purchase of jeans for women and men, and leather for making belts

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
T. Gloria is a hardworking and principled 30-year-old lady who, for three years, has had a merchandise shop as her business where she sells mostly home-consumption commodities. She is a married lady with three children aged 6, 3 and 18 months with only the eldest in kindergarten. She also cares for two orphans.

Previously, Gloria used to operate from Ryamatumba trading centre but now works from Bwaise in Kampala where she is able to make weekly profits of 100,000 shillings. She says that her level of cleanliness attracts more customers and she has a dream of owning a wholesale store as well as having all her children finish school. She needs a loan to be able to purchase merchandise for resale since her loans help to expand her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mr. Nut C., age 72, and is a modest father of three children, two are married and one is single. His wife stays at home to be responsible for housework. Nut C. is currently a cultivator, growing vegetables and fruit to earn a living. Another source of family income comes from his children who are working in different occupations; two are silk skirt sellers and one works in Phnom Penh. Nut C. saw that his children’s selling silk business is a profitable one for the family, so he decided to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a large quantity of silk skirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of silk skirts to sell.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is 21 years old and is married with one child.  She works together with her mother selling cold drinks such as soda, beer and juices.  Yuri’s husband is an independent businessman.  

Yuri has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a year and a half and is a member of the communal bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles in purchasing drinks for her business and will do the same with this loan of 1200 soles.

Yuri dedicates herself to her business full-time and is grateful to Manuela Ramos for showing confidence in her business by giving her loans.  Thanks to her loans, Yuri is moving forward with her business.  Yuri’s goals are to have her own business locale (a soda fountain, for example) and to study cosmetology.

loans.use: To buy more cold drinks for sale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine M. is 36 years old and married with three children aged 18, 17, and 12 years. All her children go to school. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in an urban area. She incurs extra transport to and from shopping.

Christine deals in onions from Owino market which is one of the busiest markets in Kampala and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people 6 days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus school fees.

Christine has been with MCDT for 5 years servicing her 12th loan, working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock of onions. Her major challenges are the ever increasing prices and heavy rains during the rainy season. Her aspirations are to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en: Arvin B. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. He is 21 years old and is married. Arvin owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services used to transport passengers to local communities. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Arvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Mary Rose and Giovani A. are a young couple who are raising their family in Barangay Tuao, North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 22 years old and  her husband is 24 years old. Neither of them finished college because they married at an early age. Their parents help them because they don’t have a stable source of income. It is difficult for them to find jobs because they did not graduate from college.

Her husband wants to work in construction at Bagabag Nueva Vizcaya. Mary Rose sells food in their village while taking good care of their two young children. She started the business with only PHP 2,000 (~ $40 USD) in business capital. She now earns a net income of PHP 500 each week which they use to pay for their daily needs. 

Mary Rose wants to have additional business capital to develop her food vending business. For this reason, Mary Rose would like to borrow PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders. She believes that she can earn a higher income and save for the future of their children with this loan.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking. She is 37 years old and divorced with three children. All her children are in school. She is supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business. She has two years of experience selling but progress has persistently been slow due to insufficient funds. 

She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a profit that is more viable. She wants to purchase bulk quantities of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk quantity of Dumas clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. has been a member of ASHI since 2007. The loans she has accessed since then were the main source of capital for starting and sustaining a business. The proceeds of her hog fattening (pig raising) and her buying and selling of 'nipa' (palm leaf) shingles are her family’s main source of income. Her husband’s income being a farmer is still very small and sporadic and is used to supplement the basic needs of their three children, aged from six to 16 years old. All are studying and Josephine wishes them to continue their studies until graduating from college.

For now, Josephine is patiently waiting for her businesses to grow. She tries her best to maximize the profit she makes out of her businesses though it is still small. With loans she receives through ASHI, she believes that eventually her business will be successful and she will be able to bring her family out of poverty and that they will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: a large quantity of 'nipa' shingles to sell and  piglets for hog fattening

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is a 36-year-old married mother of two children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the Western Region of Ghana. Most residents practice farming alongside other trading activities. 

Afua is a food vendor. She prepares and sells wheat with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells by hawking in the daytime in her community. Afua buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for 11 years and wants a loan to procure bags of wheat and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of wheat in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Teresita  C. Pascual Group

texts.en: Teresita C. P. is from the village of Mocag Baggao, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Teresita is the group leader of an 11 member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Teresita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desde hace 1 año atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Wilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar chuño, habas, cebada.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar dos vacas lecheras para expandir su negocio.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las reuniones.
texts.en:
Señora Wilma has been a member of the San Juan village bank for the last year. It is located inn the far edge of the district and province of Yunguyo and the department of Puno. She is 26 years old and is married with four children. She finished highschool and began buying and selling grains. Her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles so she could increase her capital and buy chuño (dehydrated potatoes), lima beans and barley. She has requested a loan for S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles with which she will buy two cows and expand her business. She dreams about having her own home and for her children to be professionals in the future. Her favorite thing about her village bank is the savings account and how punctual their meetings are.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is a young Palestinian man, 23 years old, who is married with one child.

Arafat owns a grocery store in addition to working as a cook in a restaurant that caters for big events like weddings and when some one has passed away. At such big events, the family provide food for all those who come to pay their respects or to join the family celebration. Gathering around the lunch table is very important in Palestinian tradition for such big events.

Arafat requested 2,000 USD to expand his grocery store and to buy new goods for the shop.

Sometimes, while Arafat is working in the restaurant, his brother stays in the shop. Arafat appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mr. S. is 26 years old, single, and lives with his mother in Phnom Penh city. He works as a driver for a private language school and earns a specific salary of $180 USD per month. S. normally takes a taxi or walks to work. He wants to have a vehicle but does not have sufficient funds to buy one. He is therefore requesting a Kiva loan to add to his small amount of savings to buy a motorcycle to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. El se dedica a la venta 
de ropa en forma ambulatoria hace mas de 1 año aproximadamente. Cuenta con ingresos 
adicional por su trabajo como obrero en un fundo agroexportador, es ayudado en el 
negocio por su sobrina cuando esta laborando. La mayor parte de sus ventas son al 
crédito, con lo cual obtiene una mayor rentabilidad, su negocio ha progresado desde 
que se inicio y con el cual ha obtenido un pequeño ahorro para la compra de una 
mototaxi y así tener otro ingreso extra; ya que su sueño es poner una tienda de 
venta de ropa en el centro de la ciudad y para la cual requiere una mayor inversión y 
esta trabajando para que ello sea en un corto plazo. Es una persona responsable y con 
un trato muy cordial por lo que cuenta con regular clientela. Cabe mencionar que el 
crédito que esta solicitando lo requiere para completar el dinero para la compra de su 
mototaxi.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 25, is single and lives in his parents’ house. He has been selling clothes as a traveling salesman for approximately one year. He gets additional income as a workman in the agro-exporting field. His niece helps him in the business when he is working. Most of his sales are on credit, which gives him greater profitability. His business has progressed since he started, and he has some small savings to buy a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) in order to have extra income. His dream is to set up a clothing store in the center of the city. In order to do so, he needs bigger investment. He is working in order for that to happen soon. He is a responsible person. He treats people very cordially, and that is why he has regular customers. He needs the loan he is requesting to augment the money he has to buy a mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Henry Augusto

texts.es: Henry M. habita en el barrio Carlos Núñez de la Ciudad de Managua, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad  y uno que aún no ha nacido, ya que su esposa está embarazada. Su esposa es abogada y trabaja de forma independiente. Henry  trabaja como contador en una empresa de medicamentos. Hace algunos años adquirió su casa en este barrio y poco a poco le ha ido haciendo las mejoras necesarias para darle comodidad a su familia. Este crédito será usado con el mismo propósito,  construirá una habitación, ya que actualmente tiene sólo una habitación en donde comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra. Espera en un futuro poder seguir invirtiendo en su hogar para así dar a su familia toda la comodidad necesaria.
texts.en:
Henry M. lives in the Carlos Núñez neighborhood of the city of Managua. He is married and has two children, aged 5 and 3, as well as one child on the way, since his wife is pregnant. His wife is a lawyer and works independently. Henry works as an accountant in a pharmaceutical company. A few years ago, he acquired his house in this neighborhood, and little by little he has been carrying out the necessary improvements to make his family comfortable there. This loan will be used for the same purpose; he will build an additional room, since the house currently only has one bedroom. He will purchase construction materials to start work on this project. In the future, Henry hopes to be able to continue investing in his home and thus giving his family all of the comforts they need.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding a room to his home

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is a 24-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop for six years. A special feature of his work is that he knows how to treat his customers. When Sari first started his business, he experienced some financial issues. He decided to set up his business because he wanted to have independent work, he had learned the skills in an academy and he had good practices. He was confident that thanks to his experience and networking, he would be well known and it would allow him to increase his clients who are his friends and neighbors.

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to further improve his work.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Lizar

texts.en:
Lizar J. is 28 years old and married to a businessman. They have two children who go to school. Lizar sells charcoal and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits her loan will bring in, she hopes to be able to open a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Edwin esta casado, tiene 32 años de edad y viven en la casa de sus papas, el Sr.  Edwin se encuentra casado con la Sra. Lucy con la que tiene 3 hijos, dos que se encuentran en edad escolar y uno que es pequeñito, la señora Lucy es cliente antigua del Banco de Emprendimiento Bolivia ya trabajo con este banco en varias secuencias.

El Sr. Edwin tiene como actividad la atencion de un restaurante con el que ya esta mas de 8 meses en funcionamiento, el mismo que queda ubicado en su mismo domicilio, el restaurante se abre a partir  trabaja a partir de las 12:00 horas hasta las 24:00 horas, el crédito solicitado está dirigido a la remodelación y refacción de la cocina del restaurante. El Sr. ofrece a su clientela una variedad de platos es un lugar muy concurrido ya que elaboran platillos riquisimos, Su esposa y el sr. Edwin quienes elaboran los platillos tienen muy buena sazon y estan muy contentos con los ingresos de su restaurante.

El Sr. Edwin esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin is married and 32 years old and he lives in his parents' home. He is married to Ms. Lucy, with whom he has three children, two are in school and the third is still a babe. Ms. Lucy is a long time client of Banco de Emprendimiento Bolivia [Entrepreneur Bank Bolivia] and has worked with this bank for several loan cycles. Mr. Edwin's activity is a restaurant that has been working for more than 8 months already. It is located in his own home, It opens from 12:00 to 24:00 hours. The loan he asks for is meant to remodel and remake the restaurant's kitchen. Mr. Edwin offers his customers a variety of dishes. It is a very sought after place because they make delicious dishes. His wife and Mr. Edwin, who cook the dishes, have a good hand cooking and they are very happy with the income the restaurant generates. Mr. Edwin is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they show in granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelling of restaurant's kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lando

texts.en:
Lando A. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Lando owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Lando has been involved in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Lando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lando is requesting his third loan, for 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Auxiliadora María

texts.en:
Auxiliadora is a 24-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Turrialba, Cartago, a tranquil mountainous region located near the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Auxiliadora lives with her sister and mother in an annex of the store which the family has been renting over the past 2 months. Auxiliadora and her 21-year-old sister, Angelica, have 5 years of experience managing  a store in San Jose; however, they have recently moved to Turrialba as a result of the separation of their mother and father. 

The sisters have been working tirelessly from 5:30 AM to 7:00 PM Monday to Sunday in their new store to get it off the ground. Auxiliadora says her sister is better with numbers, so Angelica does all the calculations and determines the prices of products. Although this loan is in Auxiliadora´s name, the two really work as a team, and Angelica will have significant input into how this loan will be used (especially since she´s so good with numbers).

In their store, the sisters offer everyday products that you might find at your average corner store: instant soups, potato chips, juices, ice cream, kitchen appliances and milk, among other products. As you can see in the picture, inventory levels are low. Auxiliadora and her sister plan to use this loan to invest in more inventory and also to purchase a fridge to keep refreshments cool. 

Auxiliadora´s short-term goal is to make the store more profitable, increase income and improve living conditions for her family. The income generated from the store's sales combines with the monthly salary that her mother earns as a domestic worker, which amounts to 90,000 colones (180 USD,) as the family's only sources of income. Rent is 30,000 colones per month, not including electricity and water costs. With respect to the store, Auxiliadora hopes to earn enough profits in order to one day be able to purchase the store and the house the family is currently renting (the house and store are attached). 

Both Auxiliadora and her sister are taking night classes, 3 hours every day, in order to complete high school. When they aren´t busy managing their store, they do their homework. The sisters hope to graduate from high school within the next 3 years. Angelica mentioned she would like to go on to university and study accounting.

Auxiliadora and her family face some challenges. The rent payments have become difficult to make, as a result of low sales levels as of late. Auxiliadora is confident that this loan will give her the injection of working capital she needs to turn the store into a better income-generating activity. Another obstacle has been local groups who attempt to break in and rob the store at night. The sisters don´t seem deterred by the robbers, though. Auxiliadora says ¨we have 2 dogs and an alarm, and the police come if the alarm goes off.¨

When asked if they enjoy this type of work, the sisters both replied yes. Angelica says, ¨it´s better to work for ourselves.¨

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and inventory items

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a young lady who is 26 years old and married with three children aged 8, 4, and 1 year. She is also charged with contributing towards the welfare of the family. They live in Teddy's own house, which she has been able to build with her husband. She wants to educate her children in good schools. She operates a retail shop in Karuguuza, Uganda and has been in the business for the last three years. She hopes to grow the retail shop into a bigger one and increase her sales. This is her eighth loan and she will use the loan funds to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap for reselling in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap for reselling in her shop.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 3  est issu de l’Association  de femmes mariées du village de Dah Manakina de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans,  5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
Hawa Dembélé, la présidente du groupe envisage utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 3 group is issued from the Association of married women of Dah Manakina, a village in San prefecture, Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 30 years of age and 5 children, and they grow peanuts. Eager to make their farming businesses profitable, the members of the group decided three years ago to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. After having repaid the previous loans without problems, they are now seeking their third farming loan. Hawa Dembélé, the group's president, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers, at the grand market in the city of San. After the rainy season, her crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Dah, San, and at other markets in the surroundings. She sells retail, and often wholesale, for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities. After selling their farming products, the members of the group intend to turn a profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 75) each, to be used to repay the loan and pay the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora G. is 43 years old and a resident of the village of Landing, Baliangao. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Dioscora has engaged in farming for more than 13 years. It is their primarily source of income.  She earns approximately 2000.00 a month out from it.

In 2004, Dioscora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioscora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Dioscora is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase home appliance. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Dioscora from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a home appliance
